title: You can but you don't have to
text: First of all, 300.- is debited from your card, of which a daily cleaning fee of 20 dollars is charged. So far, so good. When we arrived, the room was not clean, there were obvious tufts of hair and other things in the shower. The general condition of the room is rustic and old. After we complained that it was not clean (after all, you are paying for it), a cleaner came who did not speak English and was only equipped with a kind of vacuum cleaner; cleaning products and rags were not to be found. She used her hands and feet to show where it was dirty, and the bed covers were not clean either. Despite this, I still had to "clean" myself because it was not done thoroughly. You can save yourself the free breakfast. The ambience and the selection are minimal and not inviting... a few bagels, muffins, yogurt and above all everything in and with plastic (I have never seen such a bulky and unloving "buffet", for this price range you would expect a bit more variety). The hotel is in a central location, you have to be aware that everything is extremely thin. The doors to the rooms don't even go all the way to the floor and so you can hear everything. When the cleaner didn't come by one day, we were indirectly accused of lying because we apparently didn't take the door sign away (which we did). An employee then said that the cleaner wouldn't lie after all... we left it at that. At least there was a refrigerator that worked. There is also a ramen restaurant and a sports bar, which we didn't use. It was enough to sleep in (although everything was very thin) but for a comfortable stay with good service, I can't recommend it.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: I am truly pleased with my stay, the friendly staff, rooms are very clean, lobby smells amazing. One important reason is pet friendly!  I will definitely come back. Is a great location, is close to transportation.

title: EXCELLENT time at this hotel!
text: Right in the middle of all things GREAT in NYC, quick walk to cool galleries and cafes and gems in Lower East Side, inexpensive delicious food in Chinatown, and the luxury of Soho...all right there! The staff were so helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome and well looked after.

title: Honest Aussie
text: Hotel is in a very easy location to the subway. Easy access to Chinatown & Little Italy, which we much preferred. Hotel is dated and rooms are small but clean. Onsite restaurants and bars are great, breakfast options very boring if staying for more than 3 nights. Bagels, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and hard boiled eggs. Sounds like it’s enough, but not for 10 breakfasts day in & out like us. And it is a compulsory fee. They mention this like an added bonus.$20USD a day for a breakfast I did not want. Staff were absolutely lovely, not their fault that we were stung with the extra charge upon checkin. I think the hotel now mention the extra fee when booking, but we booked in February and there was no mention of this in any fine print, so hence it dipped into our holiday money. We came from Australia so the extra USD$180 converted to around AUS$300 for us. A lot!!  The area is a little noisy but I think maybe the whole of NewYork is noisy, that’s what makes it exciting. I would stay again, but after really comparing my options dollar for  dollar, if something was available for the same price with a better breakfast or some extra bonus, I’d take the other option.

title: A Great Stay
text: We were displaced with  3 cats due to a fire in our building . Through the Red Cross and the city, they accepted us into their hotel. Worn out, distressed, confused and worried, the front desk Abigail & Justine never made us feel like victims and treated us like people. They were so courteous to us and we felt welcomed from the day we walked in. Kumarie was so kind to us, she provided us with a smile and a laugh when she brought us towels and asked if we needed anything else. Even under the sad circumstances, we had an excellent stay.

title: Wonderful stay, super awesome and attentive staff!!
text: We came here for Chinatown Chinese New Year celebrations and my son’s birthday.  It was a wonderful experience at Wyndham. The staff are wonderful and so attentive to our needs. We loved staying here and would absolutely be coming back here for years to come. Particular thanks to Justine, Sean, Elliott, Swuan for the memorable visit. Thank you thank you thank you for a great experience!!!

title: Lack of attention details, wouldn’t stay again, noisy and smells old.
text:
First impressions look nice, never got refilled of coffee and creamer each day or water. It was on and off and really felt that was lacking detail. 

Noisy air conditioner in room so had to have it off, which meant room was freezing cold to sleep in unless you want a heavy air con sound. 

Shabby tiles and bathroom. Always had fresh towels but again lack attention to details with the daily clean. 

Brown smelly carpets in rooms that look dated and definitely brought out allergies for me and this is Feb so not summer allergies but something else. 

While housekeeping didn’t refresh coffee and milks and still came in to room daily, blows my mind ! Do you not have a check list to make sure everything is done this happened multiple times on my trip. 

This is not a quiet hotel, the house keepers chat and laugh very loudly at 8am outside your rooms as if we should all be awake at 8am.  Even tho every room has do not disturbed signs showing! 

The doors all slam shut loudly so if your neighbours go in and out constantly it gets very draining with the slamming. 

Sadly I haven’t enjoyed this stay based on lack of attention to daily details and the overall rundown look and antique shop smell you get from old furniture I the rooms. 
Not cosy and probably the noisiest hotel I’ve ever stayed

title: NYC - Lower East Side, Enjoyable Stay !
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights in room 404, it was a large double room. 
Clean, LED Tv, coffe machine, fridge, iron, safe etc etc
The shower was awesome !
There’s a good bar on the street level with a ton of TV’s to watch sports on. Huge selection of beers on tap. 
There’s another bar / restaurant on a higher level, I didn’t visit it unfortunately. 

My room was taken care of by the lovely Kumarie.

title: WYNDHAM Garden Chinatown
text:
Nice hotel, nice neighborhood!
The housekeeper “Kumarie” was so nice and kindly with us!
You need to book at the WYNDHAM Garden Chinatown! 
Also the restaurant “Shinka” was good too.
BEST experience in this city!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Perfect stay and view to NYC
text: Really great service of the team of Nina Kelly, room with exciting view to the Empire State Building which we enjoyed especially every morning and every night. When we come back to NYC, we surely will stay in the same hotel again and will recommend it to our friends.

title: Shimmering Skyline
text: Excellent views and a wall of windows, literally.  Very expansive and soothing. Go for the executive level rooms and be happy and smug while you relax in bed.  Even the bathroom affords a view.  How many hotels can claim that?

title: Very convenient hotel with very friendly staff
text: The Wyndham Garden is very conveniently situated close to Subway stations and bus lines. The staff were extremely friendly, especially in the Beer Garden. Nice view from the room. Price-quality was good. The rooms are a bit dated, but very clean.

title: The staff is great and makes your day
text:
Great Wifi, free water and coffee and a very nice location.
But the best is the staff form cleaning lady, till front desk.
The staff from the front desk is the best, always friendly and there to help you with everything. Don't know all there names but a shout out to Nina and Sushma who where so nice!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
I was impressed with the rooms and the cleanliness. The lobby was welcoming and the staff was excellent. They were able to assist our large party with fast and early check-in. If you are planning for a large group I recommend speaking with the sales director Sean Sy. He made the process very easy. 
I definitely recommend this location if you are in the Manhattan area.

title: Great Accommodations and Service
text: This hotel was a great choice for our group. The rooms were very comfortable, and the service was excellent. Sean Sy, the Director of Sales, coordinated the room assignments, and Nina Kelly at the front desk handled check-in expertly. I've never seen the process go so swiftly and smoothly! After our long journey to NYC, it was nice to be greeted so warmly and to find everything ready for us. It was a great location, walking distance to our events, too.

title: Excellent service
text: I had to make changes to my reservation last minute and they were very accommodating and helpful. I bothered them several times with my questions and received nothing but patience and kindness. Thank you!

title: AMAZING STAY!!
text: I visited a family member in Manhattan at Christmas and from the second I stepped into the lobby of Wyndham Garden, I was Impressed! Front desk was INCREDIBLE! Always friendly! Victor hooked me up and SWUAN was amazing and So attentive! The room was as a good size for NY, the bathroom was big with Hot water, and what an awesome view! Very MUCH recommend! I Will stay again!

title: need improvement
text: Room lightings need to improve, a bigger recessed light is more appropriate, the current small size is not suitable to light the whole room. Desk lamp too dim did not provide enough lighting for the desk. Bathroom shower glass did not prevent water to run out of the shower, it floods the whole bathroom, sink area don't have counter to hold anything. The room entry door sill is too high, tripping going in and out. The small TV framed in is not necessary, remove and install a bigger tv and replace the frame with a mantel for guest to put stuffs on.  Welcome guests with 2 bottles of water when check in would be nice, no need for every day of stays. staffs were very friendly, and professional.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: We liked the location, being about 300 metres from a subway station and near Mulberry Street.  The room is comfortable enough, if a little outdated.  The bed we had was comfortable.  We quite liked the views towards the Empire State Building that we had from our 11th floor room.  The gym while small, is functional.  The in-house Shinka Ramen Bar serves excellent food.  My main complaints are about the dim lighting in the room - very poor, the WiFi was patchy - it was a lottery as to whether it would work properly and the idea of not having a full door on a shower is a nonsense - the floor next to the shower and base of the toilet became flooded after even a brief shower.

title: I have stayed here many times.  This was possibly my worst hotel stay anywhere ever.  Ventilation system pumped smoke in
text: This property claims to be smoke-free but in fact the ventilation system pumps smoke into the rooms as if someone is in the room smoking while you’re there.  I let the front desk know each of the times daily it became an issue and although they changed my room to another, their ventilation system continued to pump smoke into our new room as well.  The problem was there during all 5 days of our stay.  The first room’s thermostat was malfunctioning as well, so it was constantly hot in the room. Staff did not communicate well with each other, so even though I had a late checkout scheduled, they still came knocking to ask when I was checking out.  I was very unimpressed with my stay, with the staff’s communication and responsiveness to issues and with the general condition of a property with “Smoke Free” rooms.  Very disappointing.

title: Acceptable
text: Decent enough hotel. Was clean and bed was comfy.  Personally,  I wouldn't stay there again, just because it was a little out the way. Nothing really stood out for us to make it an amazing stay, but given we only slept there, it did the job

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff!
text: Room was clean and comfortable.  Location was great for us.  Right by Chinatown and Little Italy.  We could access parks, multiple subway stations, and lots of great food!  Staff was polite and friendly! Would definitely stay again next time we come to New York City!

title: Excellent overall
text: The incredible room we had, on the 15th floor, with the best views of the entire city, spacious, comfortable, clean, with the necessary accessories in both the bathroom and coffee maker. We would choose it again.

title: Great stay
text: Titus was the highlight of the stay. His customer service was great, awesome smile and communication skills. Room was clean, with water and coffee provided. Great view, the lobby area in a welcoming feeling. I will be back.

title: An Positive Conference Experience at Wyndham Garden Chinatown
text:
We recently had the pleasure of organizing a conference  at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown hotel in New York City. We were thoroughly impressed with the hotel's facilities, accommodations, and service, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a venue for their next event.
The Our point of contact sean was really helpful and helped us to deal with last minutes problems.

title: Great stay and Wyndham Garden Chinatown
text: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, the cleanliness was impeccable, and the central location made exploring the city a breeze. The room was comfortable and well-appointed. I highly recommend this hotel for a memorable and convenient stay. Kudos to the outstanding team!

title: Early check-in les than 1 hour Charged (!!)
text: Whenever after a 10 hour flight someone tells you # room is ready thats fantastic news….even if its only 50 minutes - its still great to have a quick shower……well NOT in the Wyndham Chinatown….they insist upselling 30 $ for an early ( read 50 minutes ) check-in….I spoke to the manager - rules of the house….fine : my rule —-> take my business elsewhere !

title: Great hotel service and beautiful city view
text: 10/10 clean, showers were nice pillows were fluffy and staff was great. The balcony view was perfect. No noise complaints and free refreshments in the lobby. The location is great for budget shopping and cheap food.

title: Ridiculous Front Office
text: This is exactly how you would line to be welcomed @ your check-in - after a 10 hour flight …..your room is ready (!!!) …….. ah …. But being early 55 minutes is an additional 30 $ …… seriously ????  Is this how Wyndham tries to please it’s customers ????? Slamming them with 30 $ for a room that’s ready ???? Doing 200 nights a year - just reminding myself that Wyndham is off the list ! Better hotels and especially services in many other Hotel !!! Wyndham never again

title: Don’t do it y’all…
text: Outdated room and poorly and designed maintained bathroom. Proximity to Chinatown, subway line, and views from higher floors are only saving grace. Fixtures in bathroom rusting, and need updating, peeling walls and celiling. No exhaust fan or complete shower door/curtain in bathroom. Messy every time you use shower and creates sauna.

title: Clean and Comfortable
text: The room was very clean and comfortable. Location was great for our purposes, and we had great maid services daily, which is unusual in these post-Covid days! We have stayed here before, and would stay again.

title: Accused Us of Taking a Tray and Charged Us $60 Without Proof
text: Location and room was fine. Would’ve recommended the place, but they charged us extra $60, bc head of housekeeping (a bit of a jerk when trying to hurry us out) INSISTS that we stole a tray. We didn’t

title: Great hotel, just book it
text: Great location and a great value, stop reading the reviews and just book it. The room was well laid out and roomy (for NYC). Loved the floor to ceiling windows and the fact that the window opened (a rarity in the city) and the above average hairdryer provided in the bathroom. Unfortunately we were not able to take advantage of the food/drink options on site, but they looked very nice. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice, helpful and professional.

title: Can’t wait to do it again
text: This day was so amazing I came for my birthday and I was looking for something that was semi-affordable with city views and I found this gem of a hotel. They kept my luggage as I explored the city all day and upon check-in they surprised me with a room upgrade for my birthday and this was the view. I can’t express how amazing it felt to be enveloped by the city! It’s not the closest to subways but there is so much to see on the walk to them that it’s not so bad! The bed was so comfortable and waking up to Manhattan was like a dream.

title: Great stay near Chinatown
text: I had a really comfortable stay. All the staff were really helpful and nice. Nice gym, good location definitely recommend staying here when you’re in New York. Super centrally located. I had a great time.

title: every staff is nice!
text: We hold our business meetings on the 17th floor. The view is spectacular, and the enviornment is comfortable. The staff has been incredibly patient and helpful. Sean and Marisol assisted us with arranging the table settings and ensured that our needs were met before the event.

title: Exhausting stay
text: I was very disappointed. My first night I was practically suffocated by strong Glade smells being poured into my tiny room all night long, until fortunately I was able to find and unplug it next morning. The room was too hot with the heat on or a bit cold without it but there was no way to make myself comfortable. Gym was also boiling hot.  The noise insulation is insufficient and trucks in the street would wake me continuously starting 4:30 am. Everything in the room is cheap plastic and the hotel doesnt even leave a recycling bin. Awful.

title: Great location and professional service
text: This Wyndham hotel is in the heart of Chinatown.  It is just a block away from our church Oversea Chinese Mission.  It is not just the good location that we love to book this Wyndham hotel for our speakers.  It is the great service and clean environment.  Sean Sy and Nina are very professional and helpful whenever we need to book the place.

title: Wyndham garden
text: Prima hotel in Chinatown, op loopafstand van Little Italy en metrostation Grand Street.  De Rooftopbar geeft een fenomenaal uitzicht over de stad, maar de drankjes zijn er schreeuwend duur: meer dan 30,- voor 2 borrels. Douches zijn goed warm - maar niet echt heet te krijgen. Servicegericht personeel.

title: Ubicación poco segura
text: El hotel en sí no está mal, aunque la zona no es demasiado segura por la noche. Por parte del hotel no pueden hacer nada ya que es algo que no depende de ellos, aunque a modo informativo creo que debería saberse.

title: Chinatown Jewel
text: Very conveniently located, this 3+star beauty is super clean, featuring comfortable beds and soft, soft pillows in an average-sized room. The subway system is a short walk away; buses stop across the street. Don't miss the view from the rooftop bar - it's spectacular.

title: Such an amazing stay!
text:
This hotel was on point with everything.  The front desk staff was excellent.  This  location was so close to Little Italy and Canel street, which was great since we came for the Feast of SanGennaro.  Our room was so comfortable and relaxing with a coffeemaker and a refrigerator.  The coffee provided was delicious.
 Our housekeeper Kumanie was amazing, and kept everything so clean and organized.  It was so nice to have a cleaning staff who actually interacts with you and you don't have to keep asking them to maintain your room.  We will definately be returning and will reccommend this hotel.
Thank you and keep up the good work.

Notes:
Visit the Roodtop 93- Great atmosphere, music and service
Visit the Bowery Beer Garden- Good food and drink selections
If you need a taxi service to or from the airport, set it up with the hotel.  They use a driving service that is professional and reasonable.

title: No internet access
text:
The room was not ready at 3pm.  Need to wait for half hour to check in.   

The wifi did not have internet access. Although have excellence signal, unable to link to the web.

The card reader was not working on the date I checked in.  However, hotel refused to accept cash, that caused to waste a lot of time.

title: Best place to stay with a large group
text:
It's always a pleasure to work with this hotel when our production team comes to town for work. Sean is a wonderful manager along with is team and they go the extra mile to make us feel especially welcome. If you are trying to navigate the logistics of room coordination, Sean and his team have your back. They are very organized and make the booking process super easy when booking multiple rooms. 

Aside from being a comfortable place to stay, the hotel is central to lower Manhattan/Chinatown, easy to access most subways, and within walking distance to anything you need. 

We've been staying here for the last couple of years and would not have it any other way. I also highly recommend the Ramen restaurant hidden in the back.

title: nightmare hotel
text: this hotel needs a complete overhaul starting with the lobby if it want to be a four star hotel they should look like one I spent my 3000 points for a nightmare hotel I think just because it was in New York there parking was also a block away and for a women walking the street late at night it didn't seem safe

title: Great Location, clean comfortable rooms and friendly efficient staff
text: Great location - convenient and safe and bustling. Hotel rooms are clean, comfortable and pretty roomy for NYC rooms. We had a corner room with a great view west and north. Staff very friendly, helpfu and efficient - not just to me but with everyone. Location is great for lower Manhattan and subway is short 2 blocks away. Parking lot is around the corner so just build in dropping off your bags at your room with car on curb and then drive it over to drop it over. Parking attendents were also friendly and efficient. We would return.

title: Family wedding
text: My nephew was getting married and my family all stayed here. It was close to all the locations we had to go to. Plus we got the wedding discount. This was a great bonus that my nephew got for his whole family.

title: Clean and comfy in a great location for a good price
text: We enjoyed our stay at Wyndham Garden Inn Chinatown. We chose it because it was one of the few hotels where my teenage son and I could have separate beds in the same room for under $300 a night. The location couldn’t be more convenient, it’s close to several subway stops and the hotel itself is in a sort of overlap zone between (or at least within easy walking distance to) Chinatown/Little Italy/NoHo/SoHo. Uber was also a viable option for a lot of trips due to the convenient location — prices weren’t too crazy to get to Lower Manhattan or Midtown. The staff was kind and helpful and the noodle shop on the first level has AMAZING food and drinks at really low prices by Manhattan standards. Our room was meticulously clean and the beds were very comfortable. The glass bathroom enclosure wasn’t my favorite, though — not enough privacy, even with the frosted finish — and the cabinet enclosing the (VERY SMALL) minifridge was broken, which looked shoddy even though it didn’t prevent us using the fridge.

title: Parfait pour découvrir New York
text: L'accueil est chaleureux, les chambres confortables, la localisation excellente pour prendre le métro ou le bus. On est directement dans Chinatown et à 3 mn à pied de Little Italy, pratique pour le shopping et pour le soir. Et la vue sur la ville depuis la chambre est une bonne surprise.

title: Excellent experience.
text:
Sushma at the front desk went above and beyond with her customer service.  She assisted with advice on parking, loading/unloading, and with finding particular places. 
The rooms were spotless and very comfortable. Newly remodeled. Excellent view. Highly recommend!

title: One Week NYC
text:
Gutes Hotel in toller Lage.
Zimmer und Badezimmer waren groß und sauber.
Joe war sehr nett und hat uns trotz Verspätung freundlich und schnell eingecheckt.
Generell war das gesamte Hotelpersonal sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend.
Einziges Manko wie bei fast jedem Stadthotel: wenig Licht im Zimmer und wenig Ablagefläche.

title: A découvrir sans hésiter
text:
Placement idéal pour se rendre sur les sites à visiter , bus et métros à proximité. Très bon accueil.  Personnel très chaleureux.
Le petit + qui mérite d'être signalé , les chambres doivent être libérées à 11 h toutefois si le vol retour est à 21h ( dans mon cas) l'hôtel se proposer de garder les bagages en consigne et ce , gratuitement.

title: Wedding party, 17th floor venue
text: We rented the venue on the 17th floor for a wedding party. We had a great event. The staff was super helpful and we felt well supported. The venue had a spectacular view and the sunset was amazing. All of our guests took pictures, instagram posts etc all night. We were very happy with this venue and we highly recommend it !

title: Try somewhere else for the money
text: The staff was very nice but that is all there is to recommend about this overpriced hotel. We stayed a lovely week at The Belvedere in Times Square for less than $200 per night and had a huge room that was quiet clean. The Wyndam was the exact opposite. We moved there for a single night and paid $350 and was charged an extra $30 for a 2 hour early check in (...and the room was not ready when we arrived). We asked to microwave some food as was told there was a $20 charge for a microwave.  The room faced the noisy street. It had a glass bathroom door providing zero privacy. The room was incredibly noisy and small and for the price and location totally not worth it. If I had to do it again, for the money I would have stayed at the Belvedere in Times Square and simply Uber'd to Chinatown for our wedding there.

title: Clean, nice room, great service.
text: I had two separate bookings (one from a 3rd party). I arrived in town past midnight and Joe at check-in was able to combine the stays and upgrade my room. Joe and the rest of the staff were able to make my trip a breeze. The room had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building AND the WTC (corner unit). The room was clean and had everything in it. Elevators were prompt. Internet was fine for video calls. I'll definitely stay here again.

title: Holiday
text: Kumarie was our housekeeper and she was PHENOMENAL! The room was immaculate, she brought us more milk when we needed and the bed was sooo comfy! Will definitely be staying again! The staff at the front desk were also very friendly and went above and beyond!

title: Chinatown Darling
text: Great location. Comfortable room. Nice restaurants close by. You can walk to Little Italy in 5-10 min if you want a change of scenery and cuisine. The staff were so courteous and helpful. Especially Kimberly and Nina. I would stay there again in an NY minute. Highly recommended.

title: Great views of midtown and good location
text: This was a comfortable place to stay in lower Manhattan. It was easy to get around from here. I paid extra for an upper floor with view and this did not disappoint. Beautiful view of midtown including the Empire State Building. The decor is a little dated but nothing terrible. Bathroom was a good size. Some light noise (e.g., sirens, horns) occasionally from the street but not too bad. quick check-in. Overall, a good stay!

title: A very satisfactory experience
text:
Everything was perfect . A proffesional team ,esp. Miss Tiffany,with clean rooms and superb views of downtown.The neighbourhood was quiet and in the heart of Chinatown.Rooms were done everyday and supplied with soap ,shampoo,towels etc..
A chinese supermarket and a bakery just crossing the road.
They also offer a transfer to the main  airports at a decent price.
We honestly recommend it.

title: Great views of New York
text: The rooms on the 15th floor have a great view of the city. They also have a balcony, although we didn't use them much. My only suggestion would to have chairs on the balcony. Room was clean and we enjoyed coming back every night.

title: Excellent
text: I stayed at the Wyndham with my family and we all loved it. We were upgraded to a superior room and I accidentally left a substantial amount of money in the safe, which was promptly returned to me. This act of honesty puts my opinion of this hotel even higher! Great location, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms. Great views from room on higher floors!

title: Perfect Location, Great Service!
text: The location is excellent for Chinatown, Little Italy, and SoHo!  We stayed her during July 4th week.  The Wyndham Garden Chinatown was clean and felt very safe.  Room was nice and clean and your very own restroom! Hotel staff was great, from front desk, cleaning crew, and restaurant/bar employees.  Short walk to subway station.  But we usually took the longer walk to the Canal St station.  Would definitely recommend staying here and would definitely stay here again, next time we visit NYC!  Thanks everyone at Wyndham Garden Chinatown.  Oh and being where it is, you have endless places to eat and shop!

title: Nice place to stay near Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho
text:
I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Chinatown/Little Area. It is reasonably priced for NYC.

The bathrooms were larger and better appointed than I would have expected with a nice walk in shower.

If you are looking for 2 beds, I believe they only offer twins, which was fine for me and my son.

The front desk staff were friendly and helpful with storing our luggage for pre check in and post check out.

I didn't experience any elevator delays, which can sometimes happen at other hotels in the area during busy times. If you ever had to go up in order to go down, you can relate.

There is a beer garden on the first floor and I believe a rooftop restaurant and bar.

title: Clean rooms and friendly staff
text:
Our recent stay combined comfort with friendly service in a unique neighborhood..

The rooms were clean. The bedding was very comfortable.

The hotel's meeting space was well-equipped and had a great view of Manhattan. The group sale manager took excellent care of us. His  efficiency and professionalism ensured that everything ran smoothly.

title: 5 stars ⭐️
text: Our cleaning lady was the best. She attended us all the time, rooms cleaned everyday and very friendly. Is the best hotel I’ve stayed in NY until today. I recommend Whyndham Garden 💯. Thank you Kumarie for helping us all the time we were there

title: Perfect stay
text:
Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean! We had an amazing view from the 16th floor- at night it was spectacular to see the city all lit up. 
 The check in was warm, quick and welcoming. They will hold your bags if the room is not ready so you can venture out and enjoy the city. The hotel is right in china town so- for blocks there is so much to take in- street vendors and amazing, interesting food. Lil Italy is a few blocks away. The walk at night felt safe and we did not encounter any negativity. There is a lounge on the upper floor with craft cocktails, nice vibe, great service and great view.  Good water pressure- very clean bathroom. Our stay was literally perfect!

title: Great Stay, Amazing View - definitely coming back!
text:
Clean hotel in a good, safe neighborhood! I was traveling solo so definitely didn’t want to be in a dodgy area. This was so conveniently located, a few blocks from amazing Chinese food. 5 mins away from Little Italy and Soho area! Location is just too good. Plenty of subway stops around. 

I was not expecting much of a view from my room, being that this is in downtown, but the view of the midtown skyline from my room on the 16th floor was just breathtaking! 

The best part was that the staff were so accommodating and sweet! Sushma and Nina (concierge) made sure my stay was pleasant and were very helpful with all my inquiries. Will definitely stay here again, and bringing my family next time!

title: Room not ready?
text: The hotel and location of the hotel is pretty nice but here is why 3 stars.  We arrived at 2:45 granted 15 minutes before check in and room was not ready.  Okay, but they took all my info put our bags in the back and said it would be 15 to 20 minutes, so we decided to walk around China town and little Italy.  We arrive back after 4 pm, we give our slip for our bags and she hands them to us ... and I say we do not have a room key.  She said oh ... you don't okay.  She finished hecking in the person who was there before us (mind you that person DID NOT have a reservation but was handed a key and she headed to her room.   I had to give all the information I previously provided at 2:45 and then was told our room was NOT READY??? so we did not have to wait long but what the hell.  Anyway room was nice and comfortable, but really needs more light quite dark.  Overall location is very good and hotel is fine but seriously was not a good first impression and get some more light in the room

title: Gem
text: The property was significantly better than most hotels I've stayed in at very reasonable prices. I expected a tiny room with limited towels and hot water and I was treated to splendid views, ample space (for NYC) and a spotless room

title: Nice Location Bad HVAC
text: Clean hotel in a great location for a good price. The only negative is that the AC doesn't work well. We had to open the windows for cooler air. Staff is really friendly and the rooftop lounge is nice, but a little small.

title: WORST HOTEL IN NYC, VERY WORST, SCAMMERS
text: THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IN NYC. PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE,  THEY ARE A COMPLETE SCAM. I BOOKED A 1NIGHT STAY FOR MY GF BIRTHDAY UNFROTUNATELY I CAME DOWN WITH COVID.  I CALLED THEM THE A DAY BEFORE TO CANCEL MY RESERVATION BECAUSE I HAD COVID AND THEY TOLD ME THE MANAGER WAS NOT THERE TO APPROVE IT. HOTELS.COM SENT THEM AN EMAIL TO REFUND MY MONEY AND THEY STILL DID NOT RESPOND. THEY STOLE $400 FROM ME FOR SOMEWHERE I DIDNT EVEN STAY. AND I PAID EXTRA FOR THE ISNURANCE INCASE THIS HAPPENS. AND THEY STILL SCAMMED ME, DO NOT BOOK THEM, DO NOT GO HERE, SCAM ARTIST AT NY'S FINIST.

title: Pleasant stay and great value.
text:
Surpassed expectations for sure. I was not sure what to expect since Chinatown is not exactly known for having good business hotels, and the price was low by Manhattan standards. Very pleasantly surprised. Location is great - very short walk from.Grand St Metro and just a few minutes more is Canal St Metro. It is adjacent on a main road, easy access.

Rooms are spacious by NY standards, clean and the quality of furnishings is pretty good. Lots of food and beverage options. In all, excellent value for money.

title: A good place to visit Manhattan
text:
The hotel is footpath zu lower Manhattan. The room was not large, but very clean, each day we got a lot of fresh towels. Our room in the 11 level was quiet
The staff was extraordinary friendly and helpful.
In the neighborhood is little Italy for good italian food.
We can recommend this hotel

title: Just ok!
text: The hotel was clean and in a decent neighborhood for what we wanted to do while in New York.   We did have some issues with the room and the staff just said sorry.  The TV and deadbolt didn’t work.  Each day the staff just said sorry.  Not, we will have someone look at it or fix it, just sorry. Finally the last day they fixed it.  I would say an average stay with poor service.

title: Affordable option with great views!
text: I was struggling to find a place in Manhattan that would fit my budget. Was nervous about this hotel but was more than pleasantly surprised! My room had a gorgeous view of the mid-town skyline and I loved all the great food options on my doorstep. The subway is less than two blocks away making access to the city easy but it was also a nice walk. Staff were great and the room was very comfortable. Would absolutely go back again!

title: Big recommendation
text:
I had a very pleasant stay! Our room for 3 was huge and had a beautiful view over Manhattan. The bathroom was a little bit small for 3 persons but we were still happy with our room. 
We stayed at the Wyndham with a bigger group and we were warmly welcomed and well taken care of. We even had the opportunity to use the spacious meeting room, which had a magnificent view and an adjoining terrace.
The location was also great. There were many restaurants nearby and it was also not far to the next metro station. Overall I was very satisfied and would come again.

title: Charlotte Group Trip
text: First time in NYC, great service, clean rooms, and overall a great first experience. Everyone was very welcoming and accommodating despite having a large group of people. If/when I come back to NYC, definitely going to stay here again.

title: Great location. Good value.
text: Wyndham Garden Chinatown is in a unique location at the intersection of Chinatown and Little Italy. Walking distance to Williamsburg Bridge. The higher floor hotel rooms have great views. Hotel has first floor bar and top floor restaurant. Rooms are modern and clean. Depends on what your NYC plans are; it's certainly not close to the big tourist spots, but you can get anywhere with Uber, so if you like walking around Canal Street or into Little Italy and NoLita, it's a fun place to stay.

title: Great experience
text: It was a great experience. We really enjoyed our stay at the Wyndham Chinatown Hotel! We had an incredible view. Especially the staff was so friendly and helpful. i would recommend to stay here to anyone. We will surely come back for another trip.

title: China Town with a view
text: All staff have been so amazingly friendly with us. The Hotel is 4 Stations with the Metro from the center. Two metro lines just in front of the house (3 minutes). And especially the roof top bar was great.

title: Lovely Hotel and Generous Manager
text: Absolutely lovely hotel. The service was above and beyond! The manager of the hotel went out of his way to support our study abroad group. It was so nice to have a personalized letter to welcome us! Para todos que quieren quedar en un hotel que es seguro y limpio yo recomiendo esta!

title: Loved It
text:
The view and full wrap around balcony was amazing! They have the best response and service times and the hotel is located at a central point in the city! I can’t wait to come back and continue to explore the city’s 
Sydney UNCC

title: Great experience
text: The hotel was clean & quiet. The staff was kind and accommodating for all our needs. The hotel is located in a great location- very close to all the sites we wanted to see. I would recommend staying here for all trips to Chinatown.

title: Great time
text: Nice room with an interesting design. Had enough room for the family. The bath was interesting, but felt weird due to no door to seal the shower. Overall the room was nice and the staff was very helpful.

title: Chinatown come casa
text:
Buon albergo in zona strategica abbastanza vicina al centro di Manhattan e alla downtown. La camera che avevamo aveva una vista bellissima sullo skyline della city e abbastanza in alto da poter attutire i rumori della strada che sarebbero altrimenti veramente molesti. Pulizia dell’hotel ottima e gentilezza del personale sempre all’altezza.
Una stazione della metro a 100 metri, little Italy per un pranzo decente a pochi passi (100 metri).
Da segnalare vista l’assenza di una formula con colazione, un locale di nome Gemma a circa 800 metri sulla Bowery direzione nord dove poter gustare una colazione sublime.

title: Everything was perfect. We will return here when visiting New York.
text: We booked a group of rooms at a group rate  for my family and friends at the occasion of my son's wedding in Chinatown NY. Everything was great,. We were all very happy with the accommodation. Management of the hotel was very attentive to our needs. Very convenient location in Chinatown. Good value for the money.

title: Staying in Chinatown
text: Our stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was lovely.  The staff were so accommodating, friendly, and always willing to assist where required.  The rooms were clean, spacious, and well appointed.  We would definitely stay here again - it's close to everything; subway, shops, Chinatown, and Little Italy, and a short walk to Broadway and Ground Zero.

title: Nice view
text:
Very good hotel at an affordable price. Our room was ok, with a magnificent view on New York City. Staff was helpful and nice. The location is ideal for tourism, near Brooklyn Bridge, Little Italy, Tribeca.

Caution: you must inform the staff that you want your room to be cleaned every day

title: 1泊なのに3泊分請求された。
text:
Agodaで予約し既に宿泊料金（1泊）を支払い済み。にもかかわらず宿泊代金を2泊分をHOTELからVISAに請求されていた。おそらくDepostiで1泊分をチャージし、Refundするところを再度また請求したのだろうと思う。
が、これはあまりにひどい。日本帰国後に連絡をし、2泊分をRefundするよう行ったがApologyの一言もなかった。みなさんも気をつけてください。日本人は英語ができないので大変だと思う。

title: Business trip
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights, attending an event.
Sushna with Front Desk was nice and helpful!
Location is great. Easy access to tons of restaurants and metro station.
I didn't encounter any issue with A/C, hot water also worked perfectly.

title: VERY COMFORTABLE AND PLEASANT HOTEL
text: During a recent visit to Manhattan, my wife and I booked a room for one night on the 8th of April and for three nights on 22, 23 & 24 April 2023.  One of the reasons we had book this hotel was that it was only a 20-minute short walk to my daughter’s apartment located in East Village.   The hotel is located on the busy thoroughfare of Bowery in the heart of Chinatown and very close to SoHo and Little Italy.   We had a king size bed in our somewhat small room; which had a small fridge and safe.  The bathroom was very adequate with a nice powerful shower which was great.  On our one-night stay on the 8th, we were on the 9th floor; on the later 3 nights we were on the 9th floor.  The hotel overall was very clean and bright and although our window overlooked the side street (Hester), we had to close the window at night due to some of the noise on the street.   The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and went out of their way to meet any of your needs.   Since we arrived at the hotel from the airport around 0900 am on the 22nd, the hotel staff allowed us to store our luggage until we were able to check into our room at 3 pm.  Overall, I have no complaints.  We did notice that on our 3-night stay, the maids did not come into our room to clear or change the towels.  The bed was very spacious and comfortable and overall, it was a very enjoyable stay.

title: A good choice
text: Located on th edge of Chinatown and within walking distance of SoHo and Little Italy, the Wyndam offers a clean, comfortable setting for most people.  With its two restaurants and roof top bar, it has special appeal to young professionals.  Our room had two twin beds, a small dresser between the beds, a desk, a chair and an amoire.  The room itself was small and furnished with just the basics.  However, the desk had some personal items you may have forgotten.  The water was very hot and very cold.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  In fact, they create an atmosphere of caring.  Just don't ask them to book you a taxi.  They get car services.  Use the Curb app created by the City to schedule your transportation up to a day in advance or immediately!

title: Great experience but . . .
text: My overall experience was excellent but I had a terrible encounter with a security guard from an outside firm who questioned whether I was trespassing and then hurled a racist slur at me when realized I was indeed a guest. Of course, , other guest who were standing with me waiting for the elevator did not have the same experience. Beyond that, I was over satisfied.

title: Bad expereince: no aircon the 1st day; no TV channels above 9; no working wifi; hot water in shower barely adequate
text:
The air conditioning was not working when we checked in on an 86 degree day. It was supposed to be fixed the following morning. When we left the hotel we were told it had been fixed. It wasn't. We had to move rooms, and it took that room about 6 hours to cool off.  I was told the problem initially was with the whole building, and then it was just our room. 

The WiFi did not work properly the whole trip. We were able to connect to the WiFi but its internet connectivity kept cutting off. I was told I had to authenticate in my web browser but that never came up on any of our 4 devices, in spite of trying multiple times by "forgetting" the WiFi SSID and re-connecting. Not my first rodeo using hotel WiFi, but this problem was a first. If I absolutely needed WiFi for a laptop I would have been in serious trouble. Fortunately, we had cellular data.

The TV did not work for channels past 9 (although I mistakenly told the desk the problem was channels above 6). That was never fixed. I suspect it may have been related to the internet issue.

The shower hot water in the room we moved to was barely adequate when turned to full blast. Probably an issue with the tap because the hot water was fine in the first room. I didn't bother to mention this because I had given up thinking anything would get fixed. 

That said the staff was very friendly. 

Rooms very small, but it is New York and the rate was reasonable. Second room not well configured: no night table or plugs on one side of the bed. 

We will definitely  give this a pass - and possibility any other Wyndham -  next trip.

title: Could have been great
text: This hotel stay could have been really good - many aspects of it were. The location was great, the staff were wonderful and attentive, and the suite was roomy with comfortable beds. The wifi was incredibly poor - cutting off every 10 minutes. This was a minor problem. The major issue was that the air conditioning couldn't keep up with the temperature. It ended up being in the high 80's during the two nights we stayed and our room temp ranged from 73-78 degrees (being the hottest at night). It was impossible to get a good night's rest and it negatively impacted our trip. The staff were kind and said that they were aware but - reading through past reviews, it's clear this issue has been going on for a long time.

title: Great events team
text: This review is for a private event hosted at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown 17th floor event space that the in-house kitchen also catered. Sean, Preston, Jessica and the rest of the F&B team were excellent to work with over the last two months as I planned a milestone birthday event. They were highly responsive and respectful of my family's unique needs. The event was extremely well-received by my family and friends, and everyone enjoyed the Italian rustic buffet! The 17F floor event space has wonderful views of Chinatown and lower Manhattan, and the terrace space is wonderful.

title: Friendly staff and nice rental spaces
text: Staff was friendly and accommodating with their rental space. We didn't do catering or overnight rooms, but the staff gave us plenty of attention and had the rooms ready for all 8 of our sessions. We met over the course of a few months and didn't have to check in or remind them of things throughout. Good location for small business meetings!

title: Cómodo
text:
Es un hotel cómodo. Tener en cuenta que no limpian la habitación… sólo si lo pides (y te miran mal). El wifi del hotel es horrible… pagamos una habitación superior y no nos dieron una habitación común. Diciendo que no tienen habitaciones superiores (mentira). 
El metro está muy cerca, donde te pones a 15 min del centro. A escasos minutos también de la zona 0 y el distrito financiero.
Te cobran 50€ únicos por depósito, eso es algo muy positivo aquí en Nueva York

title: Good stay!
text: Tiffany at the front desk was the best! She was helpful with checking in and any questions we had during our stay. The room was very clean and the location and view were amazing! The only downside was that the a/c wasn't working, and it was in the mid 80's during our trip. It would have been nice to be informed of that, we had to ask. Our room got up to 80 degrees. The fan function of the a/c helped a bit, but only on one side of the room.

title: Great service, clean rooms, good location
text:
Great service. Our shower pressure was off and the water wasn’t hot. But this was resolved within a day. The friendly front desk staff sent Jerome who was cheerful and efficient in fixing our shower. Great guy and helpful staff overall. 

Clean rooms. Size is decent for 2 people, but not more. 

Excellent location. Chinatown has yummy and cheap food.

title: Great place to stay - Fabulous staff
text: I very much enjoyed my 9 night stay at the Wyndham Garden hotel in Chinatown, Manhattan. The best thing about my stay was the staff. I want to give a big thank you to Nina Kelly for her warm and heartfelt help on a number of occasions. And being the guest service supervisor, I know that she has inspired all of the staff. And, in particular, I also want to thank Sushma and Tiffany.

title: Good service, excellent location
text:
Positive: Clean rooms, excellent counter staff, comfortable bed and good bedding. Location can't be beat. Food all around. Convenient to many sights. Subway entrance close by. Nina(?) made us feel welcome on check-in and was helpful througout our stay.

Negatives: Shower splashes and gets bathroom wet, older building and rooms could use freshening up.

Overall, I'd stay again.

title: Good Experience!
text:
This hotel was really good for the price. Upon arrival, the lobby smelt great and the check-in was easy.

The location was great. Both are easy to walk where needed and accessible to the subway. I would recommend Kodawari Coffee, Vanessa’s Dumpling House, and Black Seed Bagels. There are many other delicious options nearby too!

The room was pretty clean and the beds were comfy. A portable noisemaker will assist in a good night's sleep! The 11th floor has a great view! The only major complaint was the design of the shower. There is no sliding door so the floor got wet easily.  There is also no complimentary breakfast or microwave in the room but there is a fridge and a coffeemaker.

There are 2 elevators which took a little bit of time. We were told that housekeeping would not visit the room daily and that we would have to request it.

Overall - I enjoyed the stay. A great “home base” that I would visit again!

title: A pleasant surprise
text: I arrived at the Wyndham by accident, my reservation was for the Windsor, but, as I was told, they were doing renovations. I enjoyed my stay at the Wyndham very much and would certainly like to repeat it on my next trip.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nice hotel to stay in. The room was smaller than what I anticipated,  but being that its NYC, it makes sense.
Overall the room was clean, comfortable, easy access to subway and staff was nice. Recommend the hotel.

title: Amazing
text:
Nice staff, confortable room.
Safe neighborhood with a lot of subway stations pretty close.

We loved. ❤️
shower was good, amazing bed and a incredible view.
We would love to come back next year with our parents.

title: Great hotel
text: We had a great experience from check in to check out. The room was just as advertised and the view was exactly what we wanted. (We paid the extra fee in order to receive the room on a higher floor.) Room itself was clean and comfortable. Distance is near the buses and metro stations which made it very convenient.

title: I loved the view!
text: The view from the 15th floor was amazing. Most of the hotel staff were awesome. The only thing I didn’t like was on the Friday of my visit, they closed the rooftop bar to the public because of a private party they had. I was disappointed that I had to go outside for drinks.

title: Diamond in the Rough
text:
Pros
Very clean, either new or recently updated, modern decor, pretty quiet area, nice views of the city, on-site restaurant. Considering the size of the room they were able to fit everything I needed in it. I thought the price was super reasonable for NYC ($187 for one night with all taxes and fees). The Shinka Ramen Bar is really good! See my other review on that.

Cons
Didn't seem like the best part of town to be in for someone traveling solo. I didn't feel comfortable venturing out after dark. Bathroom has one whole wall of glass, which was kind of neat, except it has a thin window covering and a frosted glass bathroom door - which combined caused night lights to shine into the bedroom. I ended up hanging some clothes over the door to somewhat shade it. I like my room very dark. Room was small but seemed average for NYC. Shower doesn't have a door that closes, therefore water sprays out of it, and you get kinda cold. It's a small sink area with very little countertop.

Just because my cons list is longer than my pros list does not mean I wouldn't recommend it. Everything I didn't love was pretty minor. I mostly would try to pick another area to stay in, assuming I could afford it.

title: Very good two night stay
text:
We stayed here for two nights this week for the 25th anniversary of our first date. We were on the 10th floor with a great view. This room given to us was upgraded. Everything was great with the room. It was clean and comfy. The only thing was the shower. Only had one door and the floor get wet when we took showers. Had to put towels down.  Had dinner the first night in the Beer Garden downstairs. The second night we went to Little Italy for some great Italian food. There were really no breakfast places close by so we ordered breakfast for both days from Grub Hub from a restaurant on Canal called Bosscat. Very good. 

All in all we enjoyed our anniversary stay!

title: A quick trip to NYC
text: Wyndham Garden Chinatown is a great place to stay. Close to everywhere, the room is clean, quiet and the reception lady (Tiffany) was friendly and very helpful. I also saw some not so good reviews in the past but I think this place is a lot better now than the past because of the new management. We recommend Wyndham Garden Chinatown and we will stay there agin in the future.

title: This property was rated entirely too high
text: The property is a horrible place to stay . The room were very small. The odor in the room was horrible. The room needs to be updated.The check in was extremely slow.It took almost a hour for me to check and I was the only one checking in.

title: Great location and value
text: My son and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Wyndham Garden. It is a no fuss hotel with small but cute basic room with a fantastic view of the city. Though a tad threadbare on some of the furnishings it was clean, felt very safe and secure, and was exactly what we needed for a short jaunt in the city.

title: Staff need to improve
text:
This hotel is in a cool area and near to subway station. The bed is comfy and the room a fair size.. however.. the staff need to improve.. a lot! 

On arrival the reception lady ( Tiffany) who had some good reviews here was totally overwhelmed and disorganized, after waiting post 3pm, the initial room issued was incorrect and she had to reverse the initial deposit and charge card again for deposit.. seemed like odd process.. but finally we got a room. 

Told that room cleaning service is on request only.. we booked the service daily and two days in a row no service received.. complained and excuse was house keeping lady didn’t speak English! She can’t read the service card!! But we booked at recep.. so that didn’t fly .. 

All in all ok stay and check out better but staff not great for a 4 star..

title: Great New Years Stay
text:
First time here and I’ll be back again
The place looks amazing inside and out
The rooms were nice and clean, the beds felt comfortable. I stayed in the 12th floor and had a great view of China town and the area around the hotel
Also it was in an area with amazing walking distance to multiple great restaurants and stores and all for an affordable price
The soaps were very cute it brought a smile to my face see it

The only few things I do wish was better would be the stand in shower because all though it looks cute with just a glass wall with the current shower head it had, water would get all over the place outside the stand in shower and make it a hassle to have to clean it up with towels
The second thing is, and perhaps it was just the room I was staying in but, the a/c did not cool down unless the window was open regardless on how low the temp was set
Also no microwave in the rooms, so don’t plan on bringing food back for later

But other than that guest services was amazing at helping me with an questions and the stay was very nice for 3 days and 4 night

title: my stay
text: friendly customer service. nice location. both China town and little Italy walking distance.  Other interesting area also not far from the hotel   I wish the bar stay open late, and parking is little cheaper than the current price

title: Excellent Staff makes for Excellent Stay
text: We had a fantastic stay, despite some minor issues both Nina and Mali at the front desk were always incredible and happy to help. Mali also made several excellent recommendations for local eats, especially for the fact that we arrived well after midnight our first night. I also want to shout out Larry from housekeeping, very kind and helpful too.

title: Great location, central to lots of fun
text: After reading hundreds of reviews before booking for our recent trip, my husband found the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and decided to book.  Staying with our son, our room had one king bed and one full so it was the perfect setup!  While we did not have tons of room to move around, the room was still very well appointed and even with all of our luggage, it wasn't as bad as other hotels we have stayed at in previously in the NYC area.  Yes the elevator provided some interesting challenges not wanting to go tot he 4th floor but seriously, it wasn't anything we were upset about.  And the boiler went out on the last day for the entire hotel but they were very accommodating in allowing us to stay a little longer until they could get it up and running.  Location for us was exceptional.  Just 3 blocks or so away from Chinatown and Little Italy.  Some of the best food there is to be had is within this area.  Breakfast every day for us was at the Kamboat bakery. Awesome enough we repeated daily!!  Nothing too heavy so we didn't feel the drag so early in the day but light enough to get moving.  When we go back, we will definitely stay here again.  It is too convenient not to!!!!

title: Nina at Wyndham Garden Chinatown was excellent !!
text: Nina at the front desk of Wyndham Garden Chinatown was absolutely lovely! I arrived after walking several blocks in the cold, rainy New York weather, exhausted, carrying luggage. I asked if I could check in a little earlier since I was soooo tired. Nina made some calls to see how quickly the room would be ready. I waited for maybe just 15 minutes, while Nina handled a busy lobby, but she still kept me updated about the room. She has an absolutely wonderful, sunshiny disposition, and is truly great at her job.  Coming from the south, travelers don’t know what to expect from people in New York—you know there’s all those clichés. But Nina was a breath of fresh air to meet someone so nice before I began exploring your beautiful, wonderful city!

title: A Great Experience
text: I was there for 7 nights and asked for the best room that they could do under the circumstances.  They did not disappoint.  I loved the view, the clean room, the responsive housekeeping and desk staff, and the location which allowed me to do everything I wanted to do in NY with safety and security assured.

title: In my opinion, not a four star hotel by any stretch.
text: Housekeeping still offered only on demand and even when agreed upon at check in,  a no show. One day without hot water, sketchy engineering. Asked for a light bulb to be replaced, never was. Asked to borrow a pair of censors, "not allowed". Except for the wonderful Nina, zero customer consideration. Never ever again.

title: Nina is amazing
text: Nina was so amazing dealing with check in issues, she has the most amazing attitude and gave some great recommendations on what to eat around the city and things to do! The room was clean and very quiet as well. When I visit again I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Queen sized bed with pull out couch
text: Stayed with 4 friends. It was a great size but really a waste of space. They honestly could’ve put 3 beds in there and it still would’ve been comfortable! Only issue I has was with one of the front desk workers but it was only because he really didn’t understand what I was trying to ask him. Just a language barrier but other than that great.

title: Solid hotel in Chinatown
text: The king upper-floor room was just what we booked and expected. 12th floor with no other tall buildings in front, so we could see all the way up to the Empire state and Chrysler bldgs, and Hudson Yards. Beautiful both day and night. Room was clean, bed comfy, small but comfortable bathroom with good hot water. Had drinks n apps at the beer garden downstairs, good nachos. Did not visit rooftop lounge. Location was good, steps to Chinatown (where we had Thanksgiving Dinner), next to Little Italy, Lower East Side, Soho, Greenwich Village, with all the tons of restaurants and shopping everywhere. We walked to the Whitney Museum in under 40 minutes, a nice walk. Still some street noise even on the 12th floor, but this is NYC, you just need to remember ear plugs if it bothers you. At check in the front desk told me where to get "discount" parking, which was still $55/day because it was "oversized" (Ford Maverick). I guess maybe that is a discount, but I think last time I paid for parking in NY it was about that. Oh well, you need to park in downtown Manhattan you better be willing to pay up. One tip about that: when we checked out they wrote stuff on our parking ticket to get the discount, but I didn't realize until later that it was the hotel that would charge for the parking, not the lot. Good for me the lot attendant didn't charge me, I would have paid twice! Nice hotel, good location, reasonable price (we booked using points so I don't have the exact price). Would stay again!

title: Gem in Chinatown
text:
I did a lot of research on hotels in New York, price was a big factor. Being a sole female traveller I wanted to feel safe where I was staying but also be close to all the sights in NYC.

I found the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, and read lots of reviews on different platforms including reviews for other hotels at a higher rate but found their reviews to be very mixed. I decided to just book Wyndham Garden Chinatown, I paid for 22/11/22 - 24/22/11 £268.00 inc. via Traveluro.

When I first got to Wyndham Garden Chinatown I had landed at 09:00 and walked from Central - Central Park, taking in as much of the city on my way down to Wyndham Garden Chinatown to check in at 15:00.

Mena at check in was really lovely and helpful, and not long after I had got to my room  

Rooftop93 - The rooftop bar. I popped up here on my last night to have a couple of cocktails, I was met with really lovely staff a female and a male. The were both really helpful and chatty which was nice as I was alone and it was good to talk with them. I had their signature cocktails: the  Bowery margarita and their Lycée Martini, both really good $18 each (£14.90). 

I enjoyed the great view the bar offer from the inside, I didn't get to go on the rooftop I didn't know it existed. I wish I had if it was open as from their Instagram page shows it has some great views.

I would've like this to be open for breakfast too. Maybe it was and I didn't know about it?

On booking the hotel I was asked if I wanted a particular floor / room... from some of the reviews I had seen that rooms next to the elevator could be noisy so I requested one away from this and also a high level. I was very happy to see I had level 12 and this was away from the elevator. My room had a great Westerly view.

The room itself was very clean, well kept, and comfortable. When I booked, the only rooms available on Traveuro site were accessibility rooms. M room had no 'hall/lobby' it was straight into the room. A huge frosted glass door,really big shower room, great if you had mobility issues. The only thing I felt the it was missing was a shelf to put toiletries on, I had to use towel on the towel rail to fashion my own to place all mine on.   

I would note; Traveleuro's shown check out time on my booking was 12:30 but told on the day by Wyndham Garden Chinatown staff it was 11:00 am was it was a good job I checked.

I would definitely return to the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, I enjoyed my stay!

title: Great costumer service from the night staff!
text: Mali was so nice and helpful! Really the best concierge person we’ve ever met <3 I don’t have much else to say, just that the night staff has been fantastic and made the hotel experience really great. Def will come back to this hotel just because of them.

title: Zimmer etwas klein- Top Aussicht vom Balkon
text:
Die Preise sind dem Niveau Manhattans entsprechend- aber das Zimmer nicht sehr gross.
Lage sehr attraktiv mitten in Chinatown. Die Aussicht mit der Skiline Manhattans und Blick auf das WTC ist genial.

title: Change of shower by Jerome
text:
We had an issue with the shower as the water wasn’t coming out properly for some reason. Jerome, the technician, was really nice and came very fast, he changed the shower in less than 10min and got us a very good customer service on top of producing us some adaptors for our chargers.
Thanks Jerome, we are very satisfied with your services.

title: Excellent hotel and service
text: My time at Wyndham Garden was excellent.  My room was clean, spacious with a great view of the city.  The location is interesting... right beside China Town and close to Little Italy so access to great restaurants.  Subways are nearby so getting around was convenient and affordable.  I recommend Wyndham Garden Chinatown

title: NYC visit
text: Overall, our visit at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was adequate and suited our needs. Beware that the rooms are very small, but I would assume that is the norm in NYC. Housekeeping does not come into your room unless requested. Parking was one block away and they took great care of our vehicle. My only complaint is that there really needs to be a towel bar in the bathroom. We were left to drape the towels on the bathroom door handle. The staff was curteous and friendly, and the view from our room was good.

title: Fashion Event
text: Thank you so much Mr. Sean and Mr. Hamza for the outstanding service and professional experience making my fashion business event planing process so easy and welcoming to my guests. Thank you for understanding my reasons of rescheduling the event and accommodating everything to make sure I was happy. This is one of the best Hotel experience I had in NYC! Thank you so much and I’m looking forward to continuing doing business with your company Wyndham Garden Hotel. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Chef Carlos Kings

title: DON’T STAY - NO A/C
text: DO NOT STAY HERE! The A/C does not work. The staff will lie to you about it and tell you to “give it time.” Their solution was to crack open a window and turn the A/C off. Like they thought we wouldn’t notice. Not worth the money. Again DO NOT STAY HERE!

title: Great location, even better service.
text: Excellent service. Had a blown light bulb, they fixed it within 15 minutes. Jerome (facilities) and Nikolas (front desk) deserve special shout-outs! The shower is one of the best I’ve had! Good location, near the subway.  All three bars/restaurants on site are closed Tuesdays, they should stagger that.

title: Decent but expensive
text: Room was ok but too small for two people.  The first time ever I experienced no water from the tap or shower. Had to wait more than 1h to get to shower. Otherwise decent hotel located close by both Chinatown and Little Italy.

title: NYC Trip
text: upkept of location and better service.  The surrounding area was dirty and the rooms were not well maintained. Customer service was "just" ok.  I had to request clean towel several times before I got them and we had to order our room to be clean 24 hours in advance.  If I go to New York again, I will not stay here!

title: Warum nicht mal eine spezielle Umgebung?
text: Es gibt soviele Hotels in Manhattan, wir haben das Wyndham Garden wegen der Lage ausgewählt. In Chinatown gelegen bietet dieses Hotel ein besonderes Erlebnis was die Umgebung betrifft. Man ist wirklich mittendrin, ein paar Minuten zu Fuss fühlt man sich in Asien und bald darauf in Italien. Kurze Wege zu U-Bahn und Buslinien. Es ist kein ruhiger Ort, das müssen Sie wissen. Aber wir haben uns jederzeit sicher gefühlt, auch spät Abends. Wir hatten ein Eckzimmer mit einem grossen King-Bett und einem Einzelbett. Tolle Aussicht und genug gross für 3 Leute, die Koffer lässt man meistens auf dem Boden. Was gar nicht geht ist das Badezimmer, klein und keine Abstellflächen. Innert kurzer Zeit herrscht ein Durcheinander, man kann noch so ordentlich sein, deshalb von mir einen Punkt weniger. Frühstück haben wir nie gehabt, wir haben uns bei 7eleven Kaffee und so geholt. Wer mal eine andere Umgebung möchte fühlt sich in diesem Hotel sicher gut aufgehoben.

title: Retired traveller
text:
Rare find. Best hotel for a visit in NYC. Check in  on 10/11/22 n got an early check in ., thanks to Tiffany who help  me . She was accomodating good knowledge of the area n gave me suggestions. 
The only thing is when I made this reservation months ago the ck out time was 12 noon but now it is  11 am. Fortunately they have a baggage so I can go out n have lunch before I am picked by uber for JFK my trip to Europe.
I will surely recomend this hotel n be back here on my next trip.
Thanks Tiffany.

title: Great views from the high floors
text: My room on the 16th floor had floor to ceiling windows and great views from them. Heating was not turned on in the hotel and my room was ice cold but thankfully staff brought me a space heater. Desk chair needed repair as did some other items in the room. Food and beverage outlets were all closed when I went down in the morning. Location is in a scruffy area of town but good things (shops, restaurants, bars) are within walking distance. You do however hear a lot of street noise throughout the night so take a higher floor if you can.

title: Don’t believe what they say
text:
Heat did not work and gurgling water sound from unit even when it us turned off 
Was told at check in I could checkout later but on day of checkout they said there was no record of my request and I had to leave by check out time, told it was corporate policy
Also the house phone on 12th floor was ripped from wall, hallway smells musty and stale

title: Good location, clean room, the rest was average
text:
The location was good, right in the middle of chinatown. The room was clean and reasonably spacious for new york.

They would not book a yellow cab for us claiming that it was possible (have you heard of Curb??) trying to get us to book with their airport transfer services (more expensive). The wardrobe would only fit a couple of t-shirts and a couple of pairs of trousers.

title: Great experience, can't complain
text: Staff was very welcoming upon my arrival. The hotel was at a nice location surrounded by many cafes and bakeries. The hotel also has 2 great restaurants and a rooftop bar. The room/suite itself was very clean and comfortable. The sofa bed could use some updating, but everything else was great. I would definitely stay here again. Extra thank you to management for my handwritten note and welcome gift. It was a nice surprise after a long day of traveling.

title: Courteous upgrade
text: Good value, well kept and and clean hotel in the heart of Chinatown. Adam at the front desk was very kind and helpful, upgrading me to a nice spacious corner room with a king bed which was very much appreciated.

title: Great staff at a great hotel
text: Given how hard things are for people since they pandemic, you never felt that at this Wyndham. It’s ina great location and easily accessible. The staff, especially Adam Nicholas, was extremely professional and attentive with guests. You didn’t feel rushed and they made sure your questions were answered. I was in a bit of bind trying to make sure a room was covered for a friend and Adam worked with me to get authorization done quickly so she could get in her room. He was fantastic and I’d stay at this hotel again.

title: Solid Hotel in Chinatown
text: Check in was speedy and efficient. I was able to snag a room on one of the upper floors far away from the street noise of NYC. The room was nicely appointed and clean. I slept like a baby for my busy day of work the following day. Close to the lower east side, Chinatown, Soho, little Italy and the courts. Will stay here again if my work brings me to this part of town.

title: Budget option
text: Needs upgrades. Got stuck in the elevator.  Couple I was stuck in there with said it happened twice the day before and they had to bang in the door for someone to help pry it open. Wish they would have put signs up so others didn’t use it. We ended up walking up the flights to our room each time instead of getting stuck again. Hope they can get more financial support to help staff (felt bad for them, they were trying their best!) and upgrade the hotel.

title: Clean and pleasant hotel, good amenities, excellent location
text: The coffee machine, refrigerator and ironing board in the room add to the comfort of the stay.  The hotel is clean and seems well-managed. Excellent location in the heart of Chinatown and steps away from Little Italy.

title: Hidden gem
text:
Usually I drive to Chinatown a few times a year to get my haircut but decided to stay the night and make it more relaxing. 

I saw this hotel go up years ago on my commute to a prior job in Chinatown and it looked nice. 
Tiffany at the desk was efficient and lovely. They took into consideration my requests and the room was very quiet , beautiful view, clean and comfortable. 
Easy walking distance from  Chinatowm and Littlr Italy for lunch and dinner. Had a wonderful stay. Thank you to the hotel employee in the elevator who when I complimented the hotel gave me a sweet smile under his mask. SO appreciated the cleanliness. Will be back.

title: Great hotel. Needs better lighting
text:
Awesome staff, clean, spacious, close to everything. 

But....

Lighting in both the bathroom and bedroom are horrible! I could hardly see what was in my suitcase, and applying makeup was a struggle with all the shadows.

title: Great Stay!!!
text:
The Wyndham in Chinatown NYC (Bowery) was such an easy and nice stay!!
The front desk were very helpful especially Tiffany and Adam. It’s close to everything. Not noisy when I stayed. Clean bathrooms and bedding 👍

title: Best option to visit the city
text: Perfect location near everything and away from rush. Nice room and  beautiful views. Very helpful and proactive staff. Excelent price. Improvement area would be to advise upon check in of the policy for room cleaning.

title: Shocking
text: Great location that's about as good as it gets ,lifts always not working properly never get to the floor you want to nobody seems to care when complain of issue no access to roof top on site bars restaurants closed do yourself  a favour stay somewhere else

title: Great stay in Chinatown
text: Very nice place, well connected by subway and with great views to the Empire State Building. Stayed with a company trip of 35 people and they managed the group very well. Spacious and comfortable rooms, do recommend!

title: Nice hotel in Chinatown
text: Fantastic view of Manhattan skyline from the room. Central location in Chinatown. Friendly staff. This was my second stay and I really liked it. Good bar and restaurant. Breakfast could have been better. Room was clean and tidy. I will return.

title: Review 1 week stay
text:
Great experience. Stayed for 1 week, good room size, comfortable bed and a very nice bathroom. Also, the location is great since there is a subway entrance 5 minutes from the hotel.

I would definitely repeat.

title: NY State from Los Angeles
text:
Thank you to Adam and the staff from the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for making our stay memorable.
Went to the Garden to see Billy Joel Concert and many of the Sights.  Highly recommend "Top of the Rock!!!
And of Course - Mr. Saturday Night staring Billy Crystal

title: Amazing hotel, Staff treated me like a human
text: I needed a hotel last minute, Adam not only held one for me, but he helped me get a price I could afford on short notice. Clean room, fantastic view, quiet. 100 percent my go to hotel anytime I'm here.

title: Stellar staff (Mr Nicholas, and others)
text:
After checking in, I had a concern with my room, so came back down to front desk, and got to see Nicholas in action. 
Another guest was ahead of me, and was looking for a package. There was none there. Instead of stopping right there, Nicholas checked the logs, and found an entry for pkg. which had arrived a few days before. Since he could not locate the package, he told guest that the staff member who received the package would be back in at 3pm, and he (Nicholas) would check with that staff member, and call guest. 
I loved this expression of professionalism because of three reasons: Nicholas could simply not have looked at the log book for older dates (he persevered), he could have protected himself by not committing to a call back (he didn’t), and, he could have made it the customers problem by askin them to check back in (he didn’t). 
It made my day to see such a professional in action. 
Needless to say, he was very helpful to me as well. 

Also, I got to see some of the staff interactions: they seem to function like a caring team. A good sign!

title: Hotel Guest
text: I give 10 stars to Adam kiddos for him for putting up with my craziness hes so patient and calm very professional .I was very pleased with my stay here  Extremely clean, staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat. Nice neighborhood and quiet, but only a few blocks from all sorts of different restaurants, clubs, etc.

title: Mali made our night
text: Upon first greeting, Mali exhibited top-tier customer service: swift, super-gracious, poised & personable. She made a great first impression when we entered the space and she turned our hectic evening into something more assured and relaxing. We’re so thankful for crossing paths with her.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Adam! What a guy. Very nice and has a great birthday. Our room is great for the price and the location seems good. No blow dryer, but seems like we have everything else.  Good view, fitness center, free wifi, what more could you need?

title: Great service!
text: From the moment we arrived check-in with Adam was an absolute breeze! He was super friendly and helpful. When we had a question about the tv and called the front desk he really went above and beyond to make sure we were all connected and taken care of.

title: Wyndaham Garden Chinatown
