text: Had a very nice stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.  Room (1005) was comfortable and clean with a lovely view of the Empire State Building. Aircon was a godsend as its pretty hot in July and even more so during a heatwave - so was nice to return following a day's sightseeing. Staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive if you needed clean towels etc. Nice internal roof terrace bar with a couple of bars/restaurant on the ground floor.  Really central for getting about Chinatown/Bowery - LES with plenty metro stations nearby.  Will definitely return if staying down the Bowery again.

title: Great LES location!
text: Excellent overall experience during my stay! My room was upgraded upon check in (the higher floor had great views!) and all of my questions and concerns were addressed in a quick, efficient manner.  Tiffany was very helpful :) Will hopefully be returning to this location in the near future

title: Solid Hotel but Not Four Stars
text: The staff is great, the location is fantastic, the room was clean with a great view and overall it was a very nice stay but the rooms are also a bit worn. I just can't give it four stars. The minifridge wasn't working so someone came up and had to fix it. The air conditioner dripped water into the carpet. Some of the walls had scuff marks on them. As I said, the staff was super accommodating but I think the rooms just need a bit of a refresher. I got my room on discount on priceline so maybe they also give the crappier rooms to people who purchase cheap? I would stay there again, just lower my expectations slightly.

title: Won this trip (Tista's Tickets 🎟️ and Travels 🌎) Facebook
text: Clean rooms, great customer service Bowery restaurant and bar has good food. Teado across the street Best herbal tea evvveerrrr. 18th and 19th floor are breath taking especially at night. Over good place to stay.

title: Stay away during the summer !
text:
Where do I begin? I love the location because it is close to some of my favorite neighborhoods, LES, Chinatown and Soho. I mean you could literally walk to any of those neighborhoods from this location. So it's perfect in that sense. Truly.

The staff Saturday afternoon was more than friendly with helping me check in. However after that this is where things go awry. After checking into my room I turned on the AC to cool the room off (special shout out to the gentleman at the front desk who upgraded my room, I had spectacular views of NYC!) I unpacked my bag and then went to grab something to eat. I figured about time I came back the room would be cool to my liking. So I go downstairs to grab something to eat as I was hungry. The bartender was friendly but not attentive at all and it was probably because it was STIFFLING in the said area with no AC only industrial fans blowing hot air around. 

The lobster tacos were okay but they tasted like imitation crab meat instead of lobster. Now onto the wings the wings were bussin! But seriously $14 dollars for some wings should be a crime. I got one cocktail, 6 wings, 2 lobster tacos and a diet coke and it was $50. Talk about highway robbery. 

So I go back to my room to take a shower and a nap before heading out. Can someone please tell me why on earth was my room hotter than before I left. I was attempting to get ready and couldn't stop sweating. Cause it was so blasted hot in there. So I called the front desk and they sent someone up to my room the young man was nice. He says "oh you're AC isn't working either?" He took a look at the unit and offered to give a fan to help cool the room, which I thought was nice. However I want a billion dollar corporation to explain to me why the AC wasn't working in guests rooms but the lobby was cool and pleasant. 

It was literally one of the hottest days of the year and on record and to be in a room that was damn near on the top floor with a barely functioning AC was criminal. I mean if you enjoy sweating while sleeping and getting ready this just might be the place for you. Other than that don't stay here during a heatwave cause you'll be SOL.

title: Great location. That’s about all.
text: For our entire stay, only one of the two elevators was working. They claimed they would not clean our room because of covid precautions. The door and walk between the bathroom and the room are glass which offers the chance for you to really get to know the people you are with. The fridge was frozen solid and the air conditioning kept the temperature at a steady warm temp.

title: Superior location for a value price!
text: Very conveniently located - we walked/took the subway almost everywhere!  Most of the front desk staff was super helpful and friendly.  Stopped in to the bar one late afternoon and had tasty chicken wings and beer - yum!

title: Great location for the price!
text: The location was ideal and why we originally chose this location. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were a little muggy and wished there was a door on the shower. We would stay there again and would recommend if you are looking for a nice place to stay in NY without breaking the bank.

title: Great Establishment
text: The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and it’s a great location! In the mecca of Chi-town and three blocks away from Little Italy. The Brooklyn Bridge is 5 miles away and everything you want to see is but a train away.

title: Always Good
text:
Great location for a food getaway!
Steps to restaurants in both Chinatown and Little Italy!
Then wake up and exercise by running over the Manhattan Bridge and return to Chinatown via the Brooklyn Bridge. 
Am easy three miles.. with plenty of spectacular sights!

title: I'd stay again
text: Nice place, nice location, nice staff.  Easy check in, easy check out.  Discount on parking which is around the corner.  Situated at the confluence of Chinatown and Little Italy.  Great 18th floor bar with great view.  Stay, i recommend it.

title: Great stay , Great service
text:
This is my second time this year staying at Wyndam.  It just gets better and better.   The front desk staff Was amazing and accommodating.  Meeting all my needs and made sure my stay was comfortable.  Thank you Sean and Ryan for the perfect service.  

The restaurant had great food and the staff there gave grade A service in my book; especially Eddie.   There were at least 50 people and although he was the only bartender/server; he made sure each and every drink was made to perfection; not skipping a step.   I am an operations director for barside events and my standards were definitely met.  

The rooftop bar staff were more than exceptional.  The whole team literally worked as a team.  One, security was on their A game, making sure everything was running smooth.  The bar team amazed me by taking care of each and every patron in a perfect manner.  I would definitely book an event there in the near future.   Great job to D. , Paris , howie, and Nigel ; Bravo 👏

title: fun hotel with good views, staff, bars and shops
text: all staff were very friendly and accommodating (tun), hotel has multiple bars/restaurants including a rooftop club at night and beer garden with ramen bowls. close to all the street vendors/shops and some amazing food. multiple metro lines within 10 minutes walk. rooms were nice with excellent views from floor to ceiling windows and a couple floors have wrap around balconies so would request those. thoroughly enjoyed our last minute stay more so than larger times square hotels. would come back to the area and stay here. rooms could use some maintenance as outside patio door wouldn't close easily, mini fridge door sticks  have to lift up to close, shower handle wouldn't turn easily and AC would only cool to about 72 wouldn't get colder.

title: Wonderful service and beautiful view!
text: The staff here has been amazing. The manager Sean was absolutely professional,engaging and kind. The room has a phenomenal view and was well decorated and clean. I will recommend this establishment to friends and associates that will be visiting NYC.

title: Excellent service
text: Sean the manager, as well as the rest of the front desk staff were excellent. Professional, helpful and very accommodating. The room was tidy and well appointed, with large windows to enjoy the beautiful view of the city. Great location to explore Chinatown and Little Italy. Top notch service.

title: OK room, friendly staff, not so great location
text:
The room was clean and relatively spacious for NY standards. The bed was comfortable and the staff was very friendly and there was a nice view of the Empire State Building from the very large window.

The small issues were: the cupboard was quite small, the bathroom could have done with some more towel hanging hooks, and a bit better upkeep (the soap holder was rusty and one of tiles was missing) and the black out curtains still let in a bit of light. Last and not least the location isn't brilliant, in that it didn't feel very safe in the dark.

title: Clean and comfortable
text: During a three night stay, I found the Wyndham to be clean and comfortable.  The room was very small by hotel standards with only a bed, desk and desk chair.  The bed, pillows and sheets were all very high quality.  The lighting in the room and bathroom was quite dim.  The location was excellent for visiting NYC Chinatown, but there is not any nightlife nearby.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: From check-in to check-out the service was excellent. Definitely going back. The Staff, especially Adam was wonderful.  Found parking near by. The hotel is walking distance to little Italy and SOHO. Overall a great experience.

title: Wyndham is a must stay!
text:
We originally stayed at Wyndham Garden Chinatown specifically because it was near an event we were attending- Now we plan to go back because our stay was just that awesome! Everyone we met who worked in the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk workers were all so professional and kind, they even remember the names of guests and greet you as you walk in and out! I had asked if there was a place nearby where I could get a charger and even though it was a short walk away Adam wrote me directions by hand on how to get there. He was a treasure! The adjoining beer garden serves phenomenal food and also boasts a wonderful and kind staff. It also plays some great music if you're in the mood to get your night started, or gives you the option of going to a quiet sit down area to relax and enjoy your meal that way. 
In addition the manager, Sean, and I got to speak and he was extremely kind and very professional! 
It is a highly rated spot for a reason, everyone there does their job proudly and kindly. This is what staying at a hotel should be like- personal, clean, and fun!
Thanks everyone! See you soon!

title: A Mixed Bag
text:
Sean Sy, the Front Desk Manager, was very gracious, placing us in a high corner room with two floor to ceiling walls, one facing north, the other west.  The views and sense of airiness were superb--one felt like a bird flying high over the Bowery.  With two window walls, it felt like the Mr. Big’s corner office.  Or, rather, Mr. Big’s small corner office as the room was small, more like a Paris hotel-sized room than a NYC hotel-sized one. 

Our stay was a mixed bag.  As several comments noted, the absence of a second shower door made water on the floor unavoidable.  The lack of shelf space and narrow edges of the bathroom sink counter made it hard to find space for toiletries.  The bathroom was a textbook example of form over function and a source of frustration.

The desk was small, kid's size, really; the desk chair (the room’s only chair) was sized to barely fit into the desk’s kneehole, so the desk’s inside edges were beaten up.  Worse, when in place, the desk chair completely blocked the narrow passage that was the direct route from the bed to the bathroom.  The bed had a nightstand only on one side though there seemed adequate space for another.

Two more caveats: Daily room cleaning is available, but only if you request it.  Though the sign on the room door indicates a noon checkout, I was told that it was actually 11:00.  

I do think we’d stay here again.  Without spending grotesque money, finding a perfect hotel room in NYC isn’t possible.  The Wyndham Garden Chinatown wasn’t perfect, but it was easily good enough, and better than we expected.

title: A great stay, friendly staff, very convenient!
text: I chose the hotel due to location, as I wanted a walkable area to attend a conference. Adam checked me in and helped me with a number of questions I had during my stay. My room was very clean with a nice view. I had a wonderful stay and will plan to stay here again the next time I am in NYC.

title: Great Friendly Staff - Bad AC Situation
text: Every staff member at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was genuinely friendly and accomodating. Unfortunately, the AC in the guest rooms is lacking - It was not the heat of summer when we visited (6/11/22) but the room was somewhat stuffy and the air was chugging to get a good cool in the small guest room. One support to that is that our room was equipped with a tower fan - which helped somewhat, but is not a solution when you pay a premium to stay in a hotel - You just expect good, comfortable AC. The rooms are clean but my rating reflects that a hot hotel room is not fun - and the potential for that is pretty good given the summer season on the way.

title: Mail has changed my mind.
text:
As I was dreading to come back to Wyndham after my horrible experience back in November I walked up to the counter this morning after my red eye flight.  

Mali greeted me with a big smile which honestly eased all the tension I had prior to coming.  She was extremely courteous, respectful, knowledgeable, and efficient.  It felt like home. 

I was checked in and had all my questions and concerns addressed in less than 10 mins.    

I believe that she represents what great customer service really is.  What a great asset to Wyndham hotel.   Kudos to you Mali !!!

title: Disappointed
text:
Pictures of this hotel are Deceiving  there is no rooftop access, there is no restaurant for breakfast, and the lounge 93 on upper level only open for a short period of time in evening. The lounge and restaurant do not belong to hotel.  You have to book to have your room cleaned at least 24 hours in advance.
Hotel,was clean and bed comfortable.

title: Stay is average. Room is average clean. . Service is average. Location for us is good.
text: Very average for the price.  Room clean is average. Service is average. Location is good for food. Checkout at 11 is ok. They try to be 4 stars. It will take time. Room is tiny. View is not great. Food advantage in Chinatown is why we pay for it and stay at this location.

title: Poor Customer Service
text: I had a reservation through the DayUse app for Sunday, 5/22 from 9am-4pm. The room was not ready when I arrived but that was not the issue as I understand these things happen. My issue is that although I waited patiently in the lobby for over an hour for a room to be ready (worked a double and hadn't slept in 24hrs) when I requested to check out a half hour late, due to the hour+ delay at check-in, I was told "no, that isn't possible"...but I was still charged the full rate for 7hrs. If I have to be out of the room at the check out time why doesn't the hotel have to have the room ready at the check in time? I emailed the front officer manager to discuss this and never even received a response. Very poor customer service. The hotel room itself was very nice and clean.

title: Room was small
text: There was no room service, we had to call in advance to have our room cleaned. Also had to call for restock of towels and coffee. The shower in our room was very good but not so great in other rooms. The air conditioner was working fine. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Ryan was awesome.

title: Chinatown mid-range hotel
text:
Room was decent size for NYC (we had a queen bed).  There's a poster in the lobby advertising coffee but the restaurant that serves it doesn't open until noon ??

Staff was friendly, room was clean, close to Grand Ave and Canal St subway stops.

title: wyndam hotel chinatown
text: Very nice hotel with a great staff.two blocks on way and you in little Italy. Two blocks the other way and you are at a subway station.There was a great little cafe around the corner (KORE COFFEE) which was had the nicest people working there.

title: Great stay!
text: We had a great stay here in NYC. The hotel was clean, bed was extremely comfortable. Pet friendly. And a good location for being so close to some busier roads. Tiffany was a huge help and made our stay extra special.

title: Friendly staff and great experience.
text: The day and night shift staffs are amazing! Definitely a good place to stay because they were able to accomodate our needs in a timely manner. Their communication is good and treats everyone with repect.

title: AC doesn’t work; slept terribly
text: I have stayed here twice - once in 2021 and again in 2022. The location is great but both stays the air conditioning was broken and I slept terribly. It was very very hot. The room thermostat was at 78 degrees and would not cool down. Repeated calls to the front desk were not useful; they simply said the maintenance worker had left for the evening. This shouldn’t happen and it shouldn’t happen twice. They don’t fix issues. Stay away.

title: Really friendly and well done
text: This is a very comfortable hotel in an interesting party of NYC.  The rooms are not terribly large, but that is typical of New York City.  Everything was clean and modern, and the location was great for exploring lower Manhattan. But what really makes this place is the incredibly helpful and friendly front desk staff.  Ryan in particular went out of his way to make this an excellent experience, showing just what a person in this position can do, but everyone was very good.

title: Perfect stay
text: My six night stay was perfect. Location is great. Lots of food in the area. Walking distance to everywhere. Train stations close by. Balcony is beautiful, skyline is gorgeous. Will definitely come back.

title: great hotel
text: clean rooms, convenient location close to subways, helpful staff, and quiet - a wonderful place to stay in NYC. there is a charge for early check-in but it is possible to leave luggage with the front desk

title: Good
text: It was a bit pricy, but overall the hotel was nice. There was no microwave in the room, which sucks when you have food or left over. When taking a shower it was cold because there's no shower door.  Couldn't heat up the room, AC wasnt working.

title: Not luxury.
text: Bathroom was gross.  Toilet seat falling apart.  Restaurant was not open.  Staff unable to help me locate a grocery.  Terrible noise and smell. Do not stay here.  Not worth the money at all.   Location was loud.  Parking was inconvenient.  Check in area was sub par and dirty

title: Gorgeous,  easy, perfectly located
text: This hotel was so lovely with a great view. Great customer service, nice room -clean, good shower, comfy bed. The hotel is well located - close to Chinatown, LES, subways. I'd recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Great service
text: Great service. Hotel staff very helpful and professional.  Check in was great. Associates Adam went beyond his duty. He really was helpful from room to parking.  Very pleasant. Adam also explained in detail of parking. Offered a couple of options.  Very thoughtful and considerate.

title: Great hotel and staff
text: My daughter and I went for three days and if we go back we will stay here again. The area was so fun with lots to do, and close to subway. The hotel staff was friendly and very accommodating. The bar and restaurant were great to have right there. 5⭐️

title: Not a 4-star hotel.
text:
Our rooms were tired, definitely a 4-star hotel by NYC standards. Main gripe though was that the hotel doesn't deter guests from smoking. So if you enjoy the smell or cigarette smoke and weed, this is the place for you. If you don't, then go elsewhere.
On the positive side, the location is obviously good for LES and the staff are friendly (just unable to stop guests from smoking!)
And very uncomfortable, old, squeaky beds with very soft matresses.

title: Ryan at front desk was very helpful.
text: I'm not sure why so many complaints. Everyone was helpful. Our room wasn't so bad. We slept like a rock in our beds. Not so bad for the price. I would stay here again if I return for a visit. Thank you Ryan for your help.

title: Hidden Gem
text: One of the better hotels in the city. I have stayed here on multiple occasions and always been taken care of like a regular, even with team members that don’t know me! Big shout to Adam who has always accommodated me last minute and extending reservations. Hotel is really in the best location in the City, you are literally 4 steps from Nolita, Chinatown and Soho. We would have left except the parking deck was 2 blocks away. I will never stay here again.

text: IT IS NOT A 4* HOTEL!The hotel is dirty, rundown with wallpapers peeling off the walls, dirty lamp shades, damaged walls, damaged electric sockets, old carpets, super noisy beds!Dirty no daily cleaning service because of covid???!!!The hotel is non smoking but unfortunately our neighbours were smoking weed and cigarettes the whole day everyday.We complained to staff which told us that they can’t do anything about it!No security at the hotel, Homless people using computers and toilet in the lobby!Only one person at the reception dealing with customers.People smoking weed by the entrance of the hotel!Horrible place in dangerous area!Oh and there is no kettle or safe in the room!

text:

We wanted to stay in chinatown and the location cant be beat. Definitely staying here again!

I was greeted by Tiffany at the front desk who set the tone for my stay with a smile, a quick check-in, and a professional attitude that is sorely missing in the hospitality business these days.     I got a room on the 15th floor (as for room facing west and north as they have balcony access).    The room was comfortable, nicely sized and of course great views).   The gym is also very nice for a hotel gym with new/good equipment.  I had ramen at Shinka which is located in the lobby - which was tasty and of course very convenient.       Will stay here again on my next visit to NYC.

text:
Recently I had the pleasure of staying at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown in New York City. The location is really fun, the heart of New York’s Chinatown and a few minute walk to Little Italy and the Lower East Side. The room was small but warm, clean and looking very new. I had a fantastic view of New York’s uptown skyline. The Wyndham also got us a discount on our parking, in a lot just around the corner off Canal street.

The best part of my stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown was without doubt, the people. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Tiffany, at the desk could not have been nicer. She was available for directions, advice and assistance. She even checked our bags for the the day after we checked out so my daughter and I could go to a museum before heading to the airport. Tiffany’s smile was radiant and her happy demeanor infectious in a city not known for these qualities. Wyndham is very very lucky to have her as part of their team.

title: Great stay in perfect location

title: Tired Hotel, interesting area
text:
We spent 7 nights in the Wyndham Garden and whilst it was OK, the reviews on TripAdvisor don’t live up to the "amazing" experience we had. Firstly, I would say some of the reviews on TA do seem to be a bit suspect, all 5 stars, all praising the staff and how amazing the hotel was and many reviews left by accounts just this minute registered and no other contributions.... very suspect. 

The room was very tired and I must say, a bit dirty. Luckily, we had packed wipes and after wiping down the handles and touch points (Mainly for Covid) the wipes were black. Clearly cleaning protocols are not great. The glass door in the room was covered in finger prints, as were the windows. The blind in the bathroom and parts of the wall around the bed were covered in "splatters" of some kind of liquid. Hallways outside our room looked like they hadn’t been vacuumed for some time.

The heating in the room was very noisy and couldn't be run during the night so we had to ask for a portable heater. All the windows in the room made it cold quickly. The heating would generally take hours to heat the room up. 

On the first couple of days the shower had to be run for about 10 minutes before the water started running warm. Plenty of black mold around the shower tray. The sink had a crack through it which was poorly stuck back together with mastic. 

Wallpaper around the room peeling off, lots of scuffs and damage to paintwork etc. Just felt like it needs a refresh. The TV in the room constantly displayed "No Signal" I did manage to position the broken antenna cable in a way that did it less. We were quite high up in the building which was lucky as the road noise is quite loud. 

If you're not used to city travel then the area would be of a concern to you. We used Bowery station a few times and one night it had around 10+ homeless in it, multiple people on the stairs down to the trains jacking up with needles and leaving them all over the place. Lots of human "waste" around the surrounding streets. We're frequent city travellers and this disturbed us quite a bit to the point we regretted staying in the area. 

Most of the staff were polite and friendly but we did find it quite rude that some staff completely ignored us with their head down into their phone every time we walked through. No eye contact what’s so ever. 

There were some good points to our stay! The view from the room was really good, facing the city. The bed was probably one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on in a hotel. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. 

Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.  It wasn't cheap enough to stay that far out the way and certainly not a "top" NYC hotel as it portrays. If you're looking for a comfortable bed and can get a good deal but willing to run the gauntlet through the nearest tube station, then the Wyndham Garden could be for you.

title: Professional, clean, respectful, safe, convenient neighborhood
text:
Loved it, great location, perfectly clean, good sized room, window can open for fresh air, loved my stay.
Was there to do a passport renewal errand, easy to get to consulate general area and other areas of nyc.

title: Sean Sy  and his crew are the best in customer service

text:

Checked out & Tiffany said to call Expedia for them to do anything. Expedia called Shawn for confirmation as to my statement and told the agent he has no record of us speaking. I had called the desk back & Tiffany told me to call Expedia and have them give them her name. Although they only gave me 20% of my funds back (which im still very unhappy about) Tiffany handled me from check in to check out. 

My pillow cases had make up on there & I dont wear make up AT ALL. There were I want to say old blood stains on another one which I thought was very odd. Housekeeping just isnt up to par. 2 out of 4 pillows were dirty.

Disappointing because the views from the 8th floor and up are legit breath taking. I travelled all the way from top of CT to come enjoy a self care day & that was my experience. Very upset & most likely wont be coming back.

title: Nice hotel, interesting part of town
text:
We enjoyed staying here.  The rooms were a good size for our family of three, much more spacious than other hotels we had stayed in.  The view from the room was also nice. 

This hotel is in a fun part of town.  It is right near the Chinatown ice cream factory, which has fun flavors to try, and some great Chinese restaiurants.  You can also easily walk to Little Italy.  It is walking distance to several subway lines as well.  For us, it was great that it was near a park with a soccer field (my son went over and got to play in a pickup game), as well as a 24 hour ping pong place.  

It was a bit noisy at night, because it is near a fire station, and also above the Bowery Beer Garden.  However, this is an expected part of staying in an authentic neighborhood where NYers live and hang out.   I wuold recommend asking for a room on a higher floor, if possible.  

Also, the shower is a little tough to work - it doesn't have a curtain, just a partial door, so no matter what you do, some amount of water gets on the floor.

Overall, I would definitely stay here again.  The neighborhood gives you a real NYC expereince, which is worth the slight inconveneiences mentioned.

text: Daniel at the Front Desk was incredibly helpful from check-in to check-out. Sean (the front office manager) accommodated every request with ease and fluidity. I’m not sure if these two are new or not, but with them running things, I couldn’t imagine someone having a bad stay. The rooms are large by NYC standards, and you can’t beat it for the price. If you find a good rate online, they will price match it. And the hotel itself is just steps from Little Italy, Soho, and the LES. East Village is a 7 minute walk. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. Thanks Daniel (and Sean) for all you great service!! We’ll see you next time we’re in NYC.

title: 5 Stars.  Would stay again.
text: 5 stars.  Friendly and professional staff.  Great rooms.  Very clean and well kept hotel.  Awesome view of Empire State building and Midtown at night.  Top location and close to Nolita, Soho, LES, and East Village.  Thanks Daniel and Sean on front desk.  Would stay again.

title: Best in The Neighborhood!
text:
I can’t say enough about our stay here, it was perfect for what we were looking for. Located in our favorite neighborhood, it was clean, so easy to check-in to, and had wonderful views. Adam, who checked us in after a long flight, was fantastic. 

As tried and true New Yorker, I couldn’t recommend this hotel more. It’s the best hotel in the area, and priced just right.

title: Anniversary
text: Clean & friendly hotel to stay! Staffs go the extra mile to make sure their guest needs are being met through out their stay. The hotel manager gave us a upgraded room from a queen size room to a king suite because it was my wedding anniversary.

title: Great service
text: The check in process is always pleasant the staff at the hotel are well trained and very courteous (Thank you Stephanie). The rooms are nice and for NYC standard are big. The room is very clean and nicely equipped. I recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

title: Very friendly staff
text: The front staff here is incredible! Was only in town for one night but loved it so much I wanted to stay again. Tiffany went above and beyond to accommodate me and enable me to keep the room I had.  The front desk manager was also very helpful the following morning. Will absolutely return to this hotel again.

title: Superb value!
text: A perfect location for me in the city, walking distance to everywhere I want to go. My room was not just clean and bright, but much more spacious than you would expect anywhere in NYC. The furniture in the room was not luxurious-- I don't want to exaggerate-- but new and more than functional. Linens were great-- also better than you would expect. And everyone in the staff was cheerful and helpful.

title: Loved it
text: We had an amazing stay. The room was great!! Can’t wait to come back. The staff was attentive and friendly, they even have a available microwave for a small fee. I absolutely recommend this hotel. It’s in a great area there’s so much to do.

title: Fantastic!
text: Great hotel, great view and amazing customer service. Molly had a speedy check in and made everything super easy and welcoming. Will most definitely come back!!!  Great hotel. Pretty cool food downstairs as well!

title: Close enough to where you want to go
text: Stayed here for a night.  Had some fears because of reviews about their air conditioning not working well, but it definitely works.  In fact we had to sleep with blankets,  Room was 50% bigger than the shoeboxes in Times Square, clean. modern, with refrigerator, safe, small armoire and comfortable firm mattress.  Upgraded to a room with a continuous balcony for an obscured view of red, white and blue skyscraper.  Nice.  Two blocks from Grand St station. Short walk to heart of chinatown, federal courthouse, city hall.

title: Great
text:
I really enjoyed staying at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.  The view from my 15th-floor room was amazing. 
Adam who was new to the team was AWESOME, Daniel, and the Front Desk Manager Sean made you feel Welcome

title: So accommodating and very nice room
text: Great location, great room, great service. We mostly arrived back at the hotel late night, and we always had a warm welcome from Mali. She always made sure we had everything we needed, reminded us of the heatwave, and gave us the best advice on what to do. Thank you Mali!!!

title: Wonderful service
text: From the moment we stepped in the door, Sean and Adam made us feel at home. They have great measures in place for the pandemic. Clean and updated utilities. Would recommend to any friends and look forward to coming back.

title: Amazing staff-clean, comfortable, super convenient
text:
We live only 12 blocks away but come here often when my parents come to visit or the AC isnt working.
Mali took care of us at checkin and it was a lovely 4am in the morning, as we had just arrived back in the city and there was no way I was walking up 6 flights of stairs to a hot apartment with no AC. She was lovely, gave us one of our favorite rooms in all our stays here. She even allowed us to reorganize our bags in the lobby because I couldnt find my bank card. Ryan has been the best since we first started staying here over a year ago. The whole team is personable, they remember everything, and while always professional, they know just when to throw in the perks.
The rooms are a little dark but the floor to ceiling windows make up for it, and you sort of feel like you could in the mix, but it is also super discreet and the rooms are pretty darned sound proof. Cleaning staff is super thorough too, though they need to give more towels because no matter which room, the lack of a shower door always leads to me flooding the bathroom. Oops!

Thank you guys for being a home away from home.

Oh, ps. this has nothing to do with the staff and just central management/accounting, but it literally takes forever to get your $50 deposit deposited back to your account and they do take it for every night stayed.

title: Great hotel with amazing views
text:
Checked in and rode the elevator to the 16th floor! What a great view of the city skyline. The room was perfect, not too small, not too big and the floor to ceiling widows make the view even better.  The window even opened a little so we could hear the sounds of the traffic. 
The bed was comfy and the room was clean.
There wasn't a little microwave in the room, so we couldn't heat up anything.
We didn't use the coffeemaker as there was a Starbucks nearby. 
The air conditioning seems to not work at night in many hotels I have stayed in and this was no different. The AC was set to 65 and the room was 75. 

We checked out and got discounted parking. They also held our bags all day (until we returned to get them at 8pm) which was a real bonus.

Sean and the rest of the employees were pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing hotel with amazing views!
text: This hotel never disappoints! Always extremely clean which is so important for us during these Unprecedented times. The Panoramic views from the balcony are phenomenal. The staff is consistently awesome. Ryan at the front desk is so Courteous and hospitable. Anytime we need anytime or need anything resolved, the manager Sean always goes above and beyond. The food downstairs is some of the best ramen I had as well. This is our go to hotel whether we’re doing family or couples trips! Highly recommend especially if you’re doing things in Brooklyn.

title: Area is dead right now
text: No complaints with hotel - very nice and staff was great. However, probably due to Covid, this area is completely dead after 10pm.  We walked a 4 block radius and could not find one place that was open. We finally asked someone on the street and found a small noodle bar open. There was nothing even open to have a drink.  You would think in the middle of Chinatown there would be at least one restaurant open. Nope! Every street was lit up to the hilt but every business closed!  During the day there were way too many vendors approaching you to buy purses, sunglasses, watches or whatever.  Would not stay in this neighborhood again.

title: Sean Sy and the Wyndham Chinatown are the best!
text:
I arrived early and Sean checked me in with no fee. He was training a very attentive young man, Daniel and walked him through the process as he checked us in.
I had selected a Queen room in error and he was able to switch us to a double with no problem. Even though we had been in the room for no more than 3 minutes he sent a cleaning lady to sanitize it for the next guest! Awesome COVID protocol!
My ONLY complaint is there was a long hair in the bathroom(probably from the cleaning lady) and mildew in the shower which is pretty normal. 
Would definitely stay again@

title: UNSAFE, Staff is Unprofessional
text: We checked in early Thursday evening and were woken up repeatedly at 1:30am by someone from claiming to be from the front desk, asking for our name and room number. This individual, Sean, stated he'd checked us in to the wrong room and needed us to leave...at 1:30am. Of course we had no way of verifying this, and weren't going to walk around a hotel at 1:30am. He called back repeatedly at 3 and 3:30am, until we unplugged the phone. There was also a knock on the door at 5am. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

title: Loved our stay!
text: Sean was great and super helpful! We were more than comfortable and he was so considerate. We will be back! The hotel room was clean and super accessible. Our room had a wonderful view of the city and was quiet. Thank you!

title: Just O.K.
text:
This hotel is for very basic use only.  Sleep and leave.
So if you just want a place to keep your stuff and sleep it will serve you well.
The room was clean, and the coffee maker worked well.  Location was just OK.

title: Definitely coming again
text: Sean gave excellent customer service. Room was so nice. Thank you Sean for your hospitality! The room is so cute and welcoming. Very lovely especially for how late we booked. This was a last minute booking. But Sean made it so simple. So thank you again Sean.

title: Great Service
text: Sean Sy was awesome! Nervous Hoosiers, first time in the city and he made us feel comfortable. The room overlooking the city is amazing! We are so excited to explore the city tomorrow. Conveniently located next to the Manhattan Bridge. Recommend

title: This hotel ruined my trip to NYC
text:
I understand it was hot in NYC, and we are recovering from a pandemic. But there is no excuse for the lies and the lack of concern and service from the staff and manager of the hotel. We asked for an upper floor. We were given a room on the 6th floor with a view of a graffitied wall. We were told it was a city ordinance to keep the room at 72. That would’ve been fine, but the room was 85 and humid. It was warm enough to melt the chocolates I brought to bring to a friend! Turns out this hotel is infamous for broken a/c, which we didn’t realize. Was never mentioned when we checked in. 
   Lights were super dim and not always working. Curtains had to be kept closed at all times to try to block the sunlight from further warming the room. No one at the desk mentioned they had fans to loan us, found out from another patron of the hotel after I spent a hot and sweaty hour trying to find one to buy. 🤬
    No fresh towels or wash clothes, we ran out of toilet paper on day 2 and had to use tissues.. gross. Garbage was overflowing. There was a large column in the room that totally blocked the t.v. 
   Room reeked of cigarette smoke, which as a severe, severe asthmatic gave me a lot of trouble. Front desk was nice, but useless, manager was never around. Horribly disappointed, and will never stay at another Wyndham.

title: AC was broken and NYC was 95 degrees.
text: I went to visit a friend and when I checked in, no one told me the AC is not working. My room was 85 degrees and outside was 95. The front desk lady was so rude and service was terrible. I had to call 3 times for them to bring a fan to my room and wasn't able to sleep in that tempreture all night. For 200 a night you can go to any other better hotels in NYC

title: Getaway
text: My son and I met in NY for a long weekend. The hotel accommodations were awesome and staff was excellent. Location was close to Manhattan Bridge giving easy access to Brooklyn and lower Manhattan. I did not give them a perfect score of 5 because during my stay the AC malfunctioned and the room stayed warm. Could have been worse if we were in the height of the summer. I was able to sleep comfortably. On leaving, Sean offered to make things right, demonstrating great customer service. Definitely would stay here again.

title: Deplorable Service
text:
Arrived 9pm for a 4-day stay  to be told "No AC" for next 3 days.  No prior notice (they had to have known well before this) and no offer to place us in another Wyndham or other hotel.  Just "free cancellation" or "30% off room rate" to stay in an 80 degree room.  So, at last minute, of course, we had to pay top dollar elsewhere.  Hotel management should have done something for us and they did NOTHING.

Looking at reviews, many must be fake.  The hotel is nicely located in Chinatown, but that's where the good part ends.  Lobby looks solidly 2-star.and shabby.  The desk agent was friendly enough, but no management around and no help.  Hard to believe this is part of a chain that usually has some standards for customer service.  Not this one!  Avoid it.

title: Nice Location- Very hot!
text:
This hotel has a great location and the staff is very friendly.  Also met cleanliness expectations.

The issue with our stay was it was SO HOT!  The room did not cool down past 80 and even with a tower fan provided, it was still toasty.  The hotel seems to have poor AC that doesn't kick on high enough.  The staff was nice and gave me a partial refund for this issue.

The shower was also like a jet stream and left water everywhere.

I would stay here again, but not during the summer months.

title: Excellent service
text: We had a room on the third floor with lovely curtains and bathroom. The front desk accommodated  our unconventional check-in times as well as provided great food recommendations. The maid, Kumarie, was personable and amiable as well!

title: Great location! Great hotel!
text:
This hotel was a great choice! It was a basic room, small but it’s NYC. Shower was a little odd…no door but just glass covering half and then open, so water does spill out. 
But the area is amazing! Not your over crowded area of Manhattan. Super close to Little Italy. Great food attached to the hotel and a rooftop bar.  I would 1000% stay here again!

title: great location, great service
text: Good value, helpful and welcoming staff.  Service was excellent and we felt very safe.  Visited from out of state with my family and really liked being in Chinatown where could walk to so many terrific restaurants. Easy to walk on the Manhattan bridge to get a wonderful view of the city. Subway an eight minute walk. Loading zone right in front of the hotel so we could leave our car out front while we checked in and put our luggage away.  Hotel offered reduced parking rate in nearby lot.  The only negative thing was all the traffic noise and sirens from the street.

title: Great hotel
text:
The Wyndham Garden Inn is a great hotel in Chinatown.    The local is fantastic as you can stroll through Chinatown, Little Italy, & Soho.   Due to COVID, you must request cleaning service the night before.    I was told to request it early.    However, the general
manager told me it must be done the night before.    He was very accommodating & had our room serviced.    He is excellent and will take care of any problems that arise.   The hotel has great views of the city.    This is our 2nd visit in a year & I would definitely return.

title: Extremely hot rooms
text: Apparently the hotel recently renovated their windows. The rooms were so hot and uncomfortable. The air was turnt to the lowest setting and the rooms would not cool down at all. It made the sleeping conditions extremely uncomfortable. Also, the sheets felt like sand paper. The rooms were very small, but it’s New York, I get that. Which should have made it easier for the room to cool down, but no!! If you’re looking for a comfortable night of sleep after being out in the heat all day, I wouldn’t recommend this hotel. But the hotel staff was very pleasant. Unfortunately, not getting a decent sleep, without air, over shadows the pleasantries of the staff!

title: Wonderful service and great location!
text: This is our go-to place to stay in the city. We find that this location has excellent customer service, clean rooms, and a great location. For our most recent stay, Annie at the front desk was so accommodating and friendly. We couldn't ask for better service. 100% will stay here again!

title: Past its prime
text:
I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for a business trip five years ago and it was then perfectly fine. The rooms now need refurbishing badly as I found it to be a dingy, dark and smelly place.  
COVID note -- Make sure to request room cleaning 24 hours in advance as it will not otherwise be done.  After a couple of days, the room will even feel dirtier.

title: the services are bad
text: when i ask about keep my luggage in the hotel concierge they charge me usd 5 pernight, i already told them that i have another reservation two days after my first checkout, and then when im checkin for my second stay, they have ac problem, and its already night, they only offer me full refund, or you can stay at the hotel, and the guy in the reception have a rude tone and attitude.

title: Travel
text: Annie is the best. I don’t know where to start.  I absolutely loved her customer service from the check in to check out. She always welcome us with warm greeting and always have smile on her face. She always makes our stay  so comfortable. I will never go to any other place. This is the best hotel and best customer service. ANNIE THANK YOU SO MUCH. For always providing  us the best customer service.

title: Staycation
text: I booked the room on a whim to have a  mini staycation. The next day I ended up extending the room for another night, Sean the manager at the front desk was so accommodating and helpful with all of my needs. The rooms are nice and the beer garden downstairs has great food and energy. Will recommend to anyone, definitely coming back. Can’t wait until the rooftop is open.

title: 5 star
text: Sean and marisol are fantastic! The hotel is clean and they were able to get us set up with early check in. First time in a hotel since pandemic everything felt clean and safe. Everything is great from the hotel to the service. 10/10 would recommend!

title: June celebrations!
text: Sean at the front desk was excellent! He was able to not merely hold our bags, but was able to check us in early! He upgraded our room and it is wonderful! We stayed here before and had a wonderful experience…. That is why we came back again! Clean room, nice toiletries, &beautiful view. Wedding anniversary/ birthday celebrations… ready to have fun!!!

title: A week in the City
text: We had a great time in the city. The location is super close to the train and so much within walking distance. The location was perfect for our sunrise Brooklyn bridge trip. The staff was friendly and helpful for anything we needed/wanted.

title: Great modern hotel in a great, convenient location!
text:
I'm actually a local from the South Bronx, but needed a place to stay for one night in my favorite corner of Manhattan -- Chinatown! This hotel was affordable, and right in the heart of the neighborhood within easy walking distance of so many of the best restaurants. Check-in was super easy, and the front desk manager Sean Sy even upgraded my room to an upper floor corner unit with unobstructed city views north to the Empire State Building, and west to One World Trade. Let's just say that the evening skyline view of Manhattan was stunning!

The room itself was impeccably clean, smelled great (due to a new air filtration system just recently installed), and the bed was comfortable beyond measure. I never used the tv, but I'm sure it was nice too. 

The only downside was no fault of the hotel itself -- but rather, the still ongoing restrictions due to *you-know-what*. I really wanted to enjoy the upstairs lounge, Rooftop93 -- but it was closed for the foreseeable future. However, the Beer Garden at ground level serves cocktails as well, so it was an "okay" substitute.

I plan to come back, though, when the rooftop lounge re-opens. And for that amazing view from my room!

title: Great location and helpful staff.
text:
Place was better than expected and inside rooms were updated. Great location. Annie Zhao at the front desk was super helpful in getting the room preferences we wanted and helping with us at check-in.

Lots of restaurants around and also has a rooftop bar, but the roof was closed when I was there.

title: Wyndham China town
text: Annie is one of the best representative they have on duty every time I come her service is immaculate and very courteous. My stay is always pleasant. Rooms are clean and sanitized and room service is also very helpful and timely

title: Perfect service
text:
I liked staying here. The staff is great and always try to find the best suitable solution for you. 
Rooms are clean. Very good view from the rooms
Affordable price for such area. 
I definitely recommend

title: Jeremy and Sean were awesome!
text: Our check in was flawless and amazing because Jeremy knew exactly what he was doing, and it was his first check in!!!!  Sean helped us upgrade to a better room and was just overall a fun person to meet when we checked in! Gotta love the amazing service that the two of them gave my boyfriend and I, especially since were not from around here. Highly recommend staying here, it’s a wicked nice and clean hotel!!! :D thanks guys!!!

title: Birthday trip
text: Awesome experience and friendly staff. Everyone was helpful and made us feel welcomed. Great location with a lot to explore in the area. We will definitely be back. This is a different experience from staying in the midtown area.

title: My Love Affair Continues
text: I became a Diamond Member solely by staying over 40 nights at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown in 3 months! What makes my stays enjoyable are the EXCEPTIONAL staff and perfect location. Calvin is thorough, congenial and welcoming with a smile. Annie always has great tips on dining and is helpful; whatever asked. Ryan's knowledge is reliable and his presence makes the evenings great. Stellar Front office Manager Sean Sy (with a voice that's destined for radio) leads this team with his people first policy. If there is ever any problem, it is addressed immediately and things like a complimentary upgrade or requested microwave have been given. It makes one's business feel valued. Accountability and old school customer service keeps me returning. Each visit is like coming home to my Chinatown family! General Manager Christiaan Aldoy and this group could serve as the poster children for Wyndham.

title: Decent Place in Chinatown
text:
Got to the hotel and was offered a free upgraded room with a balcony.  Not sure if it was the same size or smaller than my original one though.  I took it anyways.

  Hotel is easy to find, right on Bowery and close to Grand Station (D/B trains) and/or Bowery Stn (J/Z Trains) and easy to find because of the covering for the Bowery Beer Garden which is sort of attached to the hotel.  It's also right on the main street too.

  Room was alright, not very big, but had 2 beds, wardrobe with a safe, small fridge, desk and a nightstand that had several USB slots and plugs.

  The balcony is not what one would expect if you hadn't previously looked at photos (I had so I wasn't sure I really cared to have it).  You can walk out, but not really sit on it, and it's more like a narrow roof section it seems than a true balcony.  But you can walk around the outside of the hotel on it and get some great views depending on your floor.  I was on the 7th and I could see downtown and Midtown pretty well and even better seeing them at night.

  The room has some bottles of water there as well as standard shampoo, body lotion, etc in the bathroom.

  The bed for me wasn't as comfortable as I thought it would be.  I'm not sure if it was the bed or the pillows for some reason.  They had enough pillows, but I didn't get the best sleep in the beds.  I also would have to put a towel under the door to keep the hallway light out and that helped out.

  The bathroom is a good size, lots of towels (as maid service was scaled back due to Covid).  I found there wants any place to hang towels though at all.  There were no towel racks and the shower wasn't a typical shower one would expect.  The shower has no door, it's just a partial glass window that you can't shut.  So you would take your shower, but anyone that walks in could see you.  You also have to watch the water coming out, so that it doesn't spray and go out of the open part onto the floor.  There is also no fan in the bathroom either.

  Maid service as mentioned has been scaled back due to Covid and you need to request service a day before.  I was there a week and never needed it as I was alone.  Though if you see them in the halls, you can easily ask them for extra shampoo or towels if you needed them.

  24 hour check in desk and fast express check out with a friendly staff.

  Compared to other hotels I found this one to be highly recommended and a good price in comparison. ..

title: Sean is excellent
text: Sean is an absolute maestro. Incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable, and top notch customer service. We will definitely come back and stay here again. Highly recommended! Great location in the heart of Chinatown.

title: Short get away
text: The location is good close to the Canal street subway and another stop.  You can walk to areas of little Italy. The food options at the hotel itself are ok possibly better during non Covid times. Room was comfortable and had a fridge but no microwave. I would stay here again decent stay nothing spectacular but you’re in New York you don’t want to stay in your room all day anyway :)

title: Fantastic stay, saved our trip
text: Me and my buddy planned to stay in Brooklyn. When we arrived it was a total NO-GO. Sean and his crew at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown HOOKED us up with a gorgeous room VERY last minute. Will stay again

title: Terrific service and views
text: Sean at the front desk provides excellent service! They held my bag and even let me check in early.  The place has amazing views of the entire city.  The location is easy to get to from the metro. And you will to all the great food and shops. Canal street is just a few blocks over.

title: Downtown Bowery SoHo HIDDEN GEM!
text:
The Wyndham Chinatown is now my favorite hotel I’ve ever stayed in downtown Manhattan. Right on the border of Soho, the Lower East Side and Chinatown it lies at the heart of the the cool downtown scene. 

Perfect location. Super hip. Super clean room. Exceptional 180 degree full-city views! 

The manager Sean is a consummate NYC hospitality professional and a gentleman. With this level of professionalism and service you could easily feel like you’re walking into the Ritz.  

You won’t find better a better stay, better service or a better overall value than here, anywhere.

title: Staycation
text: Loved the balcony room. Being from NY it’s hard to get good views. Calvin helped me check in with such ease. Also upgrading my room was a smooth ride. Much appreciated ! Definitely will be back again.

title: Comfortable Stay
text: Check in was quick and fast, friendly staff, comfortable bed clean bathroom. Supermarket and pharmacy very close by. Definitely will stay here again. Oh and the lobby very beautiful and the view from the room wasn’t so back .

title: Great spot
text: We enjoyed our stay at Wyndham in Chinatown. The hotel is pretty standard for a chain, but the rates were great and we found the staff lovely. Annie was wonderful from before we even arrived, answering a few quick questions after booking online. She welcomed us at check in  and set us up for a successful stay - thank you, Annie!

title: Funny short visit  with my wife to NYC
text: Excellent hotel, great  location , right in the middle of the best of Chinatown, very clean and the superb costumer service from Annie at the front desk, who made our stay much better. Thanks Annie again!

title: Amazing couples stay in the heart of downtown nyc
text:
My girlfriend and I just had the best time staying at Wyndham Garden nyc. The hotel is right in the mix of everything that we wanted to see. All of the restaurants on our wishlist  were within walking distance too! 

Our hotel room was a corner room with views of midtown and downtown skylines. I can’t imagine a better view. Our room smelled so nice and the shower water was even scented !

Sean and the rest of the team were super accommodating. 

We will be back soon :)

title: amazing service & location!
text: This is my first time at this hotel, the city views are spectacular, but the service really makes the difference. Annie at the front desk is top notch hospitality queen! She got me a space heater because of nyc’s unseasonably cold spring, and made a vacation feel like home ❤️

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL - Read this review, ignore the others
text: There seem to be quite a few angry reviewers lately, of ALL NYC hotels.  That made choosing a hotel very difficult.  I'm glad booked the Wyndham Garden Chinatown 5/1 - 5/8/21.  It was superb.  The rooms were VERY nice and VERY clean.  I can't imagine a better location than this anywhere in NYC, located at the Manhattan foot of the amazing Manhattan Bridge.  This is in the VERY SAFE Chinatown district with Little Italy only two blocks west.  The Grand St Station is 2.5 blocks (no, really..... less than a tenth of a mile) away.  and the B and D lines can get you anywhere (either alone or by transfer, usually at 4th st).  The front desk was superbly polite and helpful.  Annie was especially a delight as she checked us in and kept an eye out for all of our needs throughout our stay.  Wifi was perfect in the rooms and throughout the hotel.  The room included a refrigerator that was everything we needed.  The bed was very comfortable and honestly, NOTHING could have been better about this stay.  The Bower Beer Garden is a really nice Craft Beer Bar in on the ground level and food can be ordered from that (pub fare) menu or from the also attached Shinka Ramen and Sake bar.  Everything we had here, including a wide array of local, regional and national CRAFT beer was fantastic.  Manny, our server was someone we talked about for the entirety of the trip.  Superb.  Again, I don't know where some of the crazy reviews come from.... I think just unhappy people in a tough time (pandemic) but take it from me, you will not regret staying here.  We've only been gone 48 hours and we're already dreaming of NYC and a Wyndham Chinatown return trip soon.

title: Great place to stay !!
text: Hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful . Location is near everything. The room was clean and had plenty of towels . The room also had a great view. They really try and accommodate your needs which is great in a hotel

title: Charming Accommodations on The Edge of Chinatown
text:
It’s with great appreciation and gratitude that I pass on my fantastic experience at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Upon arrival, the Front Office Manager Sean Sy graciously welcomed me into the hotel and made sure I was as comfortable as could be, even taking the initiative to provide me with a complimentary room upgrade on a higher floor with an amazing view.

I’d originally only planned to stay a few nights before moving to another hotel but was thoroughly impressed with all aspects of my experience here. From my interactions with the concierge, Annie and Calvin to the super helpful and hardworking housekeeping crew. It almost felt like a second home that I was torn about leaving when check-out time came on the final day of my stay. 

I will definitely be back here and am excited when the rooftop opens up again! For anybody looking to enjoy all of what Chinatown and Lower Manhattan has to offer, I highly recommend you check out the Wyndham Garden Chinatown!

title: Average Visit
text:
First trip to New York City. The hotel is in a great location in the middle of Chinatown. Perfect walking distance for where we needed to go. Parking not included. They do make it clear that parking is available off-site and its pricing. Make sure to get your parking stub validated when you check out. That was not made clear. Overall ok experience. Front desk staff was attentive. Sean was able to upgrade our room, which we did appreciate. 

Pros:
- Walking distance to plenty of good restaurants 
- COVID-safe experience
- Attentive front desk staff
- Good view of the city from higher levels
- Clear information on parking (with the exception of how to validate your ticket)

Cons:
- Slow and small single working elevator (we were on the 12th floor)
- Small room even with the upgrade but it’s NYC so not sure if this is just the norm
- No option for valet, which is what it is. More challenging with all the luggage we had to lug from the garage even though it was a super short distance from the hotel itself

Lighting and mirrors in the bathroom and entryway weren't the most conducive if you wanted to do make up etc in the morning.

Pros: Location! Close to a subway station and was just a few stops away from Herald Square area. Walking distance (comfortably) to SoHo area. CitiBike station about a block away which we love! Amazing restaurants within blocks of the hotel. Convenient parking (about 2 blocks away. Pricing was phenomenal. Clean!!! We will stay here again and it'll probably be our first choice when we come visit our son from now on!

title: Great Value
text:
This stay was taken during COVID and noted for clarifying my experience. This was also my first hotel experience in general.

Check-in was quick and easy. We were greeted, and after an ID check, my information was found. For the safety of staff and guests, there were plastic guards, which made it a bit more difficult for me to hear in addition to speaking through masks. The only difficult part of the experience is using the key card for the elevator. We often found ourselves swiping a few times to get the green light and holding down the desired floor a bit longer until it lit up. The key card worked effortlessly for our room.

The room is pristine and a digital thermostat is available by the entrance. We got there towards the early evening, so we were a bit puzzled on how to turn on the light fixtures, not realizing there were brown rocker switches underneath, on the wall. It became second nature once we figured it out. I'm not certain if the ID was specifically mentioned, but it was easy to find the guest wifi and connect to it.

While the TV has many channels and offerings, we wanted to use our own devices and external services we've been accustomed to. We needed to ask the front desk for a technician to come and take down the TV in order to access the HDMI ports, located in the back. An Amazon Fire TV stick just barely connects to the lower outlet (connecting with the TV outlet makes it difficult to remount the TV). After minutes, we were set up and running. The TV is easy to unmount after knowing what to look for, but is best left for professionals for safety. In addition, staff were ready to answer questions and assist where possible. The front desk had single use pouches of toothpaste should you forget your own. They will point out convenience stores nearby for your needs, and greet you as you exit and re-enter the lobby. I hate calling by phone, so it was important to me to be able to approach the front desk and request housekeeping needs.

Located in Chinatown, there isn't a shortage of eateries. However, due to Covid the rooftop bar was not available. The property owner did not update this in Google, and while not owned by the hotel, it was an attraction we were looking forward to, especially for some good photo opportunities. We did find another rooftop bar not too far away, but again, it was an unfortunate inconvenience that was not noted beforehand.

Overall, our experience was great. My only minor gripes were fiddling with the key card in the elevator, and accessing the HDMI ports on the TV. The key card is just trial and error, but having HDMI extender cables already hooked to the back of the TV would simplify customer experience.

title: Most exceptional staff I've ever experienced.
text: Wow, where do I begin. I booked this past weekend for an anniversary surprise and the staff could not have made it better during these times. From a few days before I even checked in I stopped by after work and met Giovanni who greeted me with such hospitality and assurance. I understood not all special requests may get to be accommodated and I thought there may have been a chance that mine wouldn’t even get to be read--but as soon as I stated my name he already assured that everything was planned to get me a great room for the occasion as long as it was not occupied on my check in day. I had read about a specific room number being “the best” on one of the reviews and when I mentioned it, Giovanni went above and beyond to inform me the room next to it was even better and why! With that being enough for me to already be so happy and excited with the effort and service, he took it upon himself to note my stop-by and our discussion for his colleague the next time I arrived to check in and decorate (I mentioned I planned to do this on the phone and clean everything up, I was warmly told by Sean that is no problem at all and not to worry! Another great experience communicating with the second staff member I encountered). On the day of check in, eager to find out if the assigned room was still going to be available, I made a call to ask a few hours before I left work to head over and decorate - which was when I encountered Calvin yet another AMAZING front desk staff member who so kindly confirmed it was available! I can’t stress enough how these gentlemen put all the pressure and anxiety I felt to make the weekend perfect at ease. I was blown away. I checked in and finally met Calvin who was even warmer in person and made me feel so welcomed. Check-in was very simple and clear, and he even answered my deposit question so kindly. The room was perfect and had everything I needed. The water pressure and temperature was great, the views were amazing and my partner who has never stayed at a hotel in the city loved every bit of it. We were even left a sweet greeting note congratulating us and wishing us a great stay that we surely did have. Despite changes in daily housekeeping due to covid, when we needed fresh towels and a new comforter from the prior stay, it was done with ease. The ramen restaurant was amazing, we both loved it! We even enjoyed 2 free drink vouchers from the staff--I honestly cannot stress enough how much they made this such a great experience. I could go on and on. If you love ramen and asian fusion food you will be steps away from heaven. Love Italian? Little Italy is also blocks away. Honestly you are right in the vicinity of just about anything you could want, we got to stop by so many nice brunch spots and bars just minutes away via uber. If you love to shop like we do, you will also be minutes from heaven as soho shops are so close! We were able to explore and enjoy the city, while having a comfortable and serene setting to come back to and relax in. I will definitely book with this location again in the future. Outstanding staff, exceptional service and breathtaking views. (I should have thought to take better pictures, I took videos and had to screenshot, but believe me when I say they were incredible in person, so next time :) Thank you so much to the team at Wyndham Garden Chinatown from the bottom of my heart for everything. We appreciate your effort and care so much.

title: A little unorganized
text:
I hate to leave anything negative right now, but I like people to go into a situation informed. 

This hotel is very short-staffed right now. They appear to be racing around cleaning rooms as guests arrive. One employee told us they're only working one day a week. 

As we checked in we were told the air conditioning will not really get below 74, and we were offered a fan. I'm not sure if that's a setting to save money or if it's always like that, but it sounded like a new thing. We accepted the fan, and it was fine. 

We knew there wouldn't be daily room service by then, but that was not at all clear when we booked the room. We were there for multiple nights and were told that we could request service if we needed it.

I should add that our room had amazing views, and the hotel was very quiet. 

On day 3 we were out of towels and coffee, and we requested service. We were told to be out of the room around 10 so they could clean it. We returned to a dirty room around 6. 

New person at the desk said there is NO run service, even if we're there for an extended stay. He did hustle up some fresh towels and waters and coffee. There's no room service right now, and finding coffee proved somewhat difficult, so we appreciated the additional pods for the room. 

If you are staying here or really anywhere right now, I would recommend calling the hotel directly and asking the manager what to expect. I think it's reasonable to expect room service every few days for an extended stay, but I would get that cleared up ahead of time so nobody is unhappy. 

It's a strange time to travel, and being flexible is important for hotels as well as for guests. 

There is room for improvement in setting expectations. Is this hotel a repeat? You betcha. Despite the confusion, everyone has been lovely.

text: I stay here frequently and really enjoy it. The staff, Sean and all the team, are very kind and take great care of me. The rooms are very smartly designed and appointed. The location is very convenient to all downtown spots - financial district, soho, lower east side, etc.

title: Place is good, service is excellent.
text: Sean and the team are extremely friendly, helpful and give me good recommendation.  I have stayed there for more than 2 months, I enjoyed my stay.  I will definetly returning again and recommend to my friends.

title: Lovely hotel maid
text:
Decent hotel. But had to mention the lovely hotel maid from Guyana, Kumarie. Excellent chats and very kind. 
Hotel is well located for Chinatown and lower Manhattan. Subway is close by as well. Walkable to downtown business district and wtc.

title: Super séjour
text:
Hôtel très bien situé pour les visites,
Le personnel d'accueil souriant, très à l'écoute qui a répondu à toutes nos demandes avec efficacité.
Le ménage est très bien fait, aucun souci.
La chambre est de taille convenable et la salle de bain est très bien.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
Bon emplacement, chambre propre, salle de bain correct même si les appareils sanitaire notamment le pommeau de douche laisse à désirer.
Le gros point noir de notre séjour étant le petit déjeuné. Les assiettes sont choisit pour vous. Aucun choix/modification possible. Vous choisissez seulement votre boisson.

title: Trip to China Town
text: Sean and Stacey were both super amazing! They made me feel extremely welcome the moment I arrived. Saw to my needs of an upgrade with no problem. They really made my stay worth wild, even in the short time I spent with them.

title: Good
text: Hotel is in Chinatown. Safe area, close to Grand Street station, restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Hotel is clean and staff are helpful. Rooms are comfortable, with coffee maker and fridge. Windows can open. Would recommend.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great location and awesome views from the rooms. If you don't leave the hote..no worries, the food/beverage there are great! Any issues you have, the staff are always eager to help correct. Great service

title: I like my chinese cousins
text:
The location is ideal. I have always loved chinatown. It gave me more time to experience the flow.
Everything about the hotel was fine. We stay in various hotels for the hell of it.
This is our favorite.

title: Zimmer mit Aussicht in guter Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt auf der Bowery am Rande von Chinatown. Da es in der Nachbarschaft das höchste Gebäude ist, hat man in der Regel schon ab dem 7. Stockwerk aus den großen Panorama Fenstern eine schöne Aussicht über Manhattan. Die Zimmer sehr schön eingerichtet und haben für New Yorker Verhältnisse eine gute Größe.
Besonders shön ist die Rooftop Bar 93. Von dort kann man einem leckeren Drink ebenfalls die tolle Aussicht auf Manhattan geniessen. Im Sommer kann man auch nach draußen. Im Winter leider etwas zu kalt.
Alles in Allem ein top Hotel. Kann ich nur weiterempfehlen.

title: Great place to stay
text:
I had a second floor room with access to a terrace outside my room
Efficient check in
Very comfortable bed
Lovely bathroom 
Decent coffee maker in room
Refrigerator
Super friendly staff both at check in and doing the rooms. 
Rooftop bar with reasonable prices
Only 5 mins walk from manhattan bridge
Did not eat at the hotel but looked pleasant
I would stay again without question
Fair price

title: Memorable Place
text: Had a great time at The Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Here to visit family and enjoyed a nice, clean and quiet room. The view of The Empire State building was fantastic. Breakfast was good and the food outlets are good. Rooftop has great drinks and views. The staff was warm and friendly. Housekeepers were very friendly and helpful with whatever I needed. Gilbert at the front desk was extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. Katra the hooka lounge recommendation was spot on. I definitely had a great time and the price was amazing. I have to come again. This place is great!

title: Convenient Place
text: Nice clean place. Location is good, near Little Italy and Soho. Clean rooms. Staff is very good. Gilbert at the front desk was pleasant and professional every time we saw him. Good recommendation for a nice restaurant in times Square. Thank You!. Overall a good place for a good price. Good Value.

title: I recommend it!
text: A nice hotel overall, clean and well maintained. Free WiFi, complimentary water and a nice shop by the desk to pick up any additional treats. I particularly liked the restaurant selections as there were several. I would definitely stay here again on business or pleasure. Subway around the corner was a huge plus as was the staff.

title: Room with an amazing view!!!
text: This hotel is a pearl! This is our second stay here and we  definitly stay here next time too! . Everything suits us perfectly. The staff is very friendly and helpful. And the view from our room is just amazing!

title: Great first stay!
text: Our small group was on the fence between the Wyndham and another boutique hotel, looks like we made the right choice. The team was very attentive to all our needs and to the best of my knowledge not a single person in our tough group complained. The Beer Garden was great to unwind. I look forward to our next excursion.

title: Great service of the supervisor Jose
text: We have stayed in this hotel a few times and last time, the supervisor Jose was really kind with us, and he make shure our staying there was good, also helps us with recomendacions for food close to the place and helped us any time ...

title: Best experience
text: Loved the area and the hotel staff was amazing. Really helped me with anything I needed and made my experience amazing with the one I love. They accommodated me with all my needs and the food here was very good. The bar downstairs is a great place to hang.

title: Feeling at home when traveling
text: The staff at the WGC are so accommodating and so welcoming.  They make sure I feel welcome every time I am in town as well as any of our new employees who stay with them during our new employee onboarding sessions.

title: Consistently great!
text: This marks my third visit to the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. I had great but short stay. Can't say enough about the front desk team, Stacey, Ray and Gilbert, always helpful and personable. The team at Shinka, such great comfort food.

title: Time
text: Jose was the receptionist at the time. He was amazing. Listened to everything my girlfriend and I had to say and helped us with our concerns. My experience was great because of him and I will definitely be returning! Thank you

title: Jose
text: Jose was wonderful! I came in with my boyfriend and Jose made sure we got a beautiful room with a wonderful balcony. He was extremely pleasant and has made our experience ten times better. Most definitely will return. Thank you!

title: Perfect
text: An excellent place to stay in downtown New York City. Kind and friendly staff. The windows are big which is great. Very clean and an excellent location between Chinatown and the lower East Side. I highly recommend it.

title: Where to begin?
text: From the moment we arrived at JFK all the way through our entire stay, things were just on point. Got a super nice yellow taxi driver who gave us advice on sites to see outside of what we already had planned during our visit. When we arrived at the hotel, things got even better as we were allowed to check in early at no extra charge and we were upgraded by Stacie. She was so personable and friendly. Our room had probably the best view I've ever had in NYC, room was clean and sizeable. The rooftop bar was excellent, everyone we encountered was just friendly. We were really happy with our little get this weekend and hope to be back soon. We left during the parade and it was just a happy kind of vipe everywhere.

title: New York New York
text: Great location, lots of restaurants plus the atmosphere of Naples and Hong Kong. People, restaurants, streets vegetable stalls, not stuffy like mid town. Great views of manhattan and convenient subway stops.

title: Over All Good
text: Nice hotel with very attentive staff, clean rooms with the best views of NYC. The sports bar was not my scene but the food was decent. My only gripe was my shower with a glass partition in place of a curtain which didn't really work. Service was great and that's always more important in the end.

title: Great stay
text: If you like variety at your choice of hotel, look no further.  These chaps have no less than 3 outlets to enjoy a good cocktail or brew.
