The hotel is in the lower east side close to Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown. I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this deal but I was pleasantly surprised. The service was superb. I would definitely come back. Cheers.

title: Relaxing Stay
text: A smooth business trip at the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown. People were most helpful and well informed on best local eats. My only gripe was the restaurant wasn't open for lunch, not convenient when it's raining, still I would recommend a visit.

title: Estancia excepcional
text: Nos alojamos en el Wyndham Garden en el lado este más bajo hace un par de semanas en una gran oferta en línea. Reservamos un piso alto con el trato que obtuvimos y nuestra vista era increíble. Se podía ver todo el horizonte de Nueva York.He estado en la ciudad de Nueva York muchas veces, pero nunca he tenido una vista como esta. El hotel incluso tenía algunas opciones de comida, aunque solo nos aventuramos al Beer Garden. Lo recomiendo mucho Todos fueron muy amables, gracias chicos.

title: Last stay in Chinatown
text:
No room service available, the listed parking is actually a block away. Also had an upgraded room, but if that was an upgrade I would have hated the actual room. 
On a positive note, the person at the front desk when we checked in was very helpful.

title: Excellent value- clean and well situated
text: Sean and Nadine were very hospitable. Clean room and bathroom. Easy to walk to everything in Chinatown and little Italy. Beautiful view from rooftop bar. I’ll definitely stay here again when coming to Manhattan

title: Sean is the man!!
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed here for her Bday weekend.  Upon arrival Sean and Nadine was super cool greeted us with a smile and handshakes....we got there at 1 but check in was at 3 but he got us in early and got us an upgrade with a room with balcony!   

We left to get a bottle of champagne when we got back there were two drink tickets for us thanks guys!  

Overall staff was super nice even the maintenance guy took my ice bucket from my hand and got me ice when I was walking around looking for the machine.

The hotel itself is in a great location in the heart of Chinatown and walking distance to little Italy.  We caught a show at Duane Park which is right up the street and came back to chill at the Wyndham rooftop bar with sweeping views of the NYC skyline.  Amazing stay will go back (P.S I worked for Marriott for 6 years in the past)

title: Very accommodating and firendly
text: I can't believe how time flies. My family and I had the nicest experience at the Wyndham several months ago. The staff couldn't have been more firendly and accommodating to us and our kids. I'm sorry to say I cannot recal the Asian gentlemans name that assisted us when we arrived but they we super nice and well informed. We hope to be back in the spring. Thank you.

title: Extremely friendly and accomodating staff
text: Very, very, very great stay. Sean, Stacey, and all the other staff at the hotel were super friendly and found us a room with an incredible view. Room was very neat and clean, housekeeping did an awesome job. Great location too. Definitely booking a room here the next time I come to NYC.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I stayed here for a friends wedding and had an excellent stay. It is a very beautiful and clean hotel. From calling ahead to ask question, to checking in and asked for extra towels, the staff was amazing. Thank you!

title: Great Views
text: Upper story rooms have great views up the Bowery toward 3rd Avenue and beyond.  If you want to be near Chinatown, this is definitely the best-looking hotel in the immediate area.  Would stay again, for the views.

title: Recent stay at Wyndham
text:
overall experience has been good. However if you can improve the lighting on the working table. The current light is very dim and not supportive to work. 
2) water bottles are provided only on day 1. However if you can provide everyday one is good. for morning coffee.

title: Excellent stay
text: Beautiful views out of the hotel, with a very convenient bar on the 18th floor with even better views and good drinks! Had a great stay. Close enough to walk to lower Manhattan and the 9/11 Memorial, and with lots of great places in Chinatown to eat.

title: Fantastico
text: La ubicación es ideal, estás a 20 minutos andando del puente de Brooklyn y a 10 min del de Manhattan. Estás a dos calles de Little Italy y muy cerca del Soho. Puedes coger a una calle la boca de metro que te lleva a uptown. La seguridad en El Barrio es buena. Hemos estado con una niña de 6 años y la verdad es que los hemos sentido tranquilos. Recomendable al 100%

title: Great reception!
text: Sean & Ray greeted me so graciously! They were so accommodating and gave me a free room upgrade with a balcony to see the evening's fireworks. The room was very clean and had a great view! We had a party at rooftop 93 and the space is amazing with great views! I also slept very well!

title: Convenient, clean, friendly
text: This hotel is in a convenient location for both Brooklyn and Manhattan. Room was comfortable. A few niggles - faucet came away from the wall - but this was quickly resolved by the staff. The staff were in fact all very friendly and helpful, including checking me in early after an overnight flight/early arrival. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff - especially Yumarie - were really friendly and helpful. I would stay again.

title: 5 days in the heart of Chinatown
text:
Excellent location in the heart of bustling Chinatown. Close to Little Italy (or what's left of it) and the Lower East Side with old New York land marks. 
Our room was simple but clean and comfortable. Service friendly, accommodating, and really helpful.

title: Business Wise
text: I'm reminded why I brands almost always out perform one offs. The Wyndham was spot on with service and everything else I needed for my short business trip to NYC. Great location, fitness room, staff and view. Keeping it on my radar. Almost forgot, they had like three or four places to eat, I only managed to visit two.

title: Goed verblijf.
text: Goed verblijf. Kamers zijn klein maar worden elke dag goed schoongemaakt. Nieuwe handdoeken en bedlinnen indien gewenst. Beer garden beneden is prima om even uit te razen. Kamers met uitzicht op de stad zijn het beste! Chinatown ook erg leuk

title: Lovely Hotel.
text: I had thr pleasure of staying here forn2 weeks.  The hotel itself is beautiful.  The staff are amazing.   I wish the Wifi was stronger and faster.  The location is just about perfect.  Being in Chinatown and a few blocks from Little Italy the food selection was out of this world.  Pictures are views from my 16th floor room.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: What a nice change. My partner and I decided to treat ourselves to a night in the city away from home and decided on staying downtown at the Windham. Definitely the right choice, people were friendly and knowledgeable about where to eat and what to see. It was a great vibe, my only complaint was getting lunch, restaurant opened a little later than we are used to but with so many options in Little Italy and Chinatown, it really wasn't bad.

title: Great attention and service.
text: The beds are comfortables and the employees are awesome, Jose the employee has been very responsible and humble with me and my friend. We arrived Tuesday and since we enter to the hotel both of us were feeling secure and in good hands. 5 or more stars for the hotel.

title: Great deal and view
text: I was lucky enough to remember this place this time. I stayed here last year and had the best time. There are so many great deals in the city this time of year but sometimes you get what you pay for. This place was a great bargain with the coolest views. The folks here just as great, always helpful and very friendly. Will not forget to come back.

title: GREAT Service... Decent Rooms....Horrible Food & beverage situation
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights just after new years before flying back home. 

Great central location as long as you don;'t mind the normal "chaos" of China town. 

We found the service from the staff amazing and the rooms were great, with a few exceptions.

1 - Only a coffee pod machine and paper cups in rooms - don't expect glasses, cutlery and a kettle. 
2 - The fold out bed in the lounge was horrible! Staff arranged a roll-away free of charge immediately, but don't expect even a 7 year old to be able to sleep on the fold out lounge-bed!
3 - DO ( repeat ) DO NOT expect tohave breakfast in this hotel. It is "served" in the adjoining Ramen bar... at bar-stools ( so really bad for small kids ) and the food is literally microwaved. Do yourself a favour and find a local diner!

title: This hotel is the shiznit!
text:
Seriously, if you're in NYC and need a place to stay and you also wanna be near Chinatown then I highly advise this place. My room was small but comfier than a mothaf***a. It was really clean and the view from the 16th floor was beautiful. I visited NYC for 2020 presidential candidate Andrew Yang's fundraiser event happening next door at the Bowery Beer Garden. Real talk, if Yang becomes our 46th president and everyone gets $1,000 a month then I'm definitely coming back to this hotel several times. That's how great my stay was. I mean, I wanna come back anyway but it'll probably be a long time from now because of finances and stuff. 

But yeah, great hotel. They've got a bar and restaurant right next door and an Asian restaurant inside the lobby area. Rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. The pricing was good even for a last minute reservation like mine. I highly recommend this place.

title: Great Spot
text: Ryan was fantastic. The room was great and the view was amazing. A quick walk to Little Italy to one of our favorite restaurants and best cannolis! We will defiantly stay here the next time we are in the city.

title: Many places to Explore nearby
text: Wonderful stay! Nice location where you can walk to the Bowery, Little Italy and Chinatown and explore some really cool places. The room was nice but the staff - Ray (check-in), Kumare and Connie (housekeeping) to everyone that quickly answered all requests was just amazing and awesome. Some nice restaurants in the hotel as well and parking (offsite) was very reasonable. Only thing missing was a pool!

title: Downtown mit grandiosem Blick nach Uptown
text: Wir waren über Silvester in Manhattan ( kann ich niemanden empfehlen) das Wyndham Garden liegt Bowery Ecke Hester Street mitten in chinatown ! Gleich in der Nähe liegen die subwaystation Bowery und Grand Street ! Das Hotel ist sauber, das Personal freundlich und die Lage für Ausflüge  zu Fuß nach downtown top ! Der Rest ist mit der Subway optimal in kurzer Zeit erreichbar ! nach JFK-Airport nehmt Bowerystation die Line J bis Jamaika 🤓

title: Mixed
text:
Wyndham in Chinatown ia at a grate location, with all the conveniences need for a great stay. plus plus plus 
however two things gave me mixed feelings:
the cleanliness of the room they do not dust there was dust build up on the mantles. so for someone like me with dust allergies not good , i am always prepared so i dealt with it...
2. it depends on who u get at the front desk determines how helpful they are .... i would like to take the opportunity to thank STACY at the front desk for going beyond to assist with information and directions and overall willingness to make my stay comfortable.... Thank you Stacy.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Gilbert and Rifang were excellent guides to our first time in New York . Would definitely stay here again . Thanks guys for your warm hospitality will for sure recommend to friends and family. Best New Years trip

title: Excellent NYE Visit
text: Stacey at the front desk took care of my brother and I during our stay. It was a very pleasant experience @ Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Thank you for an awesome and comfortable experience. Keep up the good work.

title: In a word: Great
text: Had a great time during my stay in the city. . Gilbert at the front desk was very friendly and gave us a nice upgrade and we couldn’t have been more pleased. We will definitely return and be sure to recommend the hotel to others.  I only wished  breakfast stayed open until 11 not 10:30 am

title: Great visit
text: Last Jose at the front desk was amazing. Parking was a nightmare but he helped us out a lot. The room was so nice and the bathroom was very clean. The location of the hotel was also convenient. We were able to walk everywhere. Highly recommend this place!

title: Chinatown experience
text: My time in Chinatown was well spent in large part because of this hotel. Jose at the front desk was so helpful, especially with parking which I thought we would never find. The was clean and comfortable. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Great service

title: Our NYC Visit
text: My first impression of this hotel was definitely delightful. José at the front desk offered us excellent customer service. The room was also beyond what we expected. The bathroom was very clean and the beds were very comfortable.

title: Great Service
text: Jose, the guest services representative, was so helpful and informative. He helped us find parking which we all know can be difficult in this city. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a nice view of the city as well.

title: Bad beds
text: Two twin beds pushed together to make a king. So awkward and uncomfortable. There is a 200 word minimum so I am adding more reach that and then submit the review. I don’t have much else to say. I am done.

title: A very nice stay
text: Staff and hotel and accommodations were perfect for my short stay. Absolutely no complaints, although I spent very little time inside I plan to return for my next trip into NYC in the next few months.

title: Great value, awesome view
text:
The room was nice, exactly what we expected, and the bed was comfortable.  The views from the rooftop bar were phenomenal and not to be missed.  Working the shower took some finesse and the floor definitely got wet (no curtain/door to the shower stall). 

The hotel offers pet friendly rooms (we didn't need one, but saw other people using that amenity). 

Would love to see Wyndham and other hotel brands stop giving out individual soaps, etc. and instead use refillable dispensers.

This didn't really impact our trip at all, but not sure why so many hotels are installing opaque bathroom doors, doesn't make sense to me.

title: Another pleasant stay
text: I've stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown each of the last years for a couple of nights during the holiday season and enjoyed it immensely. Great location, convenient, comfortable and accommodating.

title: Excellent Service and Exquisite, Panoramic Views!
text: I stayed here In December 2019 for two nights, and I loved the hotel! The entire staff was so friendly, kind, and helpful - which exceeded my expectations! In particular, Nadine at the front desk went out of her way several times to accommodate my requests, and she was always so nice, patient, and caring. I am a single woman traveling alone, and I felt totally safe at all times in the hotel. Moreover, I was on the 12th floor with magnificent, panoramic views of the city! I especially appreciated that my room was very clean, and the bedding was pristine. Also wonderful was the Chinatown location. Although there was no valet parking, I was relieved to find free parking on the street. Highly Recommend!

title: Awesome Service and Great Location
text: Stayed here in December 2019 for a few nights. Very easy to get here from JFK via train. Jose at the front desk and the rest of his team went above and beyond in their service. 10/10 would stay here again!

title: Chinatown!
text: Great hotel! Great staff! Knowledgeable and friendly! Gilbert and Ray at the front desk were very friendly and helpful! Kumarie in housekeeping was so nice! Clean rooms and comfy beds! Cant wait to come back! Mynew home away from home!

title: Perfect Location for any NYC Trip
text: Had a great time  at this gem of a hotel.  Location is a great jump off point to all of the attractions.  It was such a unique experience to be out of "Times Square" and visit the real New York.  Beautiful Boutique hotel in a great part of Manhattan.  Highly Recommend

title: Really solid everything!
text: They really spoiled us after I mentioned my fiancé’s birthday. Free breakfast one morning and a surprise bottle of champagne. Comfy rooms, excellent views, easy to find. Complaints about the showers are kind of nonsense, don’t listen. Staff was super friendly! Gilbert lived up to his excellent reputation. We’ll 100% stay here again.

title: Had a great stay
text: Wonderful location! So many wonderful places to eat and shop.  We had a great stay at the hotel. We were pleased with our accommodations  Gilbert at the front desk was so helpful and so much fun. Definitely coming back

title: Great spot in Chinatown
text:
I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for three nights. I come to the city once a month for work and have stayed in various locations around Manhattan and this has to be one of the best locations. 

Pros: gym, comfortable bed, quiet room, clean room, nice staff 
Cons: none to really speak of 

I will likely stay here again. I want to check out their restaurant and beer garden.

title: Excellent Value and Location
text: I loved the location of the hotel. In Chinatown, but close to Little Italy and the LES. We enjoyed sitting in the park and watching the locals. Neighborhood has a cool vibe that you won’t get at a hotel in midtown. Several different Subway lines were pretty close too. The room was clean and sized about what you’d expect for NYC. My only complaint would be the lack of a proper shower curtain/door. The glass wasn’t large enough and water would get all over the bathroom floor. Overall very happy with our stay and looking forward to staying here again on our next trip.

title: Santa con
text: Gilbert and Ryan are amazing...helped us with room food and taxis...fantastic attention and attitude... great location for lower Manhattan. Really reasonable pricing for this busy time of year! Will recommend to our friends and will use in future often.  Parking easy near by and get discounts from hote

title: Lower Manhattan
text: Decent hotel. Good area.  Gilbert at the front desk was fantastic. Good football conversation. Go Eagles! Only gripe was the price. Little high for the offerings, but it’s the holidays in NYC. Would come back during a less busy time.

title: Brilliant service!
text:
We have stayed in the Wyndham Garden Chinatown twice before when visiting New York - so the fact that we keep going back is a recommendation in itself.

On this most recent occasion I just want to highlight an excellent piece of Customer Service. Having already checked out of the hotel, we returned to see if we could book a room for an additional day as my wife started to feel unwell. Despite the hotel being fully booked, Gilbert on the front desk was amazing and managed to find us a room that we could use for a few hours until my wife felt a little better. I honestly don't know what we would have done without his help. Absolutely brilliant!

title: New York City
text: Staff was very helpful in trying to do an early checkin to allow me to get over my car sickness, as well as, finding some ginger ale. Stayed on the 11th floor with an amazing view. Bed super comfortable and refreshing after long day of exploring the city. Hotel is close to all of the must see lower Manhattan sites; Wall Street, Ground ZERO, Freedom Tower, 9/11 museum. Close to delicious, mouth watering meals: Gray Dog for Brunch, Luna for local authentic Italian pizza or pasta, Katz deli for amazing pastrami and corned beef, Dunwells for Peanut butter jelly donut juat to name a few. Two complaints: noodle restaurant within the restaurant advertises closing at 12am but did last call for food and drinks at 11:15pm, would prefer a glass door that completely closes shower off feom bathroom to keep heat in the shower and water off the floor.

title: Christmas trip in Chinatown
text: The beds were very comfortable and the room spacious. I liked that bc we had 3 people, there was at least a king bed and a double, so if someone wanted to sleep alone they could. The floor to ceiling windows on the corner units were great. Floors 12 and up offer a better skyline View though as the ones below provide a view of the building walls, which is to be expected.  The shower was a little unusual as there is no door or shower curtain and water went all over the bathroom floor which could potentially cause a slippery fall. The room and hotel were clean. Gilbert at the front desk was very helpful and offered a local deli for delivery when we had exhausted all options one night. The rooftop bar was very fun as well. The outdoor part is closed during the winter though. Would be nice to have heaters for those who would like to be outdoors.  Very close to the subway entrance for B,D trains. About a 10 minute walk for others. Close to little Italy and 9/11 memorial. The nearest Starbucks is about a 10 min walk as well.

title: Excellent Views, Beds are great too
text: This was my 10th time staying at this property. For the Christmas season, the location was perfect, with easy access to Upper Manhattan, but out of the crazy crowds. There are 2 Subways Stations just a few minutes walk from the hotel, and numerous excellent restaurants in the area. The hotel staff, especially Lindsay and Diane in the Sales Department, go out of their way making sure everything goes smoothly, which, being with a large group, was extremely important. The Rooftop Bar, Beer Garden downstairs were both bonuses to my stay. The beds were very comfortable and the view at night, especially laying in bed with the large windows, was stunning.I look forward to another stay there in the near future!

title: Janet Garris
text: Was nice but the shower did not work. Kinda small room and the comforter was heavy and hot- the food downstairs was great- not sure if we would come back at that location just rather stay up near Times Square and Rockefeller’s center for the things we want to do! But enjoyed it!

title: WYNDHAM GARDEN CHINATOWN
text: Great Hotel with wonderful staff.  Any questions or directions they were happy to help us. Beautiful views and the location is perfect. Stayed here the last 4 years and had great service everytime. Shopping and Eating right down the street.

title: Great service & super clean
text: 2nd time staying at this hotel. Once again it was an amzing experience. Very clean. Staff is helpful and friendly. Excellent location. Amazing views from the rooftop bar! Close to many restaurants and subway stops. Will be back!

title: Excelente
text: En el corazón de Chinatown un lugar con  la mejor atención, vistas inigualables desde el balcón y habitación muy cómoda, único detalle la ducha que le falta presión pero con todo lo bueno que tiene en atención, servicio, limpieza, comodidad del colchón y espacio  pasa desapercibido. Lugar recomendado

title: Perfect stay
text: Stayed in the Wyndham garden hotel, very very nice would recommend to anyone looking for a city break. I would like to personally thank our house cleaner kumarie for keeping our room clean and tidy every day to a very high standard, what a lovely lady she is and absolute credit to the hotel team. Thank you very much Wyndham garden

title: Completely a brilliant suit,hotel,stay
text: This hotel was a sidestep as we were put in a different hotel that didn’t meet a 1/10 standards. Then we booked room at the Wyndham. Get the 7th floor. Yeah you don’t have the top view but you have a shared balcony with an amazing outside view of the city. The room is clean and very comfortable. The bed is the best hotel bed I’ve ever slept on. The location is near the subway and next to china town/ little Italy so perfect for eating and shops. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

title: Great location
text: We’ve stayed here 5 times already & will continue to return. The location for us is great, the staff are all very nice & accommodating. The rooftop bar is nice to have drinks & has a nice view of the city. We always enjoy our stay here.

title: Great experience at Wyndham Chinatown!!!
text: The hotel location is great, walkable to most restaurants in Chinatown, and close to subway. Although the room is not spacious, but the room is neat and clean. I was completely thrilled with a complimentary early check-in by Ms. Nadine. She was very friendly and helpful. Looking forward for another visit soon.

title: Great location for shopping and eating
text: I booked my tickets on a app that gave hotel the choice to choose our room but they were gracious enough to give me and my girlfriend a really good room to accommodate for her birthday weekend . Great staff, Ryan took care of us with absolute professionalism .

title: Un séjour réussi
text:
Un séjour réussi pour un groupe de 14 personnes avec organisation d'un diner dans une salle privée au 17 ème étage avec vue le skyline de New York, cela vaut le déplacement !
Le personnel a été très agréable de la réservation des chambres et de l'organisation et de l'exécution de notre soirée.

title: The Wyndham Garden —
text:
Very nice hotel. Lobby was clean. Stuff was courteous. I would refer my family and friends to stay at this hotel since Christmas and New Year’s Eve is coming up. I visited the Wyndham in Rego Park too and that hotel was nice too. My Aunt’s room was beautiful, clean and modern. Especially the bathroom. The bathroom was modern and well maintained too. 

Patricia H.

title: Chinatown sufficient
text: Arrived early and was welcomed by Gilbert who was kind enough to allow me to check in earlier than 3 pm. Thank you Gilbert! Check in was quick and efficient. Once in my room I quickly found out how convenient a location this is. Near little Italy and Soho. I attended an art venue not too far away. Once I returned, I visited the rooftop bar which had amazing views of the city and the crowd was lively. Overall I enjoyed my stay very much. The staff was very friendly and the room was sufficient for my needs. My only complaints were the elevator from the street to the lobby was out of service so I had to bring my luggage up the stairs, I was fortunate that a porter was available to assist me. My second concern was the heat in my room. It was not working properly. I had to call and have an engineer check it for me. Luckily after some effort, it was fixed. Overall, the staff was extremely pleasant and my overall stay was a good one. It is one of the better hotels in an area that does not have too many. Would recommend.

title: Business
text: Stacey was very pleasant and accommodating!!!! My bags were held securely until my room was ready. The hotel is well kept and modern. The location is great! No complaints. Thank you for a great stay!!

title: Great view and great staff
text:
I was really happy with the staff at this hotel!  I lost my license on my flight to JFK and I was worried that I wouldn't be allowed to check in.  I was on a red eye flight and didn't get to the hotel until 2AM.  Luckily, the friendly person at the front desk was able to check me in and even gave me an upgrade to a corner room on a high floor.  The view from my room was amazing.  I opened all of the curtains and decided to wake up to the view of New York.

I had to have my passport over nighted to the hotel and the staff was so friendly and called me as soon as my passport arrived and kept it in a safe place until I was able to get it.

The location of this hotel is great.  I did a lot of walking and made it to Central Park, Broadway, and the Met on foot.  If you're relatively healthy, you can get to a lot of tourist destinations on foot from this hotel.

Overall, I am very happy with my stay here and the fact that the staff went above and beyond to help me.

title: Very Welcoming Start!
text: Thanks to Jose for the help early morning during check in. His greeting was a very comforting smile. He provided an excellent start to our day by explaining our accommadations and providing a travel gudie and other offers.

title: Nice place
text: Great location. Small and close to everything I needed. Check out the rooftop bar. Gilbert and Stacey were great at the desk. Rooms a little small, but it’s New York, so as long as you have a bed...... Will come again.

title: Perfect for Manhattan
text: The corner room was great with super views to the west and south. Guys on reception often worked long shifts but were always helpful - helped with early check-in AND late checkout in a friendly and courteous way. Special thanks though goes to Leonora who was working on floor 10 and kept my room just as I wanted it - as well as helping with late checkout. its staff like Leonora that make a difference to me and will have me coming back.

title: Buisiness trip
text: Excellent hotel. Very friendly staff. Very accommodating. Kumarie was an awesome housekeeper. She did an amazing job. I definitely look forward to going back. The bed was super comfortable and the balcony view was awesome.

title: Great location, staff and hotel room
text: We arrived this past weekend and got into Manhattan a little earlier than expected - the staff (Ryan in particular) did a great job in allowing us to check-in early and provided us with everything we needed throughout the trip. The staff helped us with all our requests promptly, and made the trip memorable by helping passing on a gift to one of us sent to our hotel room by a friend for a birthday. The hotel room was a good size for Manhattan, and was clean and modern. Location was excellent, as it is close to tonnes of shops, restaurants, a short walk to the subway (5-10 minutes), and right on bus lines. Our trip was excellent, and we would definitely come back again on our next trip to New York City.

title: Great location
text: Given the limitations of space in the city, the room was fairly comfortable.  The location of the hotel was within walking distance including 9/11 museum/memorial, Little Italy, Greenwich Village and of course, Chinatown.  Ryan at the desk was extremely helpful.

title: Great place in the heart of china town
text: This place was so much fun.  In the heart of China town and only a couple blocks from little Italy. There is so much culture and good food surrounding you. The hotel it self was very clean and had beautiful floor to ceiling windows.  I will stay here again.

title: In town for a wedding
text: Not so familiar with NYC.  Luckily the host hotel was the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.  Ryan was at the front desk and checked us in.  He welcomed us, answered a few questions, and pointed us in the right direction.  Thank you Ryan for getting our stay in New York off to such a good start.  We loved the hotel’s location and ambiance.  Only complaint; the shower was weak.... but I understand that is a problem in NYC.

title: Would not give this hotel a four star rating!
text:
My husband wanted to go to New York for the San Gennaro Festival.  He is disabled so I was looking for a hotel close to Little Italy and Chinatown.  I originally booked the "special offer" for the room and parking on the hotel website which reads, "Parking in New York City is no problem with our special travel package. Enjoy a stay in our plush accommodations with an upgrade to Deluxe Queen Empire View room (when available), a $15 credit to Grab and Go, and complimentary valet parking right here at our downtown Manhattan hotel. What could be easier? Package is based on availability, and black out dates may apply. Standard hotel cancellation and deposit policy apply."  

My husband decided we should take the train instead.  When we got to the hotel I asked them to honor the day's prevailing room rate of $284.00 because we did not drive and I was not going to use their parking.  They said they did not see the parking on the room and they could not accommodate my request.  They DID NOT give me the $15 credit to "Grab and Go."  All they gave me the manager's business card so I could try to contact him after the stay.  They were not "helpful" at all.  The room was not what I would consider a "Deluxe Empire Queen Room;" there was barely enough room to turn around in it.  My final charge for just the room was $427.56 for one night; $369.55 was the room fee plus tax.  I don't think I will be going to New York City again any time soon.  The rooms are ridiculously small and expensive.

title: new york china town
text: Nice room, great windows with nice views. Construction on streets out front ruined things a bit, but never the less this was a nice hotel. Pub on the property let us enjoy some local sports, nevver ate at restaurant . Staff was really friendly and helpfull.

title: 2.5 star hotel at most
text: Somehow Priceline called the Wyndham Chinatown hotel in NYC a 4 star hotel. It’s absolutely not. My husband’s taking a shower right now in a stream of water that wouldn’t be viable to wash a small dog. The room is tiny. The duvet cover doesn’t entirely cover the quilt so you actually sleep with and see the polyester comforter which lays over the scratchy sheets. The air has been on all night despite messing with the thermostat. Plus side- one wall of the room is floor to ceiling windows! Location interesting, trafficky, noisy and crowded, but then we never stay in the Chinatown area- and pretty sure not again- at least in this hotel. I think I prefer staying in Tribeca or Midtown, just as convenient. Oh well, it was for one night. Not a tragedy just not what it claimed to be.

title: Good Location
text: Good location short distance to 3 subway stations. Front desk workers were helpful ,the room was clean and had enough space. The negative was the shower set up, it has a half door which allows water to spill into the bathroom and on the floor.

title: Great rooms, great vies and great service!
text:
Straight away when we got to the hotel we were excepted by Pedro at the hotel desk.
Pedro made sure everything we needed was taken care of and that our stay in the hotel would be as pleasures as possible.

title: Just right
text:
Great location, close to subway & many sites within walking distance.  Near little Italy, too.
Roomy rooms by NY standards. Ceiling to floor Windows provide amazing view of the city & Empire State bldg is lovely at night.
Clean & quiet

title: Surprise Cost
text: Arrived at the Wyndham hotel with my family, parked in front, and asked the hotel concierge if it was ok to be parked there for a moment to unload and check in. Concierge looked at my vehicle and affirmed that it was in a guest loading spot. 10 minutes later, returned to the car to find a pricey parking ticket waiting, despite hotel advisement. Multiple hotel staff, including managers, told me that they'd assist in fighting the ticket in acknowledgment of the error. The hotel did not help me fight the ticket and did not answer any of my emails regarding inquiry into the matter. The Wyndham hotel did not stand by its word to assist in a matter for which the hotel otherwise acknowledged fault.

title: Great weekend
text: The staff helped me greatly at check in. There was some confusion with the parking garage and the concierge helped me straighten everything out. It was a very clean and enjoyable stay. I would definately stay here again on my next visit

title: Visiting for an event
text: Room was excellent, great view of the city skyline!! We arrived early, and Jose offered us an early check upgrade to $30.  Very accommodating and full of NYC class you don’t normally find.  Highly recommend staying here.  Will definitely stay again.

title: Visiting for an event.
text: Great service!!!! Was help by Jose. Very helpful and attentive to our needs. Hope to come back soon.The rooms were great. The lobby looks clean. Music very chill and relax modern environment. Everything is close making thing very convenient.

title: Amazing experience
text: Last minute trip to New York, great staff and pleasant,  Jose was awesome and patient and was willing to help us find a room. for your help. Will deff come back. The place is beautiful and neat, very convenient.

title: My stay
text: Overall great hotel and good location to places to see and eat at. Staff was very professional and friendly. The maid assigned to my room did an outstanding job and was very professional and on top of her job.  Staff was always able to answer any questions and provide recommendations when needed. Definitely would stay their again. Only down fall was no microwave in the room.

title: Great stay in a good location
text: While my stay was for business, I would have no problem staying here again with the family to take in the sights. The proximity to great attractions and fun things to do, plus convenience of the subway a few blocks away allows you to get to more.

title: Heat not included?
text: The temperature dropped to the mid forty’s with a high in the sixties during the day. My room was 64 degrees. When I told the front desk I didn’t have heat I was told the heat “wasn’t turned on yet”. This is unacceptable. I paid for a comfortable room and didn’t receive one.

title: Nice Hotel. Convenient
text: Loud outside, because NYC. Shower didnt have a door and opened to the bathroom. Floor gets wet during shower. Not just a little wet. Like soaking a towel wet. I would stay again. Ramen bar was good. Beer garden was adequate.

title: José el mejor trabajador de hotel de Nueva York
text: Gran experiencia en este hotel muy bien situado en Chinatown y con un personal muy amable y siempre pendiente de nuestra estancia en el hotel y la ciudad, José la persona encargada en el hotel por las noches nos ayudó y recomendó de todo y siempre superó nuestras expectativas en todo, muchas gracias

title: Perfect Stay
text: This hotel was perfectly located in China Town and Little Italy. It is within great walking distance of many areas and landmarks as well as within 2 blocks of the subway. The hotel was very clean. Breakfast is really good. The staff are friendly and helpful. If I’m ever back in New York I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: Clean, new, modern. Clean linen, hot powerful shower, central location in the heart of China town and little Italy. Reasonable parking for Manhattan. Great restaurants in the neighborhood. Easy to find

title: Great views and location
text: Comfortable rooms with good views and location. Ramen bar was the best ever! The beer and sake selection was super awesome and the ramen was so delicious. The location is right in the middle of everything and close to everything.

title: Hôtel efficace
text:
Grand bâtiment neuf à Chinatown proche de Soho et du Sud de Manhattan.
Les chambres sont bien conçues :entre le vrai sèche cheveux et le fer et sa table à repasser rien ne manque, les lits sont confortables et la salle de bain parfaite .
Le ménage est fait consciencieusement.Bowery est assez bruyant la nuit des boules Quies pourraient être utile comme dans une grande partie de la ville. Le bierGarden est très animé le vendredi et samedi soir sans être dérangeant.Nous avons passé une semaine très agréable.

title: For a NYC hotel, spacious, comfortable, cost reasonable, etc. It is my new go-to place when I travel to NYC for business
text:
EOM above. 
For a NYC hotel, spacious, comfortable, cost reasonable, etc. It is my new go-to place when I travel to NYC for business. Sean Sy, Guest Sevices Manager was excellent. He even gave me my room a little early so I could get myself comfortable for meetings, etc. Cheers!

title: Unethical Hotel
text: I prepaid the reservation with another card; however, for the deposit, I used another one, and the hotel charged me again from the other card just like nothing happened. After I complained, the hotel said they would resend the money to me. Yes, they send the money to me, but after a day, they again took the money from me without any notice.

title: Very good for the price!
text:
Very good for the price!!!!!!

Had a very welcoming reception at this hotel, staff if very friendly and professional.

They have a nice rooftop bar with a view.

Room is clean and nice. Best option for the price around NYC.

I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: A clean, comfortable, and pleasant stay
text: I stayed overnight for a business trip nearby and was very happy with this Wyndham.  The front desk was efficient and pleasant, explaining everything without overdoing it.  The room itself is spacious by New York City standards, was very clean (hat tip to Kumarie, the lady who I ran into who handled my room), and was well-appointed.  Second room floors (maybe others) have a shared balcony that overlooks Chinatown.  Lots to do nearby.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great Location
text: Nice room with balcony and great rooftop bar! Beer Garden was okay for beer, but not much in the way of wine.  Check in and check out was very quick and easy.  My only complaint, a worker knocked on my door at 8am Saturday to exchange the fridge, which I supposedly requested.  I did not.

title: Beware of cleaning staff
text:
I was here for 6 nights. On my third day we came back to the room and my phone charger was missing.  After talking to front desk and the manager, they asked me to email them with my version of the story.  I told them that I didnt feel safe, that I didnt want enyone else entering the room.

In the hallway, I confronted a member of the cleaning staff and after inspecting the cleaning cart, he managed to pull out the charger from a bag. I didnt get any sort of apology and I had to let the cleaning staff again into my room since it was a busy season (fashion week) and couldnt change hotels that easily. However avery day we had a slight worry about our belongings.

title: Perfect venue
text: Great little hotel in the heart of Chinatown close to subway lines and walking distance to World Trade Centre site and Federal Plaza, museums of Indian and African history, Wall Street etc.....great clean rooms, bar up on the roof and a little eatery plus heaps of Chinese restaurants...just perfect.

title: Friendly service and a clean room
text: The front desk staff was always  friendly and helpful. The room was clean but  a bit dark and cold when entering into it. However, after setting the temperature to the desired degree, it was fine. The shower handle was too tight and difficult to turn on/off.  There was no luggage stand to put  a  suit case which was inconvenient.

title: Good hotel for a decent price.
text: The staff from check-in desk were accommodating. The internet was working as it should, and I can not complain about anything. The rooms were some a bit tights, but it was ok... not that you are spending too much time there, right?

title: Nice rooms but watch your billing / receipt
text: The room was clean, the support staff (making up beds, making sure you know when checkout is) were very efficient and the service was good.  But the check-in/check-out were "okay."  Not a warm reception, seemed pre-occupied upon check in, didn't ask about our stay upon check out and didn't offer a receipt upon check out.  The final bill did not reflect the two charges made to the visa account. And the charges were made upon checking in, rather than upon check out.

title: Clean hotel, well-priced, not much beyond that.
text:
I have stayed here a few times in the past for the convenience, competitive price, cleanliness and location. 

Within a few hours of our first night on this trip, our smoke alarm went off. I called the front desk multiple times with no luck. A 'Hotel Engineer' came up, peeked his head in, and said hold on. Another 10 minutes past with the blaring, ear deafening alarm. Another hotel service person came up, and tried to radio it off remotely with someone at a panel on another floor. The panel was "too far" away someone yelled on the walkie talkie. Another 10 minutes of the ear piercing alarm went off, the man returned, pried the alarm off the wall (not a typical battery smoke alarm, but one of the large dome shaped official city alarms), and did something with a screw driver to turn it off. We were told taking a hot shower caused it to go off as the bathroom fan relies on a natural roof exhaust (not a motor fan). We were instructed to shower with low heat showers and to keep our hotel door open when we showered going forward? I can't think of a more vulnerable way and place to shower.  The front desk never followed up, apologized or offered any form of a coherent explanation as to why the deafening loud alarm went off for 20 minutes. It may have even been a fire alarm or carbon monoxide detector, but we didn't die so I guess it was neither.  

The service here is poor. It has been sort of average in the past and I was always willing to overlook that for the price and room cleanliness, but when we are talking about emergency indicators and consistently grumpy personnel, I had to speak up. Additionally, because of the Beer Garden and Ramen Bar on the first floor, there is now an ottoman sized cologne diffuser in the lobby which is bordering on intoxicating in how strongly perfumed and repulsive the scent it fills the lobby with. I imagine this diffuser is to the mask the smells of the two eateries, which it does successfully, but with the price of wanting to pinch your nose in the lobby.

We also saw an old lady struggle to pass through the main glass revolving lobby door with her rolling luggage as the side doors instruct you to always use the revolving door. She kept getting stuck, waved for help to the woman at the front desk and who responded by rolling her eyes, remaining at her station and yelling "Thats why I told you to use the door!". 

The rooms are clean, location is great, the hotel is modern and well-priced, but I am now reluctant to stay again

We had a great stay. The location was great. The room was comfortable .  Easy check in and friendly staff. Thank you Gilbert for your assistance. Will definitely return and recommend the hotel to others.

title: Staff was rude
text: The front desk staff was very rude and unhelpful. We were on the elevator going up to our room one day and the staff smashed on with a bunch of chairs and literally had the chairs falling over on top of us.

title: Nearest chinatown
text:
Wyndham Garden from central NYC, is very accessible with subway and busses. Chinatown is a little bit 
right across canal street where China town starts. The hotel has an elevator on the street level for your luggage and for PWD who cannot climb the stairs or on wheelchair. If you are joining a Chinese tour Canal street is just accross where you get your tour buses to the different tours in the east coast.

title: Overnight
text: We arrived by car expecting a portico so we could unload baggage before driving to the nearby garage (the hotel lacks a garage) since that's our experience everywhere else. There is no portico or even room to stop conveniently in the street.  We drove on to the garage and toted our bags back to the hotel. Registration was quick and simple and the room was comfortable though smallish reminding us more of hotels we've stayed at in Europe. We were there for one night for a family party and getting to Chinatown was through dense traffic.

title: great place
text: hotel is great. Staff is very helpful. Location is great. located near everything I need to be close to.  excellent place to stay. We will definitely stay here again. This place is a gem in the lower part of manhattan

title: Good hotel and room
text: We came for preparing our wedding next day. The front desk staff was very nice to give us an update to a higher and much better room. Thank Jose from Wyndham for the complimentary upgrade and we had a good night here.

title: 賓至如歸
text: 酒店前台的接待員Stacy熱情有禮，令人賓至如歸。酒店是新近建成，所以酒店用具新淨，房間設計為住客著想貼心。房間整㓗，睡床舒適。酒店就在唐人街，附近食肆林立，選擇很多，多中式餐館，也有很多小型超市，購買日用品方便。交通也很方便，附近有subway站，到Brooklyn Bridge非常方便，行去只需大約十分鐘，在大橋上可以看到紐約美景，是到紐，約很值得推薦的項目。如果再來紐約，一定再會選擇住這間酒店。

title: Great Service
text: Josè did an awesome job showing us where to go and where to eat.  The location and views are great, close to little Italy and right in Chinatown with a variety of goods to select!  Josè has made our stay even better!

title: Customer service
text:
JOSE has helped us so much. We came in a love trip and he has helped me on city tips and great hotel room! Amazing service! New york city is certainly better experience when you know exactly
where to go and have transportations all set. Ask for Jose!!!!

title: Pedro was awesome!!!
text: Excellent service! This is my second time staying here and he was excellent both times. Wonderful customer service! I will definitely be back! Thank you Pedro! We had a great room with great views. I love it here!!!

title: Bad Smell and Low Quality
text: The room smelled bad and cigarette smell came through the vents every night. Handle on ice bucket didn't work, no ice bags provided, hotel phone didn't work and staff interrupted our sleep 2 days later to fix it despite 'do not disturb' sign on the door. Customer service was non existent. The bed felt smaller than a queen but can't be for sure.

title: Ask for Jose!
text:
Jose was awesome, checked us in and was very pleasant! Outstanding service!

The check in process was very smooth and quick, room was clean and quiet. Customer service was exceptional. We will definitely stay here again, talk to Jose!

title: Easy stay!
text: You guys are great! Not only did you deliver on a good and comfortable stay but you also gave us excellent service. This made the already good deal on the rate we got even better. Our only minor issue was breakfast, a little slow but nothing to keep us from ever returning.

title: Возьмите дороже, но в хорошем месте
text:
Брали отель из-за относительно приемлемой  цены и расположения в China towne. Прогадали во всем. Большая ванная комната,  вентиляция в которой не работает, и вода растекается полу и на нем остается все время. То есть 2 взрослых человека принимают душ и вся эта влага идет в номер. 
Любим Азию, надеялись вкусно поесть китайской, вьетнамской еды.. Бродить по улицам china towne расхотелось из-за грязи и вони.
Да, отель расположен в относительной близости к 4м станциям метро. Но, сэкономленные на хорошем отеле 50$ привели к полному разочарованию.

title: Family vacation
text: Great location, close to little Italy and China town. Rooftop bar has incredible view of night time skyline. Staff always were friendly and helpful. Close to subway and hop on hop off bus stop. Bed very comfortable.

title: visita nyc
text: fuimos a neva york con mi nieto a pasar dias inolvidables, la experiencia inicio alojandonos en el hotel muy cerca del lugar  donde dev¿biamos tomar nuestro primer tour, lo cual fue muy conveniente para nosotros

title: Good stay
text: It was a good stay. Staff was efficient and friendly. Facility was clean. Many standard accommodations were provided unlike many properties. Good for business purposes. Also good location but not too crowded.

title: Amazing Empathy
text: Under unfortunate circumstances, I had to travel to New York when I booked this Windam. It was convenient to a funeral I was attending. A close school friend passed away far too young. I had to get directions to the funeral home and the young lady at the desk could not have been more sympathetic about the situation. I just had to say thank you although I unfortunately did not get her name.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
Great place to stay to enjoy lower Manhattan.  We were upgraded to a king size room on the 11th floor.  Enjoyed the floor to ceiling window in our room with an amazing view on NY. The rooftop bar is two floors, small, but excellent drinks and views. We also enjoyed the Beer Garden on the first floor. Great body products. Got to enjoy the area and close enough to the Village and SoHo to enjoy those neighborhoods. 

The shower in my room was a bit of a problem.  Soapdish was about to come off the wall and the glass door/wall was not long enough to not get the entire bathroom wet.  That's a bit dangerous.   FYI - I am from NY and I was just being a tourist.

title: Third times a charm
text: I cant believe its taken me three trips to Wyndham Chinatown to finally post my review. These guys certainly deserve it, always consistently friendly and helpful. There have been some changes with parking but I was able to work it all out with there help and my bike was nice and safe. I love the rooftop top, even better thena the room view. I still owe you guys more good feedback. kudos..

title: Conveniently Located
text: The hotel was great from start to finish, rooms were very clean with some minor wear and tear. Staff was super helpful and very friendly, you could tell they were genuine about making sure you had a good stay. The beer garden was cool althought the street construction was a turn off with the exposed exterior. I would still recommend it since I'm sure they are not thrilled about the construction either. Great place to stay if lower eastside.

title: Cool Place in a Great Location
text: I booked this place on a great deal really just looking for a place to sleep and shower over the weekend. The hotel is a Wyndham which I have not tried but was really happy with after doing so. Check in was fast and professional, I had an issue being on a lower floor and they quickly took care of it. This place had a few restaurants of which I got to visit two, the rooftop bar and some sport bar on the ground level. Everyone was firendly, really down to earth and helpful with sites to visit. I recomment it and look forward to coming back.

title: Great location
text: Very nice boutique hotel right near Chinatown, Little Italy & Soho. We stayed on the 11th floor and the uptown view was beautiful. The rooms are very clean and well kept. The staff is very professional. Highly recommended

title: Excellent hotel in Chinatown
text: My daughter and I were traveling to New York to consult medical specialists. We stayed in a room with special accommodations for disabled people. The comfort, cleanliness and beautiful view were notable but the reception desk personnel were outstanding. They answered all our questions promptly and patiently.

title: one week stay by the WOLFMAN
text: This hotel is one of the best values in New York. The hotel bordering  Little Italy,Chinatown, and Soho is a great location for staying in New York. The hotel is spotless, the service is tops in customer service, the internet is so easy to access and very quick and the beds are really comfortable. I must also say how quiet the rooms were. It really is tops in value for New York City. If you stay there visit the Egg Shop for breakfast and Wayan, French Indonesian fusion, for dinner. Outstanding dinner spot, please make a res.

title: Nice
text: No frills but clean comfortable stay.   Hotel is clean, staff is very friendly, and helpful. Knock is the fact that they charged us $30 for an early check (I guess is common in NYC).  Close proximity to the NYC sites we wanted to visit!

title: Local resident
text:
Great staff Who were helpful. Was
A good stay. We Requested a quiet room and they were able to Accommodate us. We Would recommend. Accommodations  were clean and room was basic but that’s all you need.

title: Excellent stay!
text: The staff was incredibly professional and friendly. The room and view were magnificent.  What's not to like. I definitely would like staying here again in the future. This four star hotel is a must try location in NYC.

title: Cose positive e cose da migliorare.
text:
Preciso che siamo stati dirottati per un problema tecnico dalla nostra agenzia di viaggi all'ultimo momento in questo hotel.
Posizione in Chinatown abbastanza caotica, metro vicina ma con una linea non comoda per andare a downtown. Il quartiere non è dei più tranquilli, ma si è vicini a little italy ed a Broadway street.
Reception: molto professionali e disponibili sia al check in che al check out. Nel resto dei giorni siamo entrati ed usciti senza essere salutati.
Camere: noi avremo dovuto avere una premium o superior o qualcosa del genere, ma il letto era piccolino come il bagno che era anche senza appendi asciugamani. Asciugamani cambiati tutti i giorni. Acqua gratis solo il primo giorno, poi non messa in camera. Il Tè, camomilla, zucchero non controllati quotidianamente nella camera.
Niente garage, ho dovuto pagare 20 $ per 12h per una moto in un parcheggio vicino. 
Ascensori veloci. 
Tutto sommato un buon hotel, ma non 4 stelle.

title: Overall Review
text: Very clean, polished, and well-decorated. Looks like and feels like a comfortable environment to be in. Has a nice rooftop bar (it is inside) but still very cool. Very great drinks there. I booked this hotel 4 hours before I checked-in. You can use a parking garage right down the street (2 min walk) for $35 per 24 hours in cash or $40 per 24 hours if you pay with credit card.

title: Great location with fun rooftop bar!
text: I pleasantly surprised at the quality of this property given the price I paid.  Located in Chinatown, it is a short walk from several fun areas and easy access to subway.  The room was clean, the staff was friendly and the bed was comfortable.  I really enjoyed the downstairs bar (not run by hotel) where the staff was very friendly!  But the best part was the rooftop bar where you can enjoy drinks and an amazing view!

title: nice hotel, but hotel AC terrible
text: Hotel is in perfect location, however upon arriving AC was not working , room temp was 79 upon arriving. turned AC down and left for few hours and came back to room temp at 77.  Fan was provided however it was uncomfortable thru out the night. Getting ready for work next morning room temp was 77 and humid made for getting ready for work miserable. I rated sleep quality and room a 1 because it was miserable trying to sleep and get ready fro work.

title: مدينة نيويورك
text: فندق غرفه ضيقة جدا لا يصلح لعائلة ابدا،  وبخيلين جدا حتى الماء لا يوفرونه من ضمن الغرفة كتكميلي يجب علينا شراءه من ثلاجاتهم ، ولا يتوفر لديهم حتى فرشاة اسنان ومعجون الشيء المتوفر في جميع الفنادق!! لا انصح به اطلاقا

title: Not a bad stay
text: We stayed for a couple nights. The room was fresh and clean. Only a couple minor issues. The shower has no sliding door on it. It has a half door. I'm a tall guy so water naturally splashes on me. The toilet paper rolls are right next to the shower so they would get wet. The AC in the room left something to be desired. We were on the 11th floor and naturally we were there during the hottest days of summer. The room really didn't cool down past 78*. We had some spectacular views of Lower Manhattan and Midtown from the 11th floor. There is a parking garage within a 2 min walk of the hotel. No onsite parking.

title: Food
text:
Free continental breakfast not served 
That’s not good-  please include this coffee situation with hummus crackers fruit- many people  are diabetic and need an all convenient items the hotel people are nice - and kind - it is not their fault

title: Accommodating
text: Excellent customer services without questioning and understanding my situation.  Gabriel was able to providing me the request as well as an upgraded room.  Thank you so much Gabriel (Front desk supervisor).

title: Great hotel in the middle of it all!
text: I loved this hotel. Everyone is professional and courteous and the place is also pet friendly. I was upgraded to a high floor with a balcony that looked out to the Empire State building. I had a great overnight trip with my cat I was traveling with and they made me feel more than welcome.

title: Great find
text: When booking my stay I was unfamiliar with the location and the hotel. I soon found out that both far exceeded my original expectations. Great staff highly knowledgeable and courteous. Easy to walk to Chinatown and Little Italy

title: Excellent Quick Trip
text:
We came in for a quick trip to the city and it was just a magnificent stay. The hotel is very clean, in an excellent location (near subway lines too), our room had a beautiful view of the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges, and the front desk staff couldn’t have been nicer (Thanks Jose!). 

I would definitely recommend it!

title: One night stay
text: Stayed here for one night and really enjoyed it. Comfortable bed, nice view and really great value for the price. There is a rooftop which has great views as well. Thanks to Jose for the service and the great room.

title: Excellent location and amenities
text: If you are looking for a great location and excellent amenities this is the place! They offer a Rooftop Bar, a Beer Garden and a Ramen Restaurant. Excellent service was given by Jose from check in to check out. Great skyline views from the upper floor rooms, this hotel has it all.

title: A good New York Hotel
text:
Great view, great room, good service, excellent location, great bar on the roof and ground floor. The staff was very attentive and professional.
The best thing was the view from our room  it was captivating

title: Seemed great at first !
text: This hotel seemed pretty awesome at first, rooms looked clean, updated, and customer service appeared to be great. UNTIL it was time to take a shower. There were literally gnats and flies coming from the shower drain. I immediately went down to the lobby and showed an associate at the desk a video of this. She said would I like someone to come clean the room ! This was beyond that to me at this point, I felt out of respect I should be at least offered another room. She then told me no rooms were available until after 6:00 pm !!!! Mind you it was 2:00 o clock at this point ! After waiting several hours I was given a room that reeked of cigarette smoke !!!!!!! At this point, I was fed up with the service, and lack of care that was displayed and just found somewhere to stay, I lost money, but I gained peace of mind just staying somewhere else. PLEASE BEWARE !!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Well it’s not a cheap hotel , but it is very clean and the staff is very nice, near by there is the pub of the hotel and also rooftop pub , you can see all Manhattan frome there
I strongly recommend , you can also find an interesting  restaurant inside the hotel

title: Great find in Chinatown!
text:
This little hotel was the perfect location!
So convenient to everywhere!
The view from my room was amazing!
Loved the rooftop bar and the restaurants are great!
Everyone working there was extremely helpful and nice!

title: Love the location, love the rooftop, love the rooms
text: I had a great experience here, they were very hospitable and did everything they could to make my visit comfortable and entertained. I would recommend them each time in town. Jose was amazing with customer service

title: China towns best
text:
The staffs from Sean, Jose and Ray were very helpful and they made my trip comfortable and easy.
The room with the view is beautiful at night. The room was very clean and modern. The restaurant downstairs was really good. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary during Pride weekend. The hotel staff were very gay-positive to us and to the many other gay customers. They were also very pet-friendly, handled their unexpected elevator issues promptly, and the front desk and cleaning staff were all extremely helpful with many small details. Additionally, the location and view were amazing. Highly recommended.

title: Very Good
text: Jose had great customer service. Very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Helped me get checked in quick and made my trip very comfortable. I will definitely be coming back. Room was clean with a balcony. I enjoyed my stay!

title: Soho shopping trip
text: Location was perfect for shopping in Soho. Rooms were very nice. Ramen restaurant, beer garden, sweet rooftop bar all in hotel so always great options for food, drinks, partying. Jose at the front desk was a lifesaver!  Anything we asked for, he got us or arranged for us. What an accommodating, great guy!

title: Great location and awesome view!
text: Had a great stay at the Wyndham Garden Inn in Chinatown.  Location was great, close enough to work and also in a cool neighbourhood.  Jose was awesome during check-in, and his recommendation for Shinka for ramen was spot on.

title: Best Value Hotel in Manhattan
text: I was traveling with the family (we have 4 kids), and we were planning on utilizing a "cot" to try to fit into a standard room. Jose at the front desk saw this, and decided out of the blue to upgrade us to a much larger corner room with one king bed and one queen bed.  Not only did this make our day, but it made our trip!  Thanks again Wyndham Garden Chinatown, and thanks again Jose :-)

title: Great Service!
text: Came here because the Airbnb we rented for world pride had a broken AC, and this hotel had the most reasonable nearby. Nadiana checked us in and gave us a beautiful room large enough to accommodate my friends and I with a great rate! Being that we arrived hours before check-in, Jose offered to store our luggage while we checked out the neighborhood. Housekeeping was great and the rooftop bar is beautiful! A great hotel at a great value.

title: Great Place
text: This place was great.  The check in was a little slow and I think that was partially due to Hotels Tonight but partially due to the staff.  To be fair I did check in at 11 pm but still.  But other than that the place was phenomenal.  The rooms were very nice and neat somewhat chic (not a word I use often).  The restaurants and the bars, while I did not frequent them, appeared to be outstanding and their reputations preceed them.  Overall the place was amazing.

title: Average hotel with a plus
text: Nice rooms, some of them with a great view. Well located in Chinatown, near to B and D train. Plenty of restaurants around, two blocks from Little Italy. It has stairs to reach the reception and nobody helps, be adviced if you can’t carry luggage

title: A few issues !
text:
Basically a good experience except for the elevators being difficult...they most times had a mind of their own! 
Location is perfect for access to Chinatown and Little Italy, SoHo is just a few blocks away! 
The terrible coffee and spoiled milk in the Lobby Lounge!  
No place in the bathroom to set anything down!
No hooks near the shower to hang a towel or robe!  Who wants to use the toilet seat for this?
These items should be easy fixes for the management to accomplish!
Staff at front desk was very nice and accommodated us well!

title: Great room great Staff
text: I stayed here for the first time and didn’t know what to expect. The room I had was on the north west side of the building, had an amazing view of Bowery and midtown. The staff ( Stacey, Ray, and Jose) were extremely knowledgeable and accommodating, especially when I extended my stay. I’ll definitely be back. Also the on site Raman bar located on the main floor had one of the best broths that I’ve ever had. Overall a great place if you want to explore lower Manhattan.  Again a big thanks to the staff.        ~ K. Gulotta

title: Rainy days, bright view
text: Despite the rainy work week, it was a nice stay. The staff at the desk and the restaurant were super friendly not mention helpful. One of the male registration staff members which I feel bad I forgot his name,lent me an umbrella while I ran out for a near by meeting. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Business Minded
text: I had the chance to stay here again over the best Western down the street.  While I like the breakfast option at BW, it cant compare to the people here.  The front desk team is always super helpful from suggestions to anything to make your stay more enjoyable. It's fast becoming my favorite place to south of midtown. I really like the the food options and its just convenient all way around. The views are very good as well.

title: New York Getaway
text: A wonderful stay in a hotel with a great staff.  The staff was there to help us whenever needed.  Rooms are a bit small, but that is expected in New York City.  Nice size bathroom that could have used a little caulking.  Great location to get out and walk the city.  We would definitely return to this property.

title: Broken A/C - notified on the day of checkin, after I called to confirm reservation
text:
It's early/mid June in NYC. I call in to confirm the check-in around 1pm. We do so, and hang up.

3 minutes later, I get a call saying that the room has no A/C and that there are no other rooms available. We only get an offer to cancel without late charge, like it's a favor.

By that point, it's either put up (with the broken A/C) or shut up (or pay extra money for the day-of reservation at elsewhere).

title: Chinatown
text: Tha manager, Sean Sy, is a true assett to your hotel. He is kind and courteous and very generous. He gave us a free upgrade since it was my 12 year old daughter's first visit to NYC. ALL of the staff are wonderful!

title: Good choice
text: Nice hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly. Only complaint was the air conditioning was not working properly. Did open the window but room was still a bit uncomfortable. Great view from room on 8th floor. Easy walk to subway

title: Love the view!
text: My 2nd stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, they have a amazing staff! The view from my guest room was stunning direct of Empire State Building. Affordable rates for business, this my home away from home in the Lower East Side, thank you Wyndham!

title: Location
text: This hotel worked for us as a location near our son on Houston street. It's a vibrant area of New York. Lots of great restaurants in the area. We cold walk to see our new granddaughter.  Yada Yada yada.

title: Exemplary Service
text: I'm not the type to post reviews and in fact the last time I stayed at this hotel I didn't bother even though I had an enjoyable stay despite it being a business trip. Anyway, as luck would have it this time around they were having some AC issue. While the weather was not at its worst it still was a bit of a disappointment.  That is until the desk staff member explained the circumstances to me in such a professional and empathetic way, I literally was cool (no pun) with it.  They got me water, a fan and even a couple of drink tickets not to mention a discount under the circumstances. It's not about the items I was given but more about the follow up. I stayed for a couple of days but they continued to check in on me. The issue was finally resolved my last night but I just had to say thank you to Nadina, Jose, Gilbert and Shawn for their excellent service.

title: Uncomfortable Stay
text: I stayed here on business. This hotel was aesthetically beautiful on the exterior. The rooms looked very dated. Doesn't matter to me. The real issue was the lack of air conditioning. It just didn't work! I woke up the next morning soaking wet with sweat. My room had to have been about 90 degrees. The thermostat on the wall was shot. You could have cooked a Thanksgiving turkey in my room. Just a very poor experience.

title: Good value
text: A smaller hotel with limited amenities but all things considered, it's a nice place to stay. Service was excellent and staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and simple. Efficiency is a good way to describe its essence. For business travel it's a good value if you're willing to be independent and resourceful. I'd stay there again.

title: Nice short stay
text: Amazing view from our room on 16th floor. Room clean and comfortable, air condition loud. Breakfast in Ramen-Restaurant, american brekfast only. Not much contact with the staff, but were all friendly.

title: NO HVAC
text: Better be sure the air conditioning works before booking this reservation. Miserable stay. Had to have windows open the entire visit. Horns honking cant sleep. HOT!! Expensive room for no air conditioning.

title: We stayed on floor 15 room 1501 with incredible city views and wrap around balcony. 2 blocks from the subway station.
text: Excellent views of the city and wrap around balcony room 1501. Friendly staff, 2 blocks from the subway. Great location and great service. Room was stylish and clean. Great restaurant and roof top bar

title: Great experience at Wyndam Garden Chinatown
text: This hotel had all the aspects of my trip that made it a great experience. It was idealy located near to the metro station. Food was available on the compound. thestaf was extremely helpful and friendly. the room and the entire hotel  was clean and well mainted. i was pleasantly surprised especially since I did not know what to expect.

title: Best nyc hotel for the money
text: Good for the money. Good location for spring time. I've been to 4 hotels in NY...this has been the best i've stayed at. Though far from the best overall it is the best in its price range. Subway stations a block or 2 away.

title: Never Again
text: AC not working the first day and could not open the balcony door to get fresh air in. Front desk refused to call a taxi "they would not get their commission" was the excuse. Room key only worked half the time, I had to keep three cards so I could get in my room. No room service which was advertised. I could have stayed at much nicer hotel for less than I paid here. No need for me to stay here again.

title: Last stop on the road trip
text: We where welcomed by a nice and warm receptionist called Stacey. She came out and help with the baggage. Fast check in , nice room with a view at the Empire State build. Nice bathroom. All in all a pretty nice hotel.

title: EXCELLENT HÔTEL
text: excellent hôtel, propre et spacieux avec du personnel aimable et compétent. L'hôtel est idéalement placé près de Chinatown et des stations de métro. Le bar en rooftop et les restaurants du rez-de-chaussée sont un plus.

title: Great hotel in a convenient location
text:
After a 22-hour flight I was hoping I would not be disappointed with the Hotel as I didn't want to spend excessively on the hotels nearer Uptown. But I was pleasantly surprised that the place was pretty decent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Location was good as it was walking distance to the nearest subway and a few good restaurants around too. 

GSM Sean was very welcoming during check-in. I also had some parcels delivered to the hotel prior to my stay and I really appreciate the associates (including the person who replied to my Facebook msgs) for assisting and keeping my parcels safe. Housekeeper Kumarie also did an excellent job keep my room refreshed daily.

One minor thing was the toilets became very wet after a shower as the shower screen was not long enough to prevent splashes. Other than that, I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Thanks!

title: Back again
text: I'm imbarrased its taken me my second visit to this hotel to finaly write a review but better late than never I say. Well I was here back in February and had a great time despite this being a work trip. The people at the desk are always so warm and friendly, not at all the norm for New York. I couldn't visit a second time without praising these folks. Thank you.

title: Exceptional experience
text: Very friendly staff especially at the reception desk, willing to help at any situation. Rooms are perfectly clean, internet available at high speed, subway station is very near, overall a great value for money

title: Amazing Staff, Incredible manager, Awesome stay!
text: I stayed in this fabulous, zen, and fun hotel. The staff and manager are incredible and so warm. It was an incredible hotel. My boyfriend and I needed a one night get away. We were so zen!  Highly recommend!

title: What A Great Stay
text: My fiance and I picked this place as to make one last getaway before our wedding in June. It was really our last so called trip being single. We had the best time in New York City, the weather was great and the hotel was perfect. We took the near by train which pretty much took us everywhere we need to go. The hotel staff was very helpful with suggestions and we even ventured into Brooklyn which was amazing. We are  going to Greece for our honeymoon but I almost wish we could come back. I know where we will stay.

title: The best service in NYC
text:
I have stayed in this hotel more than a dozen times. I can't say enough great things about it. It is centrally located in the big Apple and is accessible to all types of public transportation, to name a few. First and foremost, I always get first class services here. The manager, Shawn , and others such as Ray and Jose to name a few, always greet me with courtesy and professionalism. The maintenance staff and the maids also know me well.
It is like a second home to me . It is no doubt a home away from home. The hotel is great for business travelers as well as all types of traveling purposes. The restaurant is terrific. The roof top lounge offers the best view of the city anyone can ask for. 
Not only is the staff able to anticipate my needs , they also address them at a rate at which I can't ask for more. Just to share an example. I am a coffee drinker. They are sensitive enough to know that. I never have to ask for more coffee. When I check into the room there they are. In fact I have no intention of staying at anywhere but this jewel when I am in town. Thankyou Wyndham.

title: Great stay, great location
text:
My wife booked this hotel because it’s located in the heart of Chinatown(near Little Italy)and close to several subway stations(only 2 blocks away), which is very convenient as we are going back to China with many luggages. There are several nice Chinese restaurants around—you shouldn’t miss them!

The room is not big but adequate. Sean helped us with a pre-check in; he is helpful and nice—he even prepares a translation app in case I don’t speak English. 

All in all, it’s a nice stay. Definitely will stay here again.

title: Downhill since our last visit!
text:
We are locals who needed a last minute hotel in the neighbourhood during a home renovation and this popped up on our Hotel Tonight app. Our parents had stayed at the same hotel about 6 or 7 years ago in a much nicer suite), and their room was quite nice and clean back then, so we went for it.

Pros: Every staff member was polite and helpful and came to the rescue when needed. Shinka, the ramen restaurant downstairs and the rooftop bar are both worth a visit. Shinka is a great spot even for us locals. The location is excellent, close to many great restaurants and  neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan.

Cons: We checked in at 9:30pm or so and went into our room. We couldn’t find the lights. Went back downstairs on the super slow elevators and the front desk member told us how to turn them on. Not intuitive at all. Why would you put a dark brown light switch plate on a brown wall that allows you to then turn on the switch to the lights that are in the middle of the room? 

The tiny hallway light barely lit up the entrance way, let alone the sleeping quarters where this secret switch is located. It wasn’t even a master switch because turning the switch off did not turn off all the other lights in the room when we were ready for bed.

While unpacking, I stepped on a mystery liquid in my socks on the dark brown carpet that turned my white socks yellow. The carpet between the two double beds had a big wet spot that clearly did not dry out even though we had the windows open for several hours while we went out.
