The smell permeating from the spot smelled like moss or mold or something growing underneath the carpet. We laid a towel over it just so we could get into bed since we wanted to take a shower and sleep after a long day.

The shower control was difficult to use. We are frequent world travelers and have stayed in hundreds of hotels, and we have never had to call someone up to show us how to work the shower. Not even in the Amazon rainforest! The front desk member I called agreed the showers are tricky in this hotel. There’s always a first for every traveler, I suppose.

The glass door of the shower is useless at keeping the water from getting all over the bathroom. Everything ends up wet after you shower. Again, the moldy smell emanated from the shower drain. Coincidentally, the shower wall abuts the beds...

My husband, usually with a high tolerance for this kind of stuff, suggested that we Uber home after our showers. He did not want to deal with any more issues for a room that we paid a pretty penny for. We checked in at around 9:30pm and he wanted to leave at midnight. That’s how bad it was.

We left the windows open all night even though the garbage trucks and police cars were loud on the street. However, the smell did not abate. We left in a hurry around 8am, informed the front desk of the problem, was promised that the manager would contact us when he or she arrived for work today, and it’s now almost midnight. I held this review in draft mode until the end of the day to give management a chance to rectify the situation before I posted. We will not be back and will not be recommending this hotel to families or friends in the near future.

title: Never again
text:
Inadequate air conditioning when it's only 65deg out. Room is light most of the night and of course worse first thing in the morning as the currents are not thick enough. The bathroom door is frosted glass, so since there is a window in the bathroom, that also lets in a ridiculous amount of light. The bathroom shower has only half glass, so the bathroom gets flooded.
I asked the front desk to have someone check the A/C as the temperature only went up from the time I first got into the room til about 3 hours later. I was told someone would fix it. Went out for a couple of hours. Upon return, front desk said it was fixed. She never actually confirmed it was fixed as no one had been in my room. Temp had gone up 3 more degrees while I was out. Perhaps check for accurate info before lying to guests.
Last day of 2, a strong smell of marijuana has been coming through the A/C vent. Mention it during the afternoon and again upon my return in the evening. Basically was told too bad we can't/won't do anything. 

NEVER AGAIN

title: Nice location
text: very close to a couple different subway stations. Very cool area if your not into the whole time square vibe. The room was small but adequate. The only major complaint was the shower. Only half a glass door so water goes all over when you shower.

title: Good vibes, easy to like
text: Just finished an art  show downtown, exhausted but satisfied. I stayed at a usual Wyndham using my points, they have the best reward program. The hotel was very chill and friendly. There was one person at the desk but they seemed to have a good handle on geetig everyone in and out of the hotel. I got a decent size room although I was so busy I couldn't realy enjoy it. I only managed to have breakfast which was just ok. I think what I liked the most was the staff, oh yeah and the convenience of location. I'll be back when we do our next show in October.

title: Incredible Views!!
text: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden in the lower east side a couple of weeks ago on a great online deal. We booked a high floor with the deal we got and our view was amazing. You could see the entire New York skyline. I've been to New York city plenty of times but have never had a view like this. The hotel even had a few food options although we only ventured to the Beer Garden. I would highly recommend it. Everyone was very friendly, thank you guys.

title: Excellent stay
text: Clean room with beautiful views and a rooftop bar. Staff friendly, and helpful. Close to subway and Little Italy. I continue writing even though i have nothing else to say because the program wants at least 200 words to submit my review, very annoying.

title: MY STAY AT THE WYNDHAM GARDEN IN CHINATOWN
text: nice place to stay I would recommend  this location as a destination for guests looking for a good, nice clean place to stay in the downtown area of New York City.  They even upgraded me into a nice suite, yes this is the place to be in NYC.

title: Great location Great staff
text: I chose this location because I was going to to BLS shows at the Bowery Ballroom. It’s perfect. The staff was wonderful and helpful. They let me check in early and check out late. I’m a Diamond. I have never stayed out of midtown before but I really liked this area. Hotel is not fancy but is perfectly serviceable and clean. My smoke alarm in room did not have a battery in it but several maintenance workers were working constantly at the property. Good choice.

title: Great location!
text: In the heart of China town, next to Little Italy. Subway close by; lots of dining options in the area. Was upgraded to a suite upon check-in. 24 Hour Fitness Center with good equipment. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Our Holiday in China Town
text:
We had a great time in China Town and that was also because we had a good hotel in a nice neighborhood. The hotel room was comfortable well equipped and we had a great view over Manhattan. One point for improvement was the big window in the bathroom which shared to much light when used at night.
The staff was friendly and the reaction on a daily internet survey super. The Japanese food in the hotel was delicious.

title: Short walk to heart of NY Chinatown
text: It is a studio and a bit small but was nice and clean. Bathroom was medium while sleeping quarters was a bit small. Not much closet space, half-hangar closet for coats. 12 floors allowed for quietness in the city. Walking distance to Chinatown, NY.

title: Family trip in NYC
text: Je recommande vivement cet hotel. Super accueil, très bien situé. Les chambres en étage ont une vue incroyable sur l'empire state building. On peut est a 5 minutes du quartier Nolita et a 10 minutes du pont de Brooklyn.

title: Trip to NYC 2019
text:
Overall the hotel is good - very conveniently located.
Only thing I noticed is the rooms feel smaller than in the past.
It seems like a large room was converted to two small rooms
However, the view was nice.
there wasn't much lights in the room, and it tended to be dark, except in the daytime because
if the drapes are open, the room is well lit.

title: Great Location
text: The hotel was well located, very clean, and the staff very friendly.  No fancy lobby.  Would stay there again.  Very easy to walk to China Town, Soho, Tribecca, East Village.  The only issue was not many taxicabs available in the area.  Great view from our room.  Has a roof top area.

title: lu
text:
很舒適的地方～有很美的夜景地點又方便曼哈頓上下城在這搭地鐵最方便,服務人員態度也很好,房間收拾得非常整齊每天都會幫忙打掃買東西吃東西也非常便利,是很推薦的一個飯店
總之，這是一次非常愉快的逗留，人們都很友好和細心。我從未向任何人求助過，我一定會再次住在這裏。交易划算很重要。
酒店的位置不錯，位於中國城的中心位置。我們喜歡這家酒店，從我們房間的往外看，可以看到極美的景色。溫德姆花園唐人街酒店很乾凈，工作人員也都很友好和樂於助人。酒店的屋頂酒吧景色優美，風景宜人。

title: Sups Great
text: Had an amazing time. The staff were super helpful and had a great sense of humor. Alas, wish we could have stayed for a longer period of time! Definitely recommend this location for couples wishing to travel to New York.

title: Excelente ubicacion!
text: Hicimos un pequeño viaje de escapada a la ciudad de Nueva York para un fin de semana de cuatro días y nos alojamos en el Wyndham en Chinatown. Esta es una excelente área a la que viajamos cuando visitamos la ciudad pero nunca nos hemos alojado tan al sur. El hotel era muy moderno, limpio y el servicio era excelente. Lo recomendaría y es mejor que muchos de los hoteles en los que nos hemos alojado que eran considerablemente más caros.

title: What a great place to stay Really convenient and wonderful staff.
text: This is the second time we stayed there.  They are 2 blocks form the B line, which seems to go---or connect to-- anywhere. each staff member was really helpful (especially Stacy). The rooms were quiet and well-appointed.  The beds were comfortable.  The only negative comment is that there is no provision for breakfast in the hoteL  --The neighborhood has only cihinese restaurants.  (But we found out after staying there that the bar in the rear of the hotel serves a VERY costly breakfast--$15 or more for a la carte) We will stay there again.   And again.

title: Very nice!
text: Booked another great deal on Hotel Tonight, stayed at the Wyndham on the lower east side. I had seen the hotel on Bowery before but had not tried it. The hotel looked relatively new, my room was a little smaller than I was used to but very clean. All in all it was a very nice stay, people were friendly and attentive. I never once had to prompt anyone for assistance, I would definitely stay here again. A good deal is key.

title: Back for More!
text: I had been salivating over the ramen and marrow soup I had on my last stay at the Wyndam and after two long months, I finally got to satisfy my craving. The ramen soup at Shinka is genius and I had another good stay, room was on a lower floor this time but still a great view. I really enjoy staying here, you guys are great.

title: Always a great experience
text: Another enjoyable stay at the WGC. It's in a bustling neighborhood and close enough to the lower East Side. Walking the Manhattan Bridge is also a worthwhile experience. The staff is always friendly and helpful, especially the crew at Rooftop 93. Parking is available around the block on Chrystie Street and there's a Dunkin Donuts nearby. No downside to this location!

title: Downtown Delight
text: We’ve stayed closer to Times Square several times but staying in Chinatown was much better. The room was a little larger, close to Metro, helpful, friendly staff. Comfortable, clean rooms. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Loved every minute!
text: We have just returned from a week's stay in this beautiful friendly hotel. Slap bang inbetween Chinatown and Brooklyn Bridge. The staff in this hotel can't do enough to help you and especially Jose on reception who gave use a room on the tenth floor with a great views of the city for our first visit. There's a rooftop bar that has a happy hour and great restaurant and bar. The room was spacious and clean with the most comfortable bed and pillows I've ever slept on, missing it already! It's location is an ideal place to walk to Little Italy, soho, Brooklyn bride, 9/11, pier 17, state Island ferry and many more! If you would rather go on the subway it's very near and easy to use. If you want to see real NYC stay in this hotel and explore downtown aswell as the more well visited attractions.

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for a week. Located in the centre of China town. Close to  several metro station .we loved this hotel .we were a bit disappointed with our room but  we asked to change to a higher floor which hotel staff arranged for the very next day as soon as a room was available.the view from our new room was amazing .the hotel is clean and the staff are all very helpful .rooftop bar is very nice with amazing views.i would reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting N.Y.. China town is a fascinating place and much better place to stay than times square where the majority of visitors stay.i will definetly be staying here again if I return to new york.

title: Beautiful Empire Building and upper Manhattan view
text: Very good location to the subway station and cheap eats at Chinatown. Nice, clean, modern hotel. Original we were staying at room 305 (cheapest room) but due to bar noise we asked o be moved to higher floor and the manager Sean Sy gave us room 1004 on the 10th floor and no more noise and we got gorgeous view of Empire State Building and upper Manhattan (Thanks Sean). The house keeping very honest. When we moved to the new room i left my Polo Shirt in the old room and the housekeeping returned to us.

title: Staff were very helpful, good room!
text:
Had a great experience at this hotel. View from 18th Floor Bar and rooftop was stunning. Our room faced One World Trade Center. Very nicely furnished and good mattress, shower handle stiff, but got used to it.

Front desk staff very cheerful and helpful. Jose went above and beyond and made sure we had a great experience by booking a reservation for us.Price was reasonable and neighborhood bustling. Easy access to the subway.

title: Nobody Does It Better Than Wyndham
text: I booked this Wyndham Garden downtown very last minute calling direct. I was placed on hold a couple of times initially but was well taken care of and even given a btter right than what I saw online. Hotel was busy but great, all the products I'm used to from Wyndham. Racked up a few points and got to eat in a couple of the outlets, Beer Garden and rooftop. Nice experience and one I hope to repeat next month when the weather is even nicer.

title: Depend on luck of service even for diamond member
text: Booked back to back week and the first experience was great, felt the welcome. But the current stay was so under welcome for a diamond member. Very big disappointment and let down. If it wasn't close to business location would of left already. Hoping the rest of the stay would be better.

title: Good location, spectacular view and nice people
text: Bathroom could have been cleaner but otherwise a very nice, if small, room. Nothing out of the ordinary as far as size goes in NY. Extremely friendly and responsive staff. Incredible view from 10th floor looking uptown... truly spectacular. We love the location smack in the middle of Chinatown and convenient to the Village, SOHO, Little Italy and downtown. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Amazing Staff, Amazing Experience!
text: Stacey was absolutely wonderful. I was there for my birthday, and she made the stay so pleasant. Even if the hotel was terrible I would still come back because of her! The entire hotel was gorgeous and the staff was great.

title: Whydham chinatown
text: Super hôtel très calme et très propre , dans un quartier formidable plein de vie , à proximité de tout les métros , super ballades à pied dans le sud de manathan , une mention spéciale très bien pour Nadine, Staci et Eulalia pour leur accueil et travail exceptionnel.  Un grand merci pour notre premier voyage à New York ,,,,,        Claude et Muriel Schintu

title: What great stay!
text: Jose greeted us when we arrived late and was pleasant and professional. He made the check in easy and welcoming. Cheers to Jose! The room was clean and comfortable. Couldn’t ask for more. Will definitely stay again. Thanks guys!

title: Value for your money
text: great location ..very well staff the room was very clean  great view of the skyline of the city. good restaurants in the area. check in and check out were very fast the bar on the roof is aowsem go and get a good drink and relax

title: Fabulous Attention to Detail - Great Hotel
text: Looking back at my stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown, only positive thoughts come to mind. Stayed at this property a night before departing on cruise from Manhattan Cruise Terminal. Check in was seamless and speedy. Friendly housekeepers in hallways. Room was very fresh, modern, clean, and well appointed. Appreciated the bottle of water in room as well as daylight savings time reminder on desk. Took advantage of the small snack shop in lobby as well as attached sports bar, very convenient. Location was very convenient for Uber/Lyft as well as Subway to Times Square for sightseeing. Room on fourth floor, but still had a nice view (and window opens - a huge plus!). Next time in NYC, will definitely keep this hotel on my short list and would want to check out the rooftop bar when it is warmer! Thanks for a great stay!

title: A wonderful night
text: Jose offered incredibly accomodating, generous service-- he was very kind and welcoming, and gave answers to all my questions. He picked out an above and beyong room for us, with an amazing view of the city through windows from the ceiling to the floor. I'm so thankful for this night- the bed was big and soft, the bathroom offered everything we needed and more, and it was all very chique and modern. I have no complaints.

title: Jose is the best!!
text: Came in for a night and Jose completely blew our minds not only was the overall presentation great but the room was amazing had the best view of the city!! We will definitely be coming back! If anyone comes to stay here try to get 10th floor and up and also try the rooftop bar

title: Hidden Gem in the middle of China Town
text: I had no idea this hotel existed so I didn't know what to expect when work sent me here.  The views are great and if you like chinese food the options are unlimited.  I also liked that there is a restaurant supply store a few blocks away so I was able to pick up a few things for home and a great price.  The hotel is clean and the service is top notch.  I recommend checking out the bar on the top floor as well.  I will be back.

title: Surprised... But in a good way
text:
I come to NYC fairly often but never really made time for Chinatown. Overall my stay was nice. Room was decent size. Closet size was so-so. TV was a little older and smaller than I'd prefer but still it was OK. 

Definitely good for the price I paid. Bathroom shower is one of those modernist revealing semi-opaque/frosted glass styles. So if sharing the room, get ready for a little intimacy lol. 

Best part of the property were its outlets (rooftop bar & restaurants). FYI weekend happy hour is a must. :)

title: Absolutely Amazing!!!!
text: We stayed here for one week on honeymoon and cannot fault the hotel in any way.  Great location with a tube only a few minutes walk away, very polite and helpful staff (esp Jose who checked us in).  Would not hesitate to stay here again.  Wonderful views from our bedroom :o)

title: Great Couples or Family Vacation
text:
My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past few years and have always enjoyed our stay. Our last trip was with three kids (which is not easy in nyc) but the staff was very accommodating in making sure our room was perfect.
  This trip was a special trip without our kids so we wanted everything to be perfect. I called in advance of coming with some questions about the room choices and things to do in the area. Jose was extremely helpful in providing recommendations for us. When we arrived a week after my call Jose happened to be the one checking us in and remembered my name and our special weekend. I am sure he speaks to a ton of customers so I was impressed by his service. Me being picky about room choices he was patient and worked to find us the perfect room. 
The rooms are all clean and well taken care of. Very little street noise which we experienced at other hotels and could not sleep. Our housekeeper was very personable and went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed. 
We love the location for convenience to soho, little Italy, Chinatown and the lower east side.  Plus the rates are always reasonable for the level of service and room.

title: 5 star service
text:
First of all thank you to Jose on the front desk. Jose was very welcoming when we arrived late in the evening after a long journey, he was very knowledgeable and kind during our stay, what an absolute gent! 

The room was beautiful and clean with a balcony view of manhattans skyline. The Wyndham is situated close to grand st. Station.

Will definitely be returning here!

title: Amazing hotel with the most helpful staff
text: Came from Ireland to stay here for 5 nights for my 21st birthday! From the minute we came in the door we were greeted by the receptionist Jose with a warm welcome! His service was outstanding and he was determined to make our stay as pleasant as possible! The hotel is clean spacious and the view from our balcony was outstanding! Waking up the view of the Empire State Building was amazing. The staff are very friendly which is a bonus. Only 5 minutes walk from the subway station to bring you right into the centre of NYC. Would definitely recommend to stay here!

title: A place to stay in Chinatown
text:
Helpful staff, clean rooms, location is everything. 

Cons: The elevator had issues during my stay and I can hear deafening metal screeching sound in my bedroom. Wasn't able to sleep for 2 nights of my 3 night stay.

title: Great location, excellent staff, in the heart of lower Manhattan
text: A great place to stay in lower Manhattan: just a few blocks from a multiple subway stops (Grand St., Canal St.) and within walking distance of everything from the Brooklyn Bridge to Astor Place. Over multiple stays the past several years, the helpful staff has bent over backwards to accomodate, including when our stay was extended in NYC for a couple extra days from a blizzard. Highly recommended!

title: Great!
text:
Jose was helpful and efficient... Just all around amazing! 
The hotel was lively, clean, and had great amenities. and in such an awesome area. 
Check in was fast and efficient.
I will definitely be returning!

title: Consistently Great
text: I've been booking at the Wyndham in Chinatown for every business/work/leisure trip I've taken to NY the past year. I've been to so many hotels in NY over the past decade that have some things good, but get one thing wrong - and this is the first hotel in which I've never been disappointed. The staff is AWESOME and caring and present - the rooms are immaculate, the beds high quality, and the views are superb. I almost feel I'm giving away a secret. The location, incredible. I always feel calm and like I'm heading to a safe haven after very long days of meetings and work events that leave very little time for myself. Between here and the Hotel Mulberry, I can't figure which is better - but the proximity of this hotel to SWEAT yoga and amazing food kind of makes it perfection. I'll never book anywhere else in NY.

title: Short but sweet
text: Had a short stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. It was my boyfriend’s birthday and I wanted to do something special, so they gave us a corner suite with incredible views of the city! Thank you to Stacy and Jose (front desk staff) for being so accommodating. The location is great and walking distance to a really cool downtown spots. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Room with a view!
text:
Located in Chinatown the hotels offers decent rooms: clean, large enough, nice bath. 
Staff was very friendly and all requests were taken care off immediately. 
Rooms on the upper floors offer a fantastic view!

title: thumbs up!
text:
I frequently travel to the lower eastside from Connecticut to take care of my mom and this time took a great deal at this Wyndham in Chinatown.
Clean, friendly staff, great little local restaurants!  different from many pretentious overpriced hotels in same area. 

my new home in NYC!

title: Great location
text:
We have stayed here 4 times so far. For the most part, our rooms were ok. We were upgraded once, which was very nice. This last stay, our room was extremely noisy due to the elevator. This won’t deter us from staying here again, we’ll just ask for a different floor next time. 
The  rooftop bar had a nice vibe with great views

title: Busted from deposits
text: The staff was wonderful. This was my last night in NY. Didn't realize hotels took big deposits so was broke. They took less of a deposit, helped me get to airport next morning, and referred me to restaurant in Little Italy. Owner gave me half off meal and 2 free beers. Wonderful in situation that could have been so streasful. Will definitely return.

title: Diamond in the rough.
text:
Wanted to try something different the the midtown/uptown circus and selected Wyndham Garden to be close to Chinatown, Little Italy,and East/West Village. We hit the jackpot !
The staff was beyond excellent. Jose and the girls at the desk and Eddie in the bar were superb. Best customer service in a very long time. We selected the Wyndham Garden to celebrate a special day for us. We will definetly be back.

title: Front Row View
text: What crazy luck we had staying at the Garden Chinatown. we booked this hotel on a good deal and ended up enjoying a frot row view of the chinese parade. the entire area was busy and so much fun. A great weekend and we didnt even have to travel far to enjoy ourselves.  The hotel was clean and comfortable.The staf was really great, very helpful.

title: Hidden Gem
text: I found a great last minute deal on Hotels Tonight for this hotel.  I only stayed one night as this was not planned but I was very pleasantly surprised.  The hotel was clean and it felt most imporatantly safe.  They provided some toiletries since this again was a last minute thing.  I didn't get a chance to try any of the food outlets but all in all it was a good short stay.

title: Convenient and clean
text: Was not disappointed with my over all stay but the restaurant within hotel was very pricey for small portions of foos, Drinks were well prepared but hotel rooms were very clean and hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Customer Service CHECK!
text: It's always nice when customer service is spot on.  I had some minor hickups with a package I was expecting and the actual room type I reserved.  The young lady at the desk that assisted me could not have been more helpful.  I unfortunately did not get her name but she went out of her way to assist me.  This would have been a different trip if it were not for her help.  My room was spotless and evryone I encountered was so nice.  Thank you, I hope to return soon.

title: Great place!
text: Lovely hotel in Chinatown. Greeted by the wonderful Stacey, lovely girl very polite and helpful. 10th floor room looked out onto Empire State Building which was just lovely. All of the staff on reception were so helpful and super friendly, even allowed us to keep our room on for an extra hour. Thanks for a great stay, would recommend.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Dix jours passés dans cet hôtel au coeur de Chinatown, tout confort et personnel très accueillant. Les chambres sont très propres et confortables. Rooftop vraiment sympa avec une superbe vue sur Manhattan

title: Great value
text: The staff checking us in and out were pleasant and so easy to deal with. We got a free room upgrade and the room was lovely with a great view! Did not get time to check out the rooftop but looking forward to it next time.

title: Nice corner big room provided
text: Nice corner big room providedWell service and bottle water providedThere is freze provided and comfortable sleepingJust only far from subwayNot that good for small elevatorAll are good providedThanks

title: Great location, service and rooftop bar with views
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights during our first time visit to NYC. We didn’t stay too much in the hotel as we were exploring NYC for which the location is absolutely perfect. It’s on the edge of the Chinatown one block from Little Italy and less than 5 mins walk to the nearest subway (Grand Street Station). We pretty much walked everywhere in the Lower Manhattan from here. It’s also in a great proximity to Brooklyn Bridge so you can simply walk straight from the hotel.

The rooms was clean with enough space. Even though it is on a corner of a very busy street and they were doing some reconstruction on the hotel building it was very quiet in the room. The service was excellent, really can’t complain about anything.

There is a great rooftop bar with nice views up to Empire State Building. Definitely recommend to come and check even if you don’t stay in this hotel. There is also some bar downstairs and if you are after a great food then there is Little Italy with many Italian restaurants or walk up to NOHO for other options (Tip for Australians if you are after a great coffee - there is an Australian cafe Two Hands on 164 Mott St).

How to get from and to airports:
We arrived at the Newark International Airport and with a shuttle bus (we were the last one the dropped off) it took 1,5 hours. That’s not great but it was a morning busy traffic so I assume that’s fairly normal. When we were leaving NYC we took subway to Jamaica Station and then AirTrain to the JFK Airport which took over an hour but it was much cheaper then the shuttle bus and no extra discomfort (no need to walk little bit from the Jamaica subway station to the AirTrain station, I would say around 5 mins walk.) We simply wanted to avoid the unpredictable traffic when using shuttle, cab or Uber so that’s mainly why we decided to use this option.

Summary
I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel for anyone who comes to visit and explore NYC. It’s in a great location, rooms are clean and service was great. Rooftop bar is an extra benefit.

title: A View Like No Other
text: With the holidays behind us, we decided to venture to NYC with all the bargain rates.  We booked the Wyndem Garden Chinatown and we really lucked out.  Had an amazing room and the staff couldnt have been more helpful.  We will be back..

title: great find in nyc
text: We visit our daughter often and hotels are so expensive in new york. Got a very good deal and found inexpensive parking lot a 2 min walk away. The room isn't fancy but not a bad size for NY , clean and a comfortable bed. Nice bathroom. There are only Chinese restaurants in the area so no where to grab breakfast except in the hotel. But not expensive. The Ramon in the hotel lobby was amazing.

title: Ideal para estar en pareja
text: Hotel muy bien situado,en una zona peculiar,con mucho ambiente,sitios para comer, salir y comprar.No se ve zona insegura.Transporte público cercano y posibilidad de ir andando al puente de Brooklyn.En las instalacciones tienen un restaurante con comida asiática y en la última planta un pequeño bar con vistas panorámicas y precios caros.El desayuno es caro,cerca del hotel hay muchos sitios para desayunar,sobre todo hacia el norte.Tuvimos varias habitaciones,unas en las primeras plantas, estaban en obras en el exterior y cuando llegaban los obreros a trabajar te despertaban,además de que tenías que cerrar las cortinas para que no te vieran.Las que tuvimos en las plantas superiores estaban mejor.Tamaño pequeño como todas las habitaciones de hotel en New York.Había cafetera,cama muy cómoda y limpia.El baño está en algunas habitaciones,separado de la habitación con un cristal templado enorme,con lo que te ven desde la habitación cuando te duchas y la puerta es igual y deja pasar todo los ruidos,con lo que no es apto si se comparte habitación con alguien sin confianza.Un poco sobrevalorado de precio pero el hotel está muy bien para ir en pareja.

title: Nice hotel
text: Spent 2 nights here while in town for a wedding. My room was very well equipped on the 10th floor with an amazing view. My only problem was that having arrived early in the city I couldn't check in till 3pm. Anything I needed during my stay was taken care of so I really have to say my stay was enjoyable.

title: Stunning views
text: Was fortunate enough to get a great room on the 16th floor thanks to the excellent management team. Floor to ceiling windows with awesome views. Comfortable room. Fun rooftop bar was hoping. Everything clean and new.

title: Nice hotel
text: Me and my wife stayed here for 5 nights from 23rd December staff very friendly and helpful we had a standard room which was nice and had standard facilities on 10th floor on corner which meant great views out of ceiling to floor windows including empire state building. Tv with plenty of channels a machine that makes coffee from pods or allows you to boil water for tea (not a kettle) each room has fridge which is handy for storing chilled drinks. I had read reviews in regards to the showers which are essentially wet rooms with half a glass window but we had no issues with waterlogging at all. They have on site bars and restaurants which we did not use. A shop behind reception sells soft drinks, snacks etc you can either pay for those in cash or put them on your room and settle it when you leave. Times square  and Rockefeller centre are both a short subway ride away. All in all was a pleasure to stay with you - cheers!

title: Profit above service
text: We arrived around noon and were told check in was at 3:00pm.  They had a room available but it would cost an additional $30 for early check in.  This is the first time I have been asked to pay at a hotel to check in early, What’s next ?? We decided to wait and allow the room to remain empty for 3 hours, while we walked outside in the rain.  Thank You Wyndham,  Happy Holidays

title: A bit better than average
text:
I stay here often for a midweek night to avoid 2 hours in the car.   It does the job.  Bed is comfortable, TV works (nice range of channels) and it's clean.   Bathrooms are anywhere from small to super small.  No mini bar, no snacks.  You get a bottle of Poland Spring, which is kind of nice.
Check in is usually smooth and quick.

I would like to give it 4 stars, but is not quite NYC very good, but it is fine.

title: Location is perfect!
text: Great hotel in the heart of China town. Location is perfect as meetings were close by and used the city trains to get to most areas of the city with eas. This was my second stay within a few weeks, clean rooms very good service. Look forward to coming back!

title: 5 Stars!!!
text: I absolutely LOVE this property!  Lindsay and Diane in Sales are a dream team!  I've hosted several events there and everything was perfect!  The hotel has several outlets, amazing staff and delectable food.  Have I mentioned the views yet?  No matter where you are in the hotel, floor to ceiling glass windows and unobstructed views at the outlets upstairs.  Do yourself a favor and give this amazing place a try!

title: Everything I needed plus a cool bar
text: Really enjoyed my stay. I had to be in this neighborhood for work and the hotel is only a few blocks away. Also east to get a can at any time of day. The rooms are clean, bed is comfortable, and staff is nice. Also the rooftop bar is a hidden gem. Very cool view and not too crowded. I’m guessing the locals don’t know about it. I will return.

title: NOT a 4 star! Disappointed!!!
text:
Those people working at the reception should do another job! Not helpful, no smile... 

Room to small for this price

Beds to small

Bathroom floor wet after the shower

We paid the last day 3,5$/luggage to leave our luggage at the hotel. NEVER seen of heard this in another hotel. Maybe they don’t want their customers back... not very smart! 

They asked 10$/night to have a room on a higher floor! We paid almost 1300$ fort 5 nights, is this bot enough??? 

This is certainly not a 4 star hotel!

title: Poor customer service
text:
It seemed ok at first....
Loved the location!
BUT: 
Reservation was lost, no housekeeping and room temps at 82 with the window open. Luckily the condo workers 10 feet outside that window woke us up at 7:00 so we could escape!

title: Seamless Stay in Manhattan
text: We had a great and easy stay at this hotel the weekend before Thanksgiving.  The room is small, but big enough.  Amazing views from our room on the 10th floor looking Uptown at the Empire State Building! Johan was super friendly and helpful during check-in and check-out.  This is a great location with tons of bars, shops, and restaurants within walking distance. Also,the bed was super comfortable! The shower was little weird as you just get water everywhere, but with fresh towels everyday it wasn't a problem.

title: Perfect hotel for me
text: I had hoped to book a Hilton in the area but couldn't find one for a decent rate.  I am a huge fan of the Little Italy area and thought I would give this property a try.  I'm not sure what more you could want from a hotel.  The rate was good, the property was very new and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful, particularly a maid named Kumane (she was outstanding!).  You are literally blocks away from the best dining in New York and you are in a clean and safe neighborhood.

title: Pernottamento
text:
Notte passata alla vigilia di un tour in partenza da Chrystie st. hotel pulito a prezzi bassi con Wi-Fi gratuito e buono. Nei pressi ci sono moltissimi ristoranti Italiani purtroppo in buona parte non più gestiti da Italiani.
L’hotel offre gratuitamente custodia bagagli per più giorni.

title: Large rooms, good amenities, excellent value
text: Just finished my second stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown, and had another excellent experience.  Although the room was not spacious, it was certainly larger than the standard tiny accommodations offered at most NYC hotels.  Solid amenities - including a fitness facility that actually offers a variety of equipment and free weights.  The location is not ideal for most NYC travelers (some walking to subway stations is required), but in all other respects this is an excellent value.  Note that this property frequently runs promotional offers on Travelzoo.

title: Great manager
text: Had some problems with check in and brought it to the attention of the general manager Christian he was very understanding and completely looked after us for the inconvenience,  hotel was spotless and the bed were so comfortable, thank you Christian

title: Great place to stay!
text: Our stay here was great! Finding the valet service was a little difficult at first. The place was clean which is always a plus. I do wish there was a balcony in our room. The room was extremely small but that is china town for you! Overall our stay here was great. The restaurants on the ground floor were both amazing! It is close to everything downtown Manhattan.

title: Decent first stay in NYC
text: Very nice and friendly place in an otherwise less desirable location in lower Manhattan. Very nice room, service and overall stay, with 2 restaurants for a bite to eat. My only issues were that the WIFI was VERY slow, the lifts were out of order and the small shop behind reception was abysmal at best. But overall it was a fairly decent stay (although it was my only stay so far in New York City).

title: Business trip
text: Great stay, very comfortable beds and pillows, Location is right in the middle of downtown within easy walking distance to lots of great places to eat dinner. The meeting rooms all had comfortable chairs.

title: Muy buen hotel!!!
text: Estuvimos 10 días en octubre y no tuvimos ningún problema. Excelente la atención, el servicio y el wifi. Televisión abierta y películas on demand ok. Tienen un restaurante que sirve el desayuno a buen precio, una terraza muy linda para ir a tomar algo. La vista de Manhattan insuperable. El barrio chino es un barrio como cualquier otro y todo está abierto hasta tarde. La estación de metro está a dos cuadras del hotel. Tienen máquina de hielo gratis en dos pisos. En fin 100% recomendable.

title: Probably gonna stay again
text: Great location and nice, clean place. The room was not big but bigger than we expected. In theory, our room had an access to a balcony. Unfortunately the door was supposed to be sealed during some renovation and a janitor came quickly to do so. That was very disappointing. There was a roof top terrace with awesome view and a bar downstairs. Overall we very much enjoyed of our stay.

title: Cannot Adjust Room Temperature
text: While there is a thermostat in the rooms, they are incapable of adjusting room temperature.  If your idea of a nice night is sweating at 75 degrees on top of your sheets, this is your place.  For those of us who enjoy cooler sleeps, I would strongly suggest an alternative hotel.  Tough to reconcile how this is a 4-Star hotel when room temperature cannot be regulated!

title: Nice visit to downtown
text: Room was clean, some issues with the thermostat, but otherwise fine. Christian was very helpful at the front desk. Kumarie was a wonderful housekeeper, and made me feel so welcome!  Will definitely return.

title: Déception...
text:
Arrivé à l hotel très tard, on nous annonce que l on n aura pas la chambre prévue le premier soir car trop de monde... le lendemain on nous change en effet on passe du 5 au 10 ème étage la vue est plus sympathique déjà..

title: Date Night Getaway
text: My wife and I just returned from a two-night stay in Chinatown. We booked the Wyndham Garden Chinatown on Wyndham Rewards points and couldn't have been happier with our lodging choice. We stayed in room 1102 on the 11th floor which is a corner room with views of both One World Trade and the Empire State Building. We knew the room would be small as most hotel rooms in NY but we were very pleased with the room. The floor to ceiling windows made the room feel bigger and the views were incredible. The bathroom was also newly updated and we slept great in the queen bed. We also took advantage of the rooftop bar and the beer garden on the main level. Both were great options to end the day and relax together with a good beer. This hotel is a great location with easy access to uptown and downtown trains. We walked to One World Trade and later took a train to Times Square. Also, the hotel staff was great and were quick to make dining recommendations and give transportation options.

title: “Short and Sweet”
text:
Stayed in an area of the city that is not all that familiar to me for a short one night business trip as my meeting was just a block away. Great location and very welcoming team, always greeting you and asking if they can assist. 

Highly recommend if you want a solid nyc hotel with high service standards and clean rooms!

Cheers!

title: Bellissima vista
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel prenotando un po' di fretta perché era attiva un'offerta imperdibile per il prezzo. Devo dire che l'ho trovato molto carino, vista dalla camera spettacolare (16° piano con panorama sulla bowery da un lato e sul Financial district dall'altro), pulito, tranquillo nonostante la confusione della strada. La zona è quella di Chinatown, con a 10 min più metro che permettono di muoversi agevolmente ed i quartieri di Soho e Nolita per colazioni o cene top!
In complesso lo consiglio caldamente!

title: Terrible. Carpet in room was soaking wet, promise to change room not kept and given double bed when booked a queen
text: I’m in my second night in a really bad room where the carpet is still soaking and the promise to change has not been kept as apparently they are fully booked. I was even down graded from the room I’d actually paid for because when I checked in last night at 9pm the room type i had booked were all taken. Both nights the lady at reception said there is no manager to take a complaint and i should raise the issue in morning which is hardly an option when I’m rushing out very early. I might have drawn the short straw given how busy they are and given other reviews but I’ve rarely had so bad a hotel experience in decades of business travel. Terrible.

title: Great Hotel.
text: What a great hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. Right in Chinatown and a short walk to Little Italy. They were having an Italian festival while we were here. Lots to see and do. Would definitely stay here again. First rate Motel.

title: The Best Views Ever From My Room
text:
I loved this hotel in the heart of the Bowery in Chinatown, near Little Italy and SoHo.
There is a beautiful park around the corner to relax. There are plenty of fantastic restaurants in Little Italy.  I ate at Da Nico's and Il Cortile, two of my very favorites.  From my 16th floor room, I could see Freedom Tower in one direction and the Empire State building in the other direction.  The room was spacious and modern. I liked the coffee maker in the room with tea packets and coffee packets included. The elevators were quick and there was a rooftop bar (indoors/outdoors) with DJ!  There is a cool outdoor restaurant/bar on the first level too!  Stacey at the front desk was very nice and provided me with an extra hour at check-out.  There are a lot of nightclubs in the area.  I took advantage of one of the area's many spas for an authentic Chinese foot massage which can heal your entire body.   If you like visiting the luxury fashion brands in SoHo, it is an easy walk. Versace, Dolce & Gabbana, and Louis Vuitton are all close by.  There was also a refrigerator in the room, so you can stop at a nearby deli and stock up on water and snacks if you choose.   I would definitely return to the Wyndham Garden Chinatown on a return visit!

title: Nice hotel in Chinatown
text:
The hotel is very nice and the rooms are comfy. 
It’s quite close to subway-stations. 
We had ordered a room with balcony, but were told when we got there, that the balconies were closed due to reconstruction. It would have been nice to know that in advance.

title: Location amazing
text: Me and my friend stayed here for 4 nights and I can not fault it at all ! Hotel is amazing friendly helpful staff and fabulous location ! We loved the rooftop bar and the beer garden bar /sports bar downstairs was a massive bonus ! We loved that the hotel was well within walking distance of Brooklyn bridge , one world observatory and the fact little Italy and China town was on the doorstep was a massive bonus ! The hotel itself was modern and very comfortable! Will def return ! And can we say a huge massive thankyou for the friendliest maid and most welcoming Kumarie hole I’ve spelt it correct ! She was a breathe of fresh air every morning! Please pass this on to her from the 2 English girls on the second floor with the bite !! 🤣x

title: Will visit again !!!
text:
Ok we had some issues during our stay. The upgrade I had arranged for my wife’s birthday was not available and the first staff we spoke to was miserable to say the least . The following day after being out all day we moved rooms and eventually was given the room
With our luggage in. Christian had bad day(think he needed bit of loving) but cheered up towards end of our stay(think he had loving). We spoke with Dianne and an apology was accepted by us. The night staff and the girl on reception when we checked out were  both fantastic. The hotel was spotless and I must admit the scaffolding did not make a great photo opportunity but the hotel roof top bar does. The location for two Brit’s was brilliant we walked and caught the trains everyday. The area is great for food and drink and we loved it. I have become a Wyndham reward member and we will
Stay here again because on the whole it’s a fantastic hotel and apart from the girl
Who checked us in and Christian when he is not getting loving the staff are fantastic!!

title: I guess it’s ok for a cheap hotel
text:
Thermostat lets you think you are turning it down but the temp never drops below 74. It seems the hotel has it set so that it won’t go any lower. 11pm the maintenance person had gone home early and the room is muggy. Hard to breathe. 

The entire hotel is out of bottled water. No stores nearby at 10pm. They didn’t get their delivery but it’s  very strange that they only had 3 cans of soda available for purchase. 

No creamer in the room although there is a coffee maker with tea and coffee. 

The staff was very nice. 
Unfortunately they weren’t able to help much. 

I’d rather just pay more and be able to actually sleep.

title: Great Location
text: Great Location to move around. 20 minutes walk to Brooklyn Bridge. Subway also nearby. Lots of Chinese restaurants nearby for delicious budget food. Got a great deal price through booking.com website.

title: Excellent hotel, would come back.
text: Great location, great staff, helpful folks, great views. Would come back again.  Highly recommend.  Stayed here for beloved daughter's wedding.  Close to my haircutter's salon, close to my beloved Chinatown.

title: Wedding 2018
text: We have just returned having spent 2 weeks here,we got married at the local city clerks office and this hotel was a 10 min walk from it thats why we opted for it,i read some bad reviews before we arrived but can honestly say we had a amazing stay,staff were fab even upgrading us to the 15th floor hence the view of the empire,they were always happy to help smiling and just overall nice people,the maid was lovely and our room was cleaned every day ...we would highly recommend this hotel guys,it has a fab roof top bar too,we hope to revisit in the future.

title: Clean, comfortable, secure
text:
I recently stayed here for a quick overnight business trip. I don’t have any complaints. I stayed in room 1005 which is on the 10th floor and directly in front of the elevator. I didn’t notice any excessive noise from the elevator. I had a nice view of the city but honestly, I don’t know what direction I was facing. 

On the 18th floor, there is a small bar with indoor and outdoor seating. The music is a little louder than it should be but the view is great. Drink prices are strap too. $13 for a mixed drink and $9.75 for a beer. Bar closes at 1am despite the front desk telling you midnight. 

Overall, it was nice and clean and if I come back, I would stay here again.

title: Perfect - for what I wanted
text: I booked this hotel for a few nights while waiting to move into a new apartment and it was great. The price was cheap, the location was great, the room was clean, and and the service was friendly. At a cheap rate I even had a better view then when I've stayed at nicer hotels (Hotel Indigo LES, Park Hyatt both gave terrible views unless you paid a fee). I was very was pleasantly surprised. That said - nothing about the facility is 4.5/5 star - but here you get more than what you pay for.

title: Excellent service Beautiful Views
text: When we arrived we were greeted with the fact that our room would not be ready for a few minutes and as a result they would be giving us an upgrade to a corner room higher up. It had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Could not be happier with the room and the service we received

title: Prima hotel!
text:
Hotel ligt in Chinatown. De kamer is schoon en wordt dagelijks schoongemaakt. Prima prijs kwaliteit verhouding. 
Ligging is vlakbij metrostation waardoor goed als uitvalsbasis voor sightseeing.
Behulpzaam personeel en mooi uitzicht vanaf de rooftopbar en kamer.

title: Vista spettacolare!
text: Non è la prima volta che soggiorniamo a NYC e abbiamo scelto di stare alcuni giorni a Chinatown. Il posto è strategico: tutta downtown è raggiungibile tranquillamente a piedi, da Soho alla West Broadway, dal Finantial district all'East Village. L'hotel ha camere discrete, nulla da eccepire. Ciò che più ha di spettacolare è la vista sulla città. Eravamo all'11mo piano e avevamo un'intera parete vetrata. Aria condizionata al giusto livello. Pulizia soddisfacente. Letto (queen size) comodo. Poco spazio per riporre gli effetti personali, nessun appoggio in bagno. Stupendo il rooftop tra il 18mo e il 19mo piano! Per la sua bellezza, però, è molto frequentato anche da esterni, dunque nel fine settimana risulta sovraffollato ed accessibile a fatica. Birreria all'ingresso dell'hotel, con discreti hamburger (per chi la sera non avesse voglia di andare in giro). Detto questo,  Chinatown, soprattutto in estate, è molto affollata e non emana soltanto profumi speziati. Può essere un impatto difficile per chi non è mai stato a Manhattan, una bella scoperta invece per chi ama NYC, la conosce e vuole viverne tutte le sue sfaccettature. A due isolati c'è Little Italy, nelle sere d'estate chiusa al traffico in Mulberry Street, molto frequentata. Una breve passeggiata e si arriva nella giovanissima Orchard Street. La Bowery, su cui sorge l'hotel, è una parte viva della città, sempre più giovane. Salendo verso Astor Place ci sono molti locali. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Great hotel in China town
text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, the girl at the front desk at check in was wonderful!  Our room was very nice with a great view of the city.  Would stay here again, so close to little Italy, and the subway!

title: Our GO-TO Hotel in the LES
text:
The WGC has become our go –to hotel in NYC, mostly due to the close proximity to the LES and the great staff. Never had a bad experience here and hope we never do. Some of the comments may be seem overly detailed but may help you get a better picture of the property:
Shower – plenty of hot water, great water pressure, tile area clean, at least 3 towels. Perfect. (No shower door so the floor gets wet...go figure.)
Room – average size for NYC although some (corner rooms) may be a bit bigger, always clean and modern décor. Small fridge without the pay-as-you go minibar. Heard nothing from other rooms.
WiFi - works well although you do have to keep entering the password when you leave the area and return. No biggie.
Entrance – quite busty and it’s hard to pull up out front, especially if you are coming south on Bowery or coming off of Canal Street. My advice is to park at T&K parking ($40) on Chrystie just around the corner and walk the half block or so to the front door.

Location – At the edge of Chinatown and 3 blocks to Little Italy, so it’s busy on the street and the sidewalks. Five minute walk to the Lower East Side.
Staff – A BIG 10 for the staff. Every single person we encountered was friendly and helpful. Servers were attentive, housekeeping friendly and the maintenance guys were polite. Front desk was always manned by a friendly and helpful person, no matter what time of day or night.
BAR – The Rooftop 93 bar is absolutely great. Wonderful views and well-made cocktails. This is a bar manager that TV's John Taffer (“Bar Rescue”) would be proud of!

TIP: My tip is to call the hotel directly to check on the best rates and availability, especially if you’re a repeat visitor.

NOTE: There is a major construction project going on to replace windows in the hotel (July 2018) but we were not interrupted in the least by the work. There is scaffolding around the building but it shouldn’t affect your stay.

The only downsides we found were: 
1). a lack of neighborhood restaurants that were not Chinese (snails? really???). But the food at the Bowery Beer Garden (connected to the hotel) was excellent (burgers!). We did not try the restaurant in the basement (Mr. Wu’s). It's a short walk to the LES and Little Italy where there are many options. 
2). The A/C was a pain in the butt and required a visit from the polite maintenance staff to get it cranking after 2 days. In all fairness, this was during the July heat wave, but that made it even harder to get comfortable. In the end it worked fine.

Bottom line, this is a well-run, well-managed, clean, affordable choice for your NYC visit.

title: Great service and great location
text: We chose this hotel specifically for its Chinatown location.  We were very happy with the location and service. Our room was a bit small, but they gave us a cot for our child and we were very comfortable. The location, restaurants in the hotel, and rooftop bar make this place a good value. Great service!!

title: outstanding stay
text: everything you expect from and outstanding hotel in the big apple, beautiful room, outstanding sports bar, excellent service and the price was right. The location for my needs were perfect. China town, Little Italy, the Brooklyn Bridge, Lower Manhattan, all within walking distance.

title: A\C wasn’t working!!!

We changed rooms and the same thing happened which means they controlled the A/C even though there was a thermostat in the room. Made it very uncomfortable for the money we paid.

title: 1st time at any Wyndham, good experience, right next to Chinatown and Little Italy
text:
Have never stayed at a Wyndham property before, but I got a rather slick deal so I opted to stay here for a single night while working downtown in NYC. Otherwise, I would normally opt for a Marriott properly.

I drove in and the hotel is easy to find using GPS. First thought upon finding the hotel is where is the valet? I read from other reviews that you could do valet (which I wasnt planning on doing) but I was really looking for a place to be safe to unload. Well you do it on the street; there is a sign that says loading area and its about the length of 3 cars in front of the hotel. The good thing is that if you are unloading, the front desk says you are okay to leave your car there for a bit ; you wont get ticketed or towed. What  didn't like about the front entrance is that its stairs only. If you have heavy luggage you are not going to have fun, and there are no special needs entrances that I could see. Then its just a revolving door to enter, so my thought is how limited the entrance is. 

So l grabbed our stuff, checked in, went to the room, yada yada, and came back to move the car. From other reviews I read about using the local parking garage a block over for cheap instead of the hotel $60 valet (didn't even see a valet person around). I already booked on spot hero for $25 overnight parking so dropped the car off and its 3 minute walk back to hotel. 

Since I never stayed at a Wyndham, I was surprised when they front desk upgraded us to a high corner room on the 10th floor (especially since I paid next to nothing from the room). Front desk staff was extremely friendly, and I saw this outside of the fact that they upgraded my room. Corner room has some nice view of the city; empire state building one way, world trade tower 1 the other. You are facing the street so you will get some noise obviously, but nothing too bad. 

I definitely enjoyed the size and layout of our small but cozy room (small in nyc is normal); great views from both sides of the room, and bathroom. The bathroom has a full window facing the street. Bathroom was modern, updated, and clean. I am not a fan of the European shower thing with just half a glass window, and water goes everywhere outside the shower, but the water heat and pressure were good. 

Bed and pillows were very comfortable, but only had a night stand on one side of the bed, so I had to put my phone (aka alarm clock) on the top of the bed post. 

Room had a nice sized desk, fridge, free bottle of poland spring water, standing upright closet (instead of built into the wall), LCD TV hanging from the ceiling, modern alarm clock with usb charger. I was definitely happy with the room itself, and my fiance slept like a champ. Couldn't test the hotel wireless; saw the network and its asked for a password, but I don't think it was included with out stay. I had great cell coverage anyway so not an issue.

Therein are my two annoyances with my stay: I found I could not sleep good because the AC duct is right over the bed, and the sound and way it blew over me made it difficult to sleep comfortably. This is ymmv as the layout will change be room but this was very frustrating as the point of a hotel is to get a good night's sleep. 

Second thing that frustrated me was the amount of light coming into the room in the morning. This is the result of the the bathroom that I initially really liked. It has a swinging glass door that is translucent. Its really nice looking, but even if you close the bathroom shade and the door, you are going to get a good amount of light coming into the room in the morning. So I blacked out the rest of the room, but the light from the bathroom is full force in the morning, and it makes the light in the room too bright.

Other points noting; there is a rooftop bar on 18th floor but can't comment on that. Also a bar/restaurant basically built into the hotel at the entrance. There are some other restaurants/bars in the hotel but didn't make it to any of them so cannot comment. 

You are however in Chinatown so a lot of good restaurants in walking distance. We walked about 3-4 blocks to Little Italy and had some of the best pizza ever around 11pm -- ahhh! Location of the hotel was spot on to make it there. 

Overall, hotel was average, and similar to a lower end Marriott I would normally stay at. I would stay here again if I was walking to the hotel and needed a quick overnight, but not if traveling with a car and luggage.

title: Great place to use your Wyndham Rewards Points
text: We stayed here for two nights in a room with a queen-size bed on the 11th floor with a view of the new Freedom Tower.The room was a decent size (for NYC hotel rooms) and had floor to ceiling windows. We had a drink in the rooftop lounge on the 17th floor; it was chilly so the outdoor section was not open. The views looking north to the Empire State Building were amazing. We also had dinner in one of the hotels's restaurants, the Shinka Ramen Bar, which was very good (and the pork rib appetizer was exceptional). We didn't feel like having breakfast at the hotel and the young woman at the reception desk recommended a good restaurant for breakfast a few blocks away (The Egg Store), which was also very good. Not a luxury hotel but still very nice; we had no complaints and will definitely stay here again using our Wyndham Rewards points.

title: Good location, ok rooms, overpriced and not a 4 star hotel
text:
The pros:
good location with an easy access to subway (B and D trains)
plenty of food options nearby
friendly house keeping staff. A special thanks to Kumarie. 
efficient and quick check-in and check-out

The cons:
My travel agent requested an upgrade on my behalf and they did not even mention it. I got one of the worst rooms with no view on the second floor
The room had a common balcony and there was no privacy because there were people wondering around, kids running and trying to enter my room via balcony door
It was a construction site with scaffolding and that was my view. Nobody actually works there
It was very chilly in my room and the balcony door did not close properly. I could not control the temperature and had to ask the reception to adjust it
The wallpaper had bubbles and a globe was missing in one of the lamps
Food in the bar was not delicious

Overall. it was a very mediocre hotel, probably, of a 3-star tourist standard, no concierge or a ramp for luggage. Not impressed but rather disappointed. For the price I paid (US$170) I felt ripped-off.

title: Sad to say that I wouldn't go back
text:
It was our first time staying at a Wyndham. We were not expecting much, just a decent room to stay in and that's what we got. So far so good.

If I don't book a Hilton I don't need a lot of service and don't care much for it, however I am sad to say the opposite of service was what we received. On the last day we wanted to check out at 10 (noon checkout available) and leave our bags behind until 1.30pm. The lady behind the counter wanted $3 per bag - odd and this wasn't charged when we arrived and left our bags until check in. As we had three bags the grand total was $9. I didn't want to kick up a fuss and just accepted it, reached for the wallet and pulled out a $20. The lady mentioned that she didn't have change and that was it. I expected her to get some from the bar in the foryer but nothing, she wanted to charge it to the card. As I had cash left and didn't want to exchange $20 I said $10 will do. The response was that she only had large bills. I think the charge in the first place is poor service and if a small arbitrary charge is raised that is uncommon and not mentioned anywhere, change should be on hand.

Beyond that throughout the stay, the staff was not visible or welcoming, just neutral.

The lift buttons and card reader didn't work - we stayed on the fifth floor and had to press the up button to get a lift to the lobby. Tough luck if someone on an above floor called the lift as well. You'll have to go up first. One of the two lifts didn't have a function card reader which meant anyone could go to the guest rooms. This happened multiple times when a questionably looking fella just strolled in and followed us to the room or didn't know where he was going.

While the room was good the soundproofing was not, we heard taxis and cars honking frequently. We were on the fifth floor.

Don't look out for signage at the entrance. It is a construction site with scaffolding, however nobody actually works there. If you have heavy luggage think again, there are some stairs at the entrance and no ramp etc.

The location is alright but then again, unless you're keen on a Chinatown and walking past smelly fish on the way to the train station this light be a bit of a negative.

The advertised rate on their website was $319 for the night, we got it for $120 - it wouldn't be worth much more than that.

title: Good rooms, good location, expensive and no recognition of loyalty status
text:
Wife and I chose this place for a staycation due to its proximity to Chinatown. 

First the pros:
- great location
- small but good rooms
- despite being carpeted, no funky smell - seems pretty well maintained

The cons are:
- relatively expensive for what you get
- no recognition of platinum status - why’d I bother being loyal? Asked for late checkout, no can do...
- gave us a low level room right by elevator - so not only did I not get any type of upgrade but probably got the least preferred of the room
- elevator call button didn’t work - had to press up to get it working. See photo
- front office service was ok - was fine but certainly did no sense of welcome
- rooftop bar which is a positive but also means their two elevators was often filled to the brim at nights

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: This hotel needs to know how AWESOME Emily at the front desk is.  She went above and beyond to make sure I had what I needed, including letting me borrow her personal iPhone charger twice. title: Hôtel bien situé
text:
L’hôtel en lui même est bien situé par contre dans le coin il y a que des restaurants chinois et pour le petit déjeuner ce n’est pas l’idéal ....
Très belle chambre avec vue sur Empire State Building magnifique une fois la nuit tombée !!
Chambre propre avec changement de serviette tous les jours 
Bonne literie 
Proche du métro et de Little Italy 
Chambre situé au 10 eme étage c’est parfait 
Au 18ème il y a un bar Rooftop

title: 新的飯店
text: 酒店位於唐人街交通方便近地鐵出口，步行唐人街十分方便。房間舒適，員工態度良好。我們參加了本地旅行團，而此酒店位置非常近集合地點，步行十分鐘內可抵達。新式裝修令人有很舒服感覺。對比唐人街內的酒店算是不錯啊

title: Comfortable stay
text:
We were given a room on one of the lower floors with a balcony which had scaffolding attached so no view at at all. The view from the rooftop bar is incredible though. 

The room was not tiny and was of adequate size and the bathroom the same. There was no noise problems and the bed very comfortable so had great sleep after a day of exploring. 

The receptionists were friendly and helpful whenever we asked any questions. you can buy snacks from the reception when the restaurant is closed too. 

the nearest subway station is just a few minutes walk with a line that stops at all the major tourist spots. 

We ate breakfast just once at the hotel but it was good.

We would stay here again.

title: Just a generic hotel but in a great location
text:
Do not have your hopes really high for this place. It is not meant for high-rollers or honeymooners.  We used our points with Wyndham rewards and had no high expectations. This is a generic chain hotel with fairly nice amenities and really good views, especially if you are on a higher level.
I have been to NYC over 100 times but have never explored this area of Chinatown and really liked it.
The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was good. The size was not tiny, especially by NYC standards but not large, either.
Customer service was good, nothing to complain about - welcoming and accommodating staff. We asked for a room away from construction and were given one on a high floor and away from construction.

title: Disgusting customer service!
text:
I booked through sky scanner, onto Otel.com and eventually got to this hotel. 

When we arrived at 9pm we checked in without issue but when we got to the room there was only one double bed, I was staying with my 21 year old son. (I'm a 45 year old man). I thought it would be a simple case of going back downstairs and getting an alternative room. When I booked I was asked how many room and for how many adults, I asked for 1 room for 2 adults but stipulated that I required separate beds. 

To cut a long story short the receptionist said that she couldn't help and that the special requests box is only acted upon if possible. 

During our discussion about the situation the phone rang on the desk, the receptionist ignored me and picked up the phone. At this point I decided that after all the travelling I'd walk away and chat to the manager in the morning. 

The reason why, even in these extreme circumstances, I couldn't share a double with my son is that he suffers from severe eczema and tosses and turns all night scratching himself so badly that he's in constant pain and doesn't sleep well at all. 

I had to sleep on the floor using the spare pillows and the runner off the bottom of the bed! 

In the morning I asked a reception for either a roll away bed, a camp bed or even an extra duvet to put on the floor, they couldn't even do that. The whole time they pointed out that it was my fault for booking the wrong room. 

I spent 3 nights on the floor despite asking morning and night for something, anything, better than sleeping on the floor with the bed decoration! 

This was my first visit to the states and as a serving British Army soldier I'd been told that US customer service was second to none. Sadly, nothing could be further from the truth, I couldn't even get a spare duvet!

Never again to this hotel or the booking agent Otel who have refused to even call me to discuss my complaint. 

I'm almost 100% sure that I wasn't given the opportunity to state twin beds before I got to the comments box but even if I did you'd think that the hotel would at least give me a spare duvet. 

Not happy.

title: Great location
text: Rooms were very nice , restaurant in hotel was great.  Since we drove the only glitch we had was drop off area to drop off luggage and leave car for long term parking the drop off area was full and had to drive around streets and come back to drop off area again.

title: Just average..
text:
The bad:  I'm just as puzzled on how the hotel has such high reviews.  The stay here was comparable to a nicer motel at best.  First off, the front desk messed up our reservation, which seems extremely common with this hotel.  We had 3 people in our group and had booked a room for a king size bed + queen size bed.  Instead they said that room was unavailable and had given us a smaller room with 2 queen beds.  Front desk staff failed to clearly explain why the room was unavailable.  However, after venting my dissatisfaction, an "upgrade" was offered.  We were given a larger suite with just a king bed, with an option for a roll out bed for the 3rd guest. Larger room was a plus, but 3 nights on their springy roll out bed is not recommended unless you're under the age of 10.

Not a full service hotel.  No concierge, no room service, front desk personnel is just okay, but not helpful.  Asked the front desk for an estimated taxi fare to JFK airport, and they didn't know and told me to just take an Uber.  Seriously?  Did not even offer to help when we were in the lobby clearly having trouble with our 4+ pieces of luggage at 5am.

The good:  Hotel location is great if you want to get away from the city.  It's situated in Chinatown and is easily accessible to the subway.  Lots of great affordable restaurants nearby, but bring cash.  Credit cards not accepted in a lot of places in Chinatown.

title: Puzzled??
text: For the life of me, I cannot understand the high reviews for this hotel.  I just returned from a five night stay at this hotel and was not impressed and I must say disappointed because we booked based on the reviews.  First of all, our room did have a nice view and we did enjoy the bar located at the top.  The view from the bar was amazing.  My son handled the booking and I really don’t know what happened but we ended up with a queen bed instead of two double beds.  Upon check-in, they would not switch the room for us, but were very accommodating by allowing the use of a rollaway bed for the mere cost of $30 a night.  (I’ve paid extra before for a rollaway but never $30 a night.) The room was extremely small to begin with and then throw a rollaway in.  Shower did not work very well at all for the first two days.  They had to install a new shower head.  Not once did they replace the toiletries in the room.  I accidentally spilled some soda on the comforter and they never bothered to replace it with a fresh one our entire stay.  Never did restock the coffee that was in the room the first day.  A couple of days we weren’t sure the room had been cleaned because the bed and rollaway were made very haphazardly.  Staff was nice enough at  check-in, but basically ignored us the rest of our stay.  Had a great time while visiting New York but was very disappointed in this hotel.

title: Hotel en chinatown
text: Hotel en Chinatown muy justito de todo, habitaciones muy pequeñas escasamente puedes dejar la maleta, si quieres habitación con mejor vista 50 dólares de suplemento, personal de recepción poco atento y con pocas soluciones.

title: NYC trip
text: Very nice stay.  The hotel is in an area of the city that is not as busy as other mid-town areas.

title: The big apple
text: This place was very clean and comforting. The view and location is perfect. It has a roof top bar with a view that is breath taking. It also has a club in the basement with very nice staff. 15min walk to brooklin bridge. I give this a 5 star

title: Nice clean, comfy hotel in good location. Nice rooftop bar.
text: Room was of decent size (for NYC); bed was comfortable. It had a working desk which was nice. The room faced Hester St. on the 3rd floor which was a little noisy (this is the reason I stay away from midtown) . Good location; 2 subway stations very close. Good area if you want a bite to eat as Chinatown and LES cheap eats all over. Nice rooftop bar. Room was clean. WiFi was OK, but not great. There are no doors on the shower and that can make for a cold bathroom at first. My only complaint - if you can call it that - is that the shower squeals at a certain temperature. Apparently, the room next door had the same problem. Love the 12:00 check--out time!

title: Location! View! Recommended
text: We stayed at this hotel 12/24 - 12/29 and it did not disappoint. It's located in Chinatown which is a really unique part of New York but it's also conveniently located where you can get to any part of NYC very easily. The room was small but I think that's too be expected in the city but we had such an amazing view! There is also a rooftop bar that's awesome and a couple of dining options on property as well. The only thing I did not like about our room was that the shower is akward; there isn't a door and so it's only half enclosed. The water didn't get as hot as I like so with the open concept I was pretty cold while showering but I would stay here again either way.

title: Nyc holiday December-January
text: The shower head only sticks to one side which is annoying, the tv channels are limited and your a subway away from Macy’s and your just down the road from little Italy. The room was very small for two people ( see previous photos) reception is very helpful and polite. The cleaners do a good job to maintain the room in a good condition. Outside is noisy with the workers under construction.

title: Προτείνεται
text: Οικονομικό σχετικά για Νέα Υόρκη, καθαρό, ευγενικό προσωπικό, διαθέτει βραστηρα, τσάι και καφέ. Ο λόγος που βάζω 4 αντί για 5 είναι ότι στο δωμάτιο είχε κρύο. Βέβαια είχε πολύ κρύο αυτές τις ημέρες, παρ' όλα αυτά δεν το δικαολογω και δεν το αποδέχομαι. Αν εξαιρέσουμε αυτό το γεγονός, το συνιστώ.

title: Good hotel, good location
text:
Lower east side location with good restaurant and nice rooftop bar.
Room was nice but as previous reviewers have stated the Heat-A/C unit does not set properly.
Was on lower floor so the street noise was a bit of an issue thru the night.
Ramen restaurant located inside hotel was very good. They also served a typical breakfast in the morning

title: Nice bed and location!
text: The hotel has a great location and price, the bed is comfortable, the view from the rooftop is amazing, I  do complain about the AC in room 310, I couldn't sleep because was too hot and we put in 70 and nothing change.  But overall is a good place to stay!

title: Hotel room was HUGE!
text: Biggest room I've ever stayed in while in NYC. The room got absurdly hot --both the AC and Heat on the termostat apparently pump out heat. Otherwise, spacious room, upgraded bathroom, mini fridge. Easy check-in and not too noisy of a neighborhood.

title: Interview
text: This hotel is great!  Very quiet and in a wonderful area.  A short walking distance to 911 Memorial and easy access to public transportation uptown.  The lights at night were so pretty.  I definitely recommend.

title: Great location!
text: Stayed 2 nights for quick NYC getaway. It was a perfect location for my husband and I. Easy subway access; numerous dining options that were all walkable; arrived early Friday morning and our room was ready. Even though we were on the 3rd floor, everything was quiet. Very clean rooms, hallways, front lobby. When we were leaving Sunday night, we stepped out of the hotel and a taxi pulled right up - how's that for service!!! Definitely would stay here again

title: Emily was delightful!  (and lovely) ((is it okay to say that nowadays?))
text:
first-- i will keep saying this - hotel manager: provide business cards for your staff!  no one really needs your card when we will never see or meet you.

Emily on the other hand was informative, professional, and a pleasure to deal with.  Hotels are hotels - people alone make the difference.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: Spent three nights with my brother over Thanksgiving weekend.  Great hotel, great location, great staff!!

title: Nice view
text: My room had a particularly nice view toward the Chrysler building. Particularly nice at night. The room was comfortable and quiet. The shower was small but managed to fit two. Only small negative...be sure to check the alarm clock. The staff does not ensure that it is off. I learned this by being awakened by it at 6 even though I only got to be at 5.

title: Back to testify
text: This hotel is quite comfortable and it is relatively accessible from both the freeway and the downtown federal courts. It does have ADA accessibility within elevator at street level. The interior elevators take a little getting used to. Folks are friendly and helpful and there are a number of close restaurants.

title: NYC Marathon
text: I booked this reservation for my brother for the NYC Marathon. All the front desk was very helpful. I called the night before the reservation and the night auditor was beyond helpful. He was very professional and me less stressed out about my brothers travels. My brother said the hotel was clean, and room was nice. Housekeeping kept the room very clean throughout his stay, which he was very thankful for after the marathon.

title: Really great location with easy access to public...
