text: Really great location with easy access to public transportation , subway and bus stops very closeby , the food in this area is fantastic , front desk was always friendly and very helpful

title: Good Value for the Money
text: With the restaurants, roof deck, workout room and more, there is a lot of value for the money.  New ramen place coming in looks promising.  View from the 18th floor bar is spectacular.  Bowery is busy and it’s not a warm a fuzzy location, but there is a lot in walking distance.  And Kamarie made it feel like home!

title: Great Location
text: Beautiful hotel  in Chinatown and close to Little Italy.  Floor to ceiling windows made the nighttime view fabulous.    Room was clean and very modern.  Definitely would stay again.

title: Great place! view is amazing
text: Went to New York for 3 days and stayed here for all three days and lemme tell you I'm pleased with the place. The view in the top of the place is amazing and their bar downstairs is always a lot of fun. There's a lot of people chilling there and it's just a cool place to hang out

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: Nice room, easy walking distance to Canal Street and multiple restaurants and shops, great service. I'd stay there again.

title: Clean and good value
text: Great price for a NY hotel. Comfortable for two people. Bathroom clean. Plenty of outlets and bed very comfortable. Nearby fun restaurants, shops, and easy to get to. Definitely wish more hotels were like this and stuck to the basics and did the basics well!

title: Nice, I like it but won't go back
text: Don't get me wrong, this is a nice hotel. Excellent location, modern, part of the Wyndham family of which I am a loyal rewards member and clean/safe. But, on a recent visit I checked out early and asked if my bag could be stored. I was told that it would cost $3.50. I balked and they waived the fee. But, what avarice. I paid almost $300 before fees and taxes and checked out early, giving plenty of time to ready the room for the next guest, and they tried to squeeze an extra $3.50 out of me for a courtesy for a loyal guest. SMH.

title: Amazing View
text: The view from the room is simply amazing. Excellent service from the time check in to checkout. Arrived early and was immediately accommodated. There's a valet parking which was very convenient. The hotel is conveniently located. Walk to Soho, Little Italy, and of course this is located in Chinatown.  Nice evening walk to the Brooklyn Bridge too which I had never done after all the years I have been coming to the city so that was a plus for me.  There's a rooftop lounge with a fantastic view of the city where you can enjoy a cocktail. Downstairs, there's a full service bar/restaurant.  I will definilty stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, family friendly
text:
I stayed with my family for vacation, the hotel is located near the Manhattan bridge in China town. The staff is very friendly and was very responsive for family with toddler needs. The room was clean and relatively spacious. The view from the rooftop bar is absolutely priceless.
Highly recommended

title: Un Hotel au trop& un personnel bienveillant
text:
Nous avons séjourné une semaine avec ma fille et je compte bien redeposer mes bagages la bas!!! J'appréhendais que ce ne soit trop loin en métro de toutes activités, mais absolument pas! L'hôtel est propre, le personnel a l'écoute et toujours la pour la satisfaction du client, les chambres spacieuses et confortables et le patron est d'un professionnalisme sans nom! J'étais dans un Hotel à Times square puis à celui la et il n'y a pas photo je préfère de loin celui la!!!! J'ai fais encore plus d'activités qu'à mon premier sejour l'an dernier. Ma fille était ravie... le départ a été dur. Je remercie vraiment tout le personnel pour sa bienveillance et son écoute durant notre sejour je vous le recommande vraiment. 
Omar vous êtes vraiment une personne merveilleuse... je vous souhaite une carrière à la hauteur de ce que vous méritez.

title: NIce Room, No Service
text: Room was clean, nice, plenty of outlets for devices.  Although they advertise that they have room service, when I called room service, the front desk attendant said she didn't know, then put me on hold for 10 minutes, after which tired of waiting. I called room service again for beverages, I was told that I would have to come downstairs to the bar to get it myself.  Also, they advertise room service food from Mr. Wu's restaurant downstairs, but it was not available.

title: Wedding visit
text:
I attended a wedding at the hotel and stayed one night.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.  The location was very convenient to all the other activities planned for that weekend.   I just am not a city girl and  
it was a very busy area for me to get around.

title: Bra och rent!
text:
Trevlig personal, rent rum. Bra dusch, skön säng och en väldigt fin utsikt. Ett väldigt bra hotell att bo på! 
Även trevligt att det ligger vägg i vägg med little italy där det finns många trevliga restauranger. Gångavstånd till allt!

title: Great location but a little iffy on the crowd
text: The location of this hotel is it's greatest asset. You can literally walk out and find food in seconds! If you like to eat in Chinatown/Little Italy, this location is great. The rooms were clean and very fairly spacious for NYC standards. They have a really cool restaurant/lounge on the first floor. And a cool rooftop lounge. Neither one did I actually check out as I was with my young daughter. The only thing that was off for me was that when I went to another floor to get ice, I noticed that there were signs posted which indicated to me that they house families here--there were signs about when breakfast was and policies about garbage, etc. I don't have an opinion about this one way or another, but I just thought people should be aware of that. And that the public will come in at night to use the elevator to get up to the rooftop. I did not feel unsafe at any point mind you. Again, thought this was relevant to let people know. I would stay here again. I come to NYC two-three times a year and you can't beat the location.

title: Nice hotel
text:
I live nearby the hotel and has also stayed at this hotel when my boyfriend visits. I've seen this hotel grow and become the hotel now. It started off as just a hotel with a restaurant downstairs with a lounge upstairs. They have now also made an outdoor beer garden with tons of tv for sports games. They have also started doing night events which I haven't been in but have seen a lot of people dressed up at night going in and out. There is also a great rooftop bar where you can just relax and hang out with friends.

The rooms are not huge, but you can't expect much from a hotel in NYC. It is spacious enough and clean. They provide necessities and free wifi. I also stayed in a room with  balcony once. The balcony connects with all the other rooms on the floor and can see into everyone's windows. The balcony itself is nice, but I was walking down and ended up seeing a man changing with his window curtains opened (awkward).. The staff is friendly and accommodating. You can leave your luggage there for the day after check out and pick it up any time before 9pm. They allowed me to have late check-out every time I stayed (about 3-4 times).

title: Unfriendly service. Not at all accommodating
text: Receptionists aren't accommodating. Their answers are blunt no-s without offering any form of solutions. I felt like I had to brighten their days. The room was clean and neat but I had a room facing bowery street with traffic noise. Convienient, close walk to metro line 6 but quite a walk to other subway lines. The area is fun to explore including lower part of soho and little italy and the given chinatown.

title: Long weekend
text: If you're looking for a hotel in China town area. This one is ideal. It's very close to everything. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Check in and out is easy. Keep in mind that since it's in the middle of China town, it's noisy and busy. If you plan to be on the go (like us), this hotel is for you.

title: A hotel with a clash of priorities - hotel or nightclub?
text:
We chose to stay at Wyndham Garden Chinatown for our New York leg of our trip to America, which was a 5 night stay. This is not our first visit to New York and we wanted something different to the tourist trap of Times Square. 

The area on first glance is ok but nothing special, Bowery is the edge of chinatown so you don't get the "watches, watches, bags bags" while on the road itself as soon as you're off the road the area leaves a lot to be desired and I would suggest only breathing through your mouth especially on a morning! There were discarded pigs legs, fish and rubbish strewn in the road right outside to hotel! There's a subway station a couple of minutes away though which is good. 

The hotel checked us in quickly and we went up to our room on the second floor. This floor has a balcony outside the glass door in the room which is shared with all other floors so you can't open your curtains as there's always someone strolling by! The door had some tape on the edge of it I assume this was to stop the draft coming in but it didn't work as it was freezing on a night on that side of the bed. The room is a good size and has a fridge, large tv and coffee making facilities. The bathroom is good too but the fact you can see others showering when in the bedroom is massively offputting - perfect for a peeping tom! The shower was hot and powerful but the fixings were loose and the shower tray rusting, the shower also makes a screaming noise when running which I'm sure our neighbours didn't appreciate at 6am (we were in room 204 if you want to look at fixing that). The housekeeper did a great job of keeping the place clean and tidy, the main problem I had is that whenever we were in the room we were getting bitten by something which was leaving large red lumps on our arms, legs and bodies, we never saw what was causing it but it was definitely only when in the room. 

The rooftop bar has amazing views BUT the music is too loud, like ridiculously so. So much that you genuinely can't hear the person sat next to you and it stopped us going up again after the second visit. The bar underneath is also very loud - I'm writing this draft while on night 4 of the 5 night stay and I genuinely cannot sleep due to the noise from downstairs and the noise from the road too, I'm dreading tomorrow as it's our last night and we need to be up at 3am for the airport. The lifts are also just full of people going up to floor 18 making it harder to get to your room. Also, we asked the receptionist where we could buy some water for the room and we're sent into the hotel shop where we got charged $4 for a small bottle. The Hong Kong supermarket over the road do a large bottle for under $2. 

In summary - I'm genuinely confused as to what this hotel is aiming itself at as it seems nice but the uncomfortably loud music and number of visitors who don't seem to be staying in the hotel are stopping us enjoying the hotel for what we booked it for - relaxing and sleeping. That, coupled with the bites from whatever is feasting on us mean that on our next visit to New York we wouldn't consider this hotel again which is a shame as it could offer guests so much more by way of being a hotel rather than a nightclub. 

It was difficult to choose between 2 and 3 out of 5 for this hotel but I went for 3 as the description of 'average' is about right for what is on offer as a hotel meant for sleeping in and relaxing in.

title: Fantastic location
text:
We have enjoyed 7 nights at Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Room 1604 had an amazing  view uptown so we never felt as though we were missing anything.
Room had everything we needed and bathroom great (with same view).
Staff all really helpful especially Emily at foh.
Hotel is minutes fron subway and we loved being so close to chinatown little italy soho nolita. An easy walk to Brooklyn and Manhatten bridges and ols seaport.
Subway gave us everywhere else in minutes with aircon! Photos all taken from 1604

title: decent stay
text:
Getting away form Times Square is a blessing. Decided to check out lower Manhattan this time. This hotel is decent. We all know NYC is terribly expensive, noisy, dirty and crowded. I wanted more cultural experiences rather than the time square/disney experience. Chinatown is perfect, steps from Little Italy and Soho. 

Arrival at the hotel was shaky. Was stuck in the elevator, because the button to 10th fl was stuck and had to go to 11th fl. and walk down. Rescued by a security guard. I avoided that elevator on the return.
Key didn’t always work for 1st, 2nd try in the other elevator either.

 
it's midnight and I'm hungry. NO room service but Highland Deli delivers. Got a burger and fries. Good flavor however, no salt or ketchup provided so everything was a dry, dry, dry. Make sure you request it if you order.

My room is good., nice view, small and clean(mostly) something weird on my sheets. NO counter space for my cosmetics in the bathroom, that’s a HUGE pain. Put some of my things on the toilet seat to get dressed. The mattress is encased and therefore bedbugs are not an issue.:-)

The closet is a problem too. it's a half closet and my clothes can’t hang without hitting the bottom and getting wrinkled. So I use the 
Bathroom hook. Why the bar is so low I don’t understand.  No dresser drawers either.

No tub in 1001, but good city view. The shower has a weird design, only half a glass and the water spills onto the floor under the sink after showering. So the floor is wet, not great while you are trying to get dressed.

Fridge works, but it’s not turned on, you must open the door and dial the number up before it gets cold..

Windows don’t open. Small rooftop lounge for drinks. Cosy restaurant below, but it was closed.

You have to pay $3.50/bag after you check out and want them to hold your bags☹  Also, 1st water in your room is free, then they charge $3.00/bottle afterwards.  Take a trip to the market across the street and stock up for .69/bottle

title: Nice little hotel
text: This is a nice little hotel on the edge of Chinatown and just blocks from Little Italy, the Manhattan Bridge and Tribeca. I found it to be decently situated within walking distance of several subway lines to get me where I wanted to go.

title: Great place
text: Modern, clean with great amenities including rooftop bar, beer garden and nightclub. Very cool especially for the  neighborhood. Short walk to Lower East Side, Little Italy and many subway lines makes it desirable even if you aren't there for Chinatown.

title: Convenient  and value
text: Convenient  and value basically sums up our stay at this Wyndham hotel.  The staff was courteous and the lobby was modern. The rooms and shower was tight but as expected in NYC.

title: Missing items
text: An otherwise very nice overnight in the city turned upside down when I realized I left a couple of dresses hanging in the hotel room closet after checking out and driving upstate. After calling the hotel to retrieve them on our drive back down, I was shocked to hear that they didn't have them. I guess those dresses pulled a disappearing act. Otherwise hotel was fine. Nothing exceptional. Busy corner, but good location. I just wouldn't expect this from a quality hotel with a good reputation like Wyndham.

title: Spettacolare!!!
text: Ottimo albergo, cortesi, stanze pulite, silenzioso e prezzi contenuti!! Comodo per raggiungere qualsiasi meta.....sempre se si ha voglia di camminare!!! Altrimenti le fermate di metro sono vicine. Posto nelle vicinanze di NoLita!!!

title: Charming Hotel
text: Staff were very helpful and pleasant. And the Location was terrific. I have a couple of criticisms about things which should have been repaired more quickly: Street elevator for luggage not repaired for week; Slow internet for a week. Nonetheless, hotel is very clean. Rooms are pretty and well designed. Good experience.

title: Great location and clean!!
text: The location is great and walking distance to Little Italy. I had a balcony view which was awesome! The room super clean and had all the amenities I needed (and they surprised me with a complimentary wine bottle...nice touch, thanks!). I would definitely stay here again!

title: Loved the location
text: We stayed here for 3 nights.  Little Italy is just a few blocks away. There were also several convenient subway options. Our rooms were very comfortable. The music coming from the brewery on the bottom floor is a bit loud at night, but overall the stay was great. The view from the 16th floor room was gorgeous!

title: Hôtel qui ne vaut que 2 étoiles pour nous
text:
Nous avons réservé une chambre pour 4 avec 2 lits doubles : il y avait qu’un seul lit vraiment double qui est queen size et le 2ème lit double  « small size » mesurant dans les 130cm de large( comme dans dans les mobilhomes moins de 3 étoiles). Mauvaise insonorisation de la chambre.
Chambre petite et inconfortable. Mobilier minimaliste : pas de chaises, pas de table ou de bureau, une toute petite penderie sans étagère. Les valises sont posées à même le sol, on pouvait à peine circuler. Rien pour accrocher les serviettes dans la salle de bain , ce qui oblige à changer de serviettes tous les jours puisque leur séchage est impossible. 
Douche à moitié fermée : salle de douche remplie d'eau après chaque douche
Bagages laissés une demie journée à la consigne payants !
Le roof top n’est pas accessible, il faut consommer, c’est un bar !
Seuls points positifs : chambre propre et bonne literie mais inconfortable pour le lit double « small size » pour 2 personnes! ça ne vaut certainement pas une 4 étoile. 
.

title: Another jewel in Manhattan
text: Usually when returning to my hometown, I stay uptown in Harlem because it's really home. I stayed here in Chinatown because as a Blasian (Black and Asian -- Chinese) I came for a conference of folks from the Chinese diaspora. I really love this hotel! A cool sidewalk bar/restaurant is really jamming! Oh! And the rooftop bar has the most spectacular views of NYC!

title: Perfect room
text:
The view from our room was incredible (empire state building). The same view was also seen from the bathroom, it was great.

The room was very clean, I liked the terrace and the bed was very comfortable.

Only bad points is to make your guest pay to store their luggage after they checked out. That is not acceptable when you know we already spend $$$$ for a room.

title: A Gem shining through in Chinatown!!
text: This little gem was situated in a great location in Chinatown, down the block from Little Italy and near subway stations. The rooms are very nice and comfortable and have wonderful views with their full length floor to ceilings! There is a lovely roof top with awesome views, restaurant, and bar. The staff is wonderful!!! Extremely helpful and pleasant. Not a bad walk to the Freedom tower either. I will definitely stay again.

title: Wouldn't Do It Twice
text: Started off good. My family and I were 3 hours early to check in time and I was able to get checked in which was great.  The hotel was not stroller or handicap accessible due to no ramps at entrance and an out of order elevator that would've taken us up to lobby at the entrance. Hotel seemed clean.....minus a roach sighting.  The view was pretty amazing as I could see the skyline of the city.  I only stayed there two days but would definitely not stay there again.  It wasn't worth the money I paid for the room.

title: TRIFECTA
text: Let's see that would be right price, right location and nice room. In New York it's hard to get that combination, but this place does. Quick check in, with wi fi password on room card cover. Room key access to your floor, nice security feature. Room size about 250 sq ft which is big  by NYC standards. Desk, sitting area, nice closet, and room is clean and well appointed.

title: Great in every respect
text: Wonderfu hotel in every aspect.  The view is Spectacular. Location is hard on the weight so close to little italy.  Our second stay. Can't wait. For the third.

title: Excellent location in Chinatown
text: One of three hotels I regularly stay at in Chinatown --- the room layout in the Wyndham is pretty nice, managing to get natural light into the bathroom and enough electrical outlets in the right places for a business traveler. Their rooms are the strongest part of the hotel offer --- everything else is average or perfunctory. The restaurant/bar at street-level is the source of too much noise (at night when I'm trying to sleep), and personally I'd get rid of it for something more civilized. So, if you go to bed early, get a room on a higher floor! Can't argue with location --- close to public transportation, lots of food options within a few blocks. Never had any issues with personal safety in this area, even at night.

title: Broken air conditioning ruined the stay
text: The hotel overall is fine.  There are some pluses, (floor to ceiling windows that provide a nice view, decent bar adjacent to hotel, fairly close to subway) but on my most recent stay (I've stayed here before) the air conditioning was not working.  It was 95 degrees in NYC and the only thing you want after walking around in that kind of heat is to come back to a cool room to rest.    It was awful - even the bedding was damp from the humidity.  The front desk clerk who came up to check it (not even maintenance - the front desk clerk!) said maybe it was because the blinds were open.  Um, it's midnight and the sun has been down for about 4 hours and the room is the size of a small closet, so I think if the temp in the room has gone UP since we arrived and set it at 68, it's probably not because the blinds were open.  Then he tried to tell us it takes a little time for it to cool down.  Like 8 hours??  No, not buying that.  I asked to be moved and he said they were sold out.  He offered a fan, which we accepted, however it did not do much to cool down the room.  So we were not able to sleep much, which is really what we were paying for.  On a separate issue, I asked at check in to change the credit card the room was booked under and the front desk clerk (same one from earlier) said he took care of it, but NOPE, he didn't.  Vanessa, the morning front desk clerk was fantastic in helping to clear that up, and provided us with a late checkout which was much appreciated.

title: A Gem in chinatown
text: A modern,well constructed hotel in an old place. Excellent location in chinatown and near little Italy.Rates are reasonable,service excellent.

title: Good hotel north of Canal St on Bowery
text: I stayed here for 2 nights prior to leaving for vacation from EWR and needed a quiet place to work with Wifi one of the days. I've stayed here before and got a great room which faced the bridges. This time, my room faced Bowery and was on the fourth floor so noise was a bit of a problem but otherwise decent, but small room. Kind of dark but the bed was comfortable and the maid service was accommodating to my request to clean the room at the end of the afternoon as I needed to finish computer work. Free WiFi worked fine. Elevators were a little slow as one was out of service. The hotel is 2 blocks from the nearest subway service and served my purpose well.

title: The slowest internet I've ever experienced, very noisy
text:
If you want to use any of your electronic devices while on vacation don't book here. This place has incredibly slow internet and no option to purchase a higher speed. It literally took five minutes to load websites. All reception had to say was that the speed decreases as more people join the network. No kidding. Common sense would tell you to invest in a better wireless system for your guests. In this day and age it's unfathomable that a hotel doesn't have reasonable internet service.

In addition, the hotel was very noisy, especially if you're on a lower floor. The rooms are very small. Overall you get what you pay for I guess.

title: Stayed summer 2016
text: Stayed last summer for4 night and it was a great stay. Room was on the 7th floor, which has a shared balcony that faces north and you can see the empire state building at night. Comfortable bed and the hotel was recently renovated. I always stay down in LES, Chinatown, Little Italy when visiting NYC and this was one of the better hotels I've stayed at in comparison to Comfort Inn Manhattan bridge, Best Western Bowery Hanbee and NobleDEN. The last being the best one of the four, but also the most expensive.

title: Perfect!
text:
The hotel was very clean.  Room was great & loved the view with floor to ceiling windows. AC was perfect, cool enough & adjusted quickly. Rooftop bar was so fun, small, but lively with awesome views.  
Hotel does charge to store your bags, as many hotels worldwide do.  It is customary to tip for each bag stored unless there is a charge. It is clearly stated, so there should be no surprises.  Great location in the heart of Chinatown and close to Little Italy. Also only 2 blocks to subway.  Staff was great too!

title: Perfect.
text: I am still shocked at the price i paid for this hotel. What a great deal in the heart of NY. This is the perfect location in the heart of chinatown with so many great places to eat within walking distance (katz deli, lombardis, and of course chinatown restaurants) the train is close as well.  The room was bigger then i expected for a NY hotel and super clean with a great view of the skyline. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again

title: Great Place to stay.
text:
I would be happy to recommend the Wyndham Garden to my family and friends.  The location is 
right in the middle of what I wanted to do in NYC, good food, good shopping and access to not only China but to little Italy. Rooms had a great view and had what I needed.

title: Location great, room mixed
text:
For this family trip, the hotel's location in Chinatown proved to be very convenient. Despite the glass and steel facade, the hotel's public spaces are functional and basic.

We can only comment on our room. Like the hotel, the room is functional and basic. The beds are just right; not too firm or soft, and the pillows are soft. But the room needs more chairs and the a/c vent and system need to be reevaluated. The bathroom is different than the rest of the room and fits in with the expectations that one has of a glass and steel building. But the bathroom needs more than one hanger and lacks towel rods/hangers. Despite the eco-friendly offer to let guests reuse towels, the hotel doesn't provide any means for guests to hang wet towels to dry out. Granted that given the size of the bathroom, it may be a design challenge but nevertheless, this needs consideration.

The room door warps in the door frame. When exiting and locking the door, this made engaging the lock mechanism difficult and required several attempts of pulling the door hard. On our last night, the lock seemed to be engaged but when I returned an hour later, I found the door unlocked and slightly open.

title: Nice hotel with rooftop bar
text:
I stayed here a number of years ago and enjoyed it.  I was therefore disappointed when I was given a room with a bathroom so small that I have to keep all my toiletries next to the bed.  The only other option was keeping my toothbrush on the toilet which seems pretty unhygienic. There was simply no shelf or area round the basin to put anything. 

The management were very responsive and moved my room the second day to a same category but with smaller bedroom and slightly bigger bathroom.  

The rooms themselves are nice, modern with floor to ceiling glass. I should mention that although quite good the curtains are not black-out which for some is important. On higher floors you have very nice city views.  However on lower floors and particularly the rooms overlooking Bowery noise is an issue. 

I didn't have ID so wasn't allowed to order a drink in the rooftop bar even though I am 50 this year!!  Maybe that's why it was empty? 

Location is good - 3 minute walk from the B/D lines and lots of Chinese and Italian restaurants close by.

title: Nice place and good locatuon
text: Rooms are clean and updated. Bed was great. Room Fairly good size for New York. Friendly service at check in. Plenty of things to do in the area with a great beer bar on first floor. Price is reasonable. Save 20 dollars on parking at hotel and use spot hero. Plenty parking in area for about 30 a day.

title: Agréable
text: Première fois à NYC et peut être pas la dernière. Nous avons choisi cet hôtel par l'intermédiaire des commentaires mais également des photos. L'extérieur est super et de nuit avec le rooftop allumé c'est encore plus sympa. Pour ce qui est de la chambre, nous n'avons pas eu la chance de nous retrouver en étage supérieur mais au premier étage. C'est à dire que nous étions juste au dessus du bar, mais nous avions le droit au balcon. Petite appréhension pour le bruit, mais au final nous n'avons pas été si dérangés que ça. La chambre était spacieuse et nous avons pu nous y étaler à loisir. Il n'y a pas de restaurant au pied du bâtiment, mais il suffit de parcourir quelques mètres dans les rues avoisinantes, pour trouver son bonheur et pas que des restaurants chinois !!!! Je conseil donc cette hôtel et faite abstraction du bruit, car venir à NYC pour rechercher le calme est illusoire ou alors il faut trouver un hôtel en dehors de Manhattan..... Ah oui, le rooftop à une jolie vue sur l'Empire State Building mais aussi sur les immeubles de Financial District et le bar du 18ème bénéficie également d'une très belle vue tout en étant protégé par des vitres.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: We stayed here just one night. We came earlier before check-in hour however we were offered to store are luggage. The room was clean and spacious. I liked the large windows with a great uptown and empire view (12th floor). It was little bit problematic for me to control the elevator.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: This is a brilliant hotel in a great location. Right in the middle of  Chinatown,  and a few blocks from Little Italy. Some great restaurants within 5 minutes walk.  The rooms are great. Comfortable beds, very clean. Great views of the Manhattan skyline. Would recommend a trip to the Skyline bar for happy hour drinks. If we came back to New York we would definitely stay here again.

title: Voor herhaling vatbaar!
text:
Wij sliepen op kamer 1505.
Deze was keurig netjes qua maat en qua verzorging met een keurig nette, lichte en ruime badkamer. Er was ook een föhn aanwezig en er werd voorzien in doucheschuim, shampoo en bodylotion. De bonus was een PRACHTIG uitzicht op de Empire State Building. Zowel vanuit bed als vanaf toilet ;-). Deze was tijdens ons verblijf ook nog eens in kleuren opgelicht vanwege Memorial Day.
Op de eerste avond echter was ik echt in de veronderstelling dat we nog om een andere kamer zouden gaan vragen. Het geluid van het verkeer, en dan met name het claxoneren, klonk alsof het in de hotelkamer zelf gebeurde.
Wat bleek: de balkondeur sloot bar slecht af.
Dit hebben we dagelijks opgelost door 'n dik stuk papier tussen het slot te schuiven. Dat scheelde aanzienlijk.
Verder waren de bedden heerlijk, met 2 kussens p.p. zodat je naar keuze kan gebruiken en was de douche (sterkte straal, douchekop, warmte water, regelen van temperatuur en kracht van de straal) perfect!
In de omgeving voldoende uitvalsbasis voor gebruik van de metro. Vlakbij Manhattan bridge. Midden in China Town en vlakbij Little Italy.
Wij zouden het zo weer doen!

title: Good Job
text: My stay was good, nothing to complained about maybe the shower door was a lil weird being only half covered

title: Clean, cheak and cheap
text:
the hotel was great...
comforting room are great, friendly staff, easy location. very kind and helpful staff help. modern decoration. comfortable beds thank you very much.
Small and urban hotel but very comfortable!

title: Perfectly nice hotel but noisy.
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on what was our second visit to NYC. We chose the China Town area as it was better located for the sights we wanted to visit on this occasion. We used booking.com and after some clever timing managed to get a superior Queen room at just over £100/night, which we thought was great value for a 4 star hotel in NY. The hotel itself was perfectly nice, we didn't have breakfast included do can't comment on that but reception staff were always available and although not overly friendly, perfectly polite and helpful.
The gym was basic but although I used it each morning I never shared it with anyone! Plenty of towels and cold water down there, also a daily paper on the counter.
There is a rooftop bar (one of our reasons for booking here) but we discovered it is NOT affiliated with the hotel and is actually quite a dump (see separate review). In my opinion Wyndham Garden would do well to completely disassociate themselves from it.
The hotel is located on a very busy crossroads and I was concerned before we arrived about noise. Our room had floor to ceiling glass looking out over the main road and was very noisy- that would be our main criticism. I don't know if any rooms were less noisy but on the 5th floor the traffic, sirens, horns and traffic cop whistles were irritating to say the least, preventing us from getting proper sleep. 
The room itself was furnished to a good standard with a comfortable bed, large TV and basic coffee making facilities. 
The bathroom lacked thought though. The shower screen was attractive but not sufficient to prevent the rest of the bathroom (including loo rolls) from getting soaked. There was nowhere to even hang a hand towel and not one shelf to put any toiletries on, meaning we had to nip in and out of the bedroom for everything.
Finally, the long gold curtains in the room would have been a lovely feature if they hadn't been desperately stained and in need of a good wash!

title: Great budget hotel!
text: We had a terrible experience with an AirBnB and this hotel was available in NYC and the location and staff were incredible! The top bar was awesome and had great scenic views of NYC. We went during the winter so the rooftop pool and bar were not open but would love to go back and see it. We absolutely love the food in the area and found that everything was very close such as food and entertainment. Our flights home ended up getting canceled and the front desk was able to take care of us and allowed us a discounted rate to get rebooked in so we did not need to find a new hotel in the crazy times!

title: Reasonable price and location
text: One of the two elevators were broken during my entire stay. And I stayed longer than a week. The espresso machine was also broken a couple of days. The breakfast was below par so I went out for breakfast. Other than that I was pleased. The small gym had what you need to stay in shape, the rooftop bar was trendy and well frequented. The cleaning was good and the noise from outside did not disturb me. A good choice if you're on a business trip, but don't come here for romance. Except if you're madly in love, because then everywhere is romantic.

title: Newer hotel, smaller rooms
text: Location was great, located right in the Chinatown and close to Little Italy and the public train station that'll bring you uptown. Many great restaurant near by and across the street from what use to be diamond district. The rooms are newer,clean but small compare to other nearby hotels. The beds are actually smaller then what one might be normal with, a double is the size of a twin, queen the size of a full.

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a room with a balcony on the 15th floor. Amazing view!!! Ok sized room, but it could use an upgrade, bigger bed and more storage space. I liked that room always were nice and clean, and you get fresh towels whenever you need it. The hotel has a good vibe, with a very nice rooftop bar, with also an incredible view. On the first floor you'll find a beer garden, with food and drinks. We really liked it there! The location is great, if you like the buzzing feel of chinatown! A lot of great restaurants in the area. Short walking distance to the subway, if you want to head uptown or downtown/Brooklyn. Overall a great hotel, but a little highly priced for that standard.

title: Great hotel in mediocre location
text:
We were looking for a hotel in the East Village area but accepted an expansion of the search area and ended up at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown.    
The property:  our room was clean, reasonable size for a NYC hotel and it did the job.   The heat was off for the season and we had a cold snap --- the staff brought in a space heater which solved the issue.  
The lobby is rather plain.  Now we were only looking for a place to crash at night so it wasn't that big of a deal but if you really want/need a vibrant lobby this place won't scratch that itch.  

Location:  Now in all fairness I did agree to the search expansion so that's on me .... but the neighborhood is a bit more on the run down side than I might've imagined.  On the other hand there is certainly the character of the many markets and bakeries and restaurants --- even a fish market.   

For the price it was a very reasonable deal.

title: Hmmm, interesting... baffled!!!
text:
I am truly baffled at the logic behind this nonsensical design.   Why on earth would you have only HALF A SHOWER DOOR? It just doesn't make sense.  It probably isn't because of a price thing, cheaper for just 1 shower door.  It has to be a design thing.  Let me tell you, DESIGN FAIL!!!! I sincerely hope they have good flood insurance because they will need it.  They are just begging for a huge flood to occur from within.  Aside from that, I enjoy a steamy, warm bathroom when I'm showering.  With just one shower door, that did not happen.  I was too concerened with that growing puddle water where there shouldn't be any to enjoy my shower.  Even with 3 folded bath towels used as bath mat, not enough.   It's ridiculous designs like this that I might have to start bringing along a shower curtain.
The room is cozy, comfortable enough. (I've been told that by NYC standards, the size of the room is "huge". (don't compare, you only setting yourself for disappointment)  When did compact become the new acceptable standard?  It's not asking too much that I can walk around in the room and not be doing that walking on the bed. Becareful to not hit your head on the ceiling while walking!) Okay, I went off on a tangent there. The room isn't that small, I promise. I was able to stretch out my arms on all sides of me and not hit walls. It really was cozy and comfortable.  It certainly was clean.  Loved the floor to ceiling window. Looking out to a rainy and busy Chinatown on a Saturday morning is an experience.  Couldn't figure out why there's a portion of the room that was wasted space.  Perhaps it's a structural support beam or wall.

title: Helpful staff, lovely room, great view, good deal
text: After much research, I found that Wyndham Garden Chinatown gave the best deal for the money and for a hotel in lower Manhattan. The room was lovely, with floor to ceiling windows and a view of the skyline, including the Empire State Building. Apparently the rooms with views cost a little more, but just a little and it was so worth it.  The bed was comfortable and there was a nice desk and fridge. The staff are very helpful and the room was clean.  The hotel is in Chinatown, with plenty of tasty and affordable restaurants nearby.  Subway stops, bus stops and cabs are all nearby. The New Museum is also nearby.   The Village, Soho, Little Italy and LES are all within easy walking distance.   I would definitely stay here again.

title: Primera visita a la Gran Manzana
text: Supero ampliamente las espectativas. La relacion precio/calidad es muy buena. La zona no es de lo mas pintoresco, pero la ubicación es estrategica. Me permitio acceder a los medios de tranporte, con poco caminar. Cerca de Little Italy y Soho. Mas que conforme

title: Three day stay
text:
This hotel is in a great location for visiting the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Century 21 etc, all are within easy walking distance and there are subway stations within east walking distance to access midtown NYC.
The hotel is very clean and the rooms are of a good size, we didn't eat here because there is so much choice close buy.  The only issue for me as a light sleeper is the traffic noise, which picks up about 5:30/6:00am, it is not too bad at night as by the time we were getting back to the hotel the traffic had eased off.
I would highly recommend this hotel for its location.

title: Quick Trip
text: My wife, and I made a quick trip to NYC to do some sightseeing. The hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. Great staff, clean room with a great view, and in walking distance to some great parts of the city. Would definately stay here again if I make it back to NYC.

title: surprise with the location and it is quiet
text: I didn't expect this hotel will impress me as it is located right in Chinatown.  The lobby is simple and the check-in agent is very nice and fast.  There are 3 different style of bar/lounge in this hotel.  There is a bar located outside the hotel lobby and one on lobby level. Another one with the beautiful view of NY are on the 17th/18th floor.  The 18th floor is open roof deck and you can bring your drink from 17th floor and sit there.  Although the room is small but it is very nice and clean.  The bed is comfortable and there is coffee machine provided.  There are tons of restaurants that you can choose from Chinatown.  Also the subway station is right on Canal Street and within walking distance.   If you like shopping, this hotel is not the right choice.  The business Center is located right on the lobby for the guest to use for free.  They also offer free wi-fi service.  Their check out time is 12 pm instead of 11am. You may leave your luggage for $3.50 per luggage after check out if you are not ready to go to airport yet.  Overall they provide all the needs and convenience.

title: Décevant
text:
Nous avons suivi les avis et demandé une chambre dans les étages élevés. Et nous avons bien fait!!! 12ème étage, et pourtant toujours bruyant, rue très très passante et camions dès 6h du matin. Les sirènes de police font elles parties du "charme" de Manhattan. 
Pour la chambre: petite mais confortable, propre mais une climatisation à revoir, bruyante, qui soufflait un air avec une magnifique odeur de.... cannabis ! Allez savoir comment c est possible! Même dans les communs! Pas d'ouverture de fenêtre possible donc assez suffoquant. 
Pour les communs: hall très petit,fauteuils vieux et inconfortables. 
Un bar indépendant de l'hôtel est au rez de chaussée. Il est quasi fermé jusqu'au jeudi puis nous avons été surpris de voir un videur à l'entrée de l'hôtel et une queue de jeunes jusque dans la rue pour rentrer dans le bar! Mais de notre chambre nous n'entendions pas la musique. 
Nous avons pris un soir un verre au 18ème, autre bar indépendant à l'hôtel. Jolie vue assez petit, cosy, nous avons demandé à aller au roof top au 19eme, on nous à transféré nos cocktails dans des gobelets en plastique.... et le roof top est composé de 6 canapés orientés nord-est avec un gros projecteur comme lumière. Des gens extérieurs à l'hôtel étaient totalement ivres mais ça c'était pas de chance pour nous. Biensur très belle vue sur l'empire state building! 
La situation est tout de même bien, à 10min de Soho mais en plein chinatown, pas de Resto  (autre que chinois!) ou bars à côté!
Ne vaut pas un 4 étoiles!

title: Bathroom lighting was poor
text: Bathroom needs better lighting.  Could not shave with the poor lighting in the bathroom of room 305.

title: Very Affordable Downtown Hotel
text: I would highly recommend this hotel if visiting the Chinatown area or the Financial District. The rooms were very clean and updated. Great views of the Manhattan skyline. And the staff was friendly and welcoming. The price was very affordable for Manhattan.

title: Best of New York
text: We have stayed in NYC multiple times but this hotel by far is the best for the price!  Clean, well appointed rooms.  Our suite was enormous by NY standards and there were plenty of great restaurants within walking distance.  If you love to sing...private karaoke rooms are directly across the street.  Will definitely be visiting this hotel again and again!

title: Excellent
text:
J y ai séjourné une semaine en couple et cet hotel est vraiment parfait ! Idéalement situé au Coeur de Chinatown et Little Italy facilement accessible par le métro je le recommande vivement.
Le petit déjeuner est tres bon et copieux (servi au restaurant à la carte )
Le personnel est agréable 
Le rooftop au 18ème est également très agréable 
Les chambres sont très confortables 
Je recommande cet établissement

title: Great views but awful reception service
text: the room was very good and clean. The views are fantastic. The rooftop was good as well. The reception service ok the other hand was really bad. They even charged us for keeping the luggage in the last day while we were out during the morning. I'll never comeback

title: a bargain and a great place
text: clean, professional service and very cozy, a different scale compare to many other choices that could be easily overpriced and unsatisfactory.

title: My absolute favorite budget hotel in New York
text: The hotel is beautiful and very clean, with one of the loveliest rooftop bars I've been to in New York (especially impressive because of its location, surrounded by much smaller tenement buildings that do not obstruct the view).  The neighborhood is very interesting at the edge of Chinatown and Little Italy, and just below SoHo.  Marvelous restaurants, the Grand Street subway station and a Whole Foods are a short walk away.

title: Great place
text:
My husband and I stayed here 2 nights for a getaway. Was very skeptical about staying in Chinatown but loved the hotel and location. Very clean and modern. Room was spacious and clean and very comfy. Bathroom clean and modern. Balcony was amazing touch to the vaca. Being able to walk out and look at the city and have a beautiful
 View of the Empire State Building. Perfect stay for the best price and close to everything! Only problem was the bathroom shower. I just didn't get the concept of an open shower that was littearly open. But other then that loved the hotel and would stay again.

title: Attractive, clean, economical but...
text:
Noisy!
Arrived on a Friday night and was given a room on the third floor facing Bowery street, partly hidden by a scaffolding. Monday morning , I was awakened quite early by the noises and talk of busy workers a few feet away. Asked for a more quiet room and was promptly and politely given a fair sized one on the same floor but not far from the elevators. My suitcases
 were conveniently moved for me. Staff was impeccably professional and attentive, the barman concocted an outstanding martini and Kumarie, the housekeeper always had a warm smile and welcoming attitude. I was disappointed though that so much sound came through the room from the passage way, doors closing, elevators and chatting kept invading my space.
Enjoyed several ot the cheaply priced but tasty Chinese eateries nearby. Walked 15 to 20 minutes to cinemas on Houston, bookstores near Union Square. Overall had a lovely time. Would come back.

title: Clean, nice hotel
text: This newer hotel is very reasonably priced and being close to downtown and the bridge makes travel to different neighborhoods (even Brooklyn)  super easy. Only complaint is the bar & restaurant are poorly run (if run at all no one seems to care) and in dire need of a visit from Jon Taffer of Bar Rescue.

title: Uncomfortable and unfriendly
text: Not our first stay in NYC and I took time and effort to find the right hotel for our stay. The location is ok, but the hotel poor. Unfriendly staff, particularly the bistro and bar staff, who were completely uninterested and basically rude. The only happy and approachable member of staff was the maid! Room was very small and freeeeeezzzzzing! So much so that maintenance had to seal the door and housekeeping placed blankets on the floor, (pic enclosed). NYC is an amazing place, but this bad experience has definitely affected our holiday.

title: Excellent
text:
Super accueil. Une bonne équipe à la disposition des clients. La vue de la chambre est à tomber. Les plus belles vues sont dans les derniers étages. (Au douxieme)
En remontant un Bloc vers le nord,on trouve de bons restaurants. Chambres propres et bien équipées

title: Once in your room it was quite good.
text: We choose this hotel for its location, reasonable price and Trip Advisor recommendations. Despite a very long wait (there was no one at the front desk upon our arrival), we were not disappointed. We would have preferred a room on a higher floor with a better view but otherwise the room was very comfortable, clean (Thank you Kumane!), quiet and everything worked well. Both Chinatown and Little Italy are within easy walking distance as is the wonderful Tenement Museum. One note of interest. The near see through glass wall between the bedroom and shower was an unique experience for us in 208.

title: Not my cup of tea! ROOM 207
text:
Stayed the 20th to the 24th February.  Clean hotel but the rooms are tiny, to the point wear you have to climb over suitcases to get to the bathroom.  We had second floor room looking at a brick wall.  The sliding doors to the outside leaked noise and the wind whistled through the night. I asked to move rooms as I had emailed them twice requesting a nice room (it was a surprise trip for my boyfriends 30th birthday)  I never got a reply. When I asked to move rooms I was told there would be a charge.  Having already paid for my room I wasn't prepared to pay anymore.   Shower is poor just spits the water out and floods the bathroom.

Lovely rooftop bar on the 18th floor with amazing views at night, opens at 5pm.  Even though we had been there all week we were asked for id on the last evening.  Bar food is nice (only ate on first night as we were too tired to go out).  Nice big portions.  

Nice friendly staff.

One other issue I have, I was asked to leave my debit card details, which I did as I thought this was standard procedure.  Only to find out from my bank yesterday they debited $40 from my account FOR NO REASON.  I will be contacting them when my statement comes trough.  The hotel was all paid for as a package through British Airways.  I should not have been charged anything.

Don't give your card details. 

In terms of location - I would stay downtown again.  Apart from the one day when we visited the 9/11 memorial, statue of liberty and Brooklyn Bridge we spent the rest of time around central park and times square.  So next time I will stay up that end.  Not many restaurants around china town, there is little Italy but as the name says it's all Italian.  which is fine for one night. 

All in all I wouldn't return to this hotel.

title: In the heart of china town
text:
Nice hotel 
Have stayed last 2 x in nyc 
This time I faced front of building and the view and sun was best 
Have never eaten here as there is dim sum and other awesome food nearby

title: Well Located, Reasonably Quiet Functional Hotel
text:
Room sizes are decent and the bed was comfy, the floor to ceiling windows are great. The hotel is very well situated in Chinatown in the Lower East Side, close to what little remains of Little Italy and the glorious Brooklyn Bridge. Several subway stops are close at hand. 

Customer service was typically brusque and indifferent, as seems to be the way in NYC, which, frankly, detracts from the many good aspects of this hotel. I ate breakfast here once, and it was overpriced and below average. Far better options are available a short distance away. Both bars were rather tepid and uninteresting. 

Given the paucity of options at this price range in NYC, I would definitely stay here again, but it would be nice if the staff could be a tad more warm and welcoming.

3.5 stars.

title: Nice large handicap room
text: We were on the 10th floor thinking that would be high enough to muffle the traffic sounds but we were wrong. Sounded like we were @ street level, very loud outside noises. Brought dollar store shower curtain liner that helped with keeping bathroom floor dry, worked well.  Duct tape helped hold it up.

title: Wyndham garden chinatown
text: Great location, very close to manhattan bridge. Hotel was clean, everyone was friendly and helpful, especially our housekeeper, kumarie. Our balcony Room was much nicer and bigger than usually found in manhattan. Roof top bar was cool as well. Would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Definitely recommend this hotel if you in love with Chinatown. Even this hotel is not "typical chinese hotel", the surroundings are amazing. 
Close to Metro, close to lovely restaurants (also near to Little Italy), lovely rooms with great view, perfect staff.

title: Surprisingly nice
text:
This hotel is in The Bowery which was synonymous with down and out when I was a kid. It's now a safe but messy neighborhood. And it's Manhattan where everything is ridiculously expensive.

I was delighted to find this attractive, clean hotel in the midst of all that. The rooms were a good size for New York. Some had spectacular views through large, modern windows. The lobby bar had tasty appetizers and excellent service. 

There is also a bar on the top floor. It's comfortable, spacious and has an expansive view of the city. We were disappointed to find they did not serve food or snack there. I'm sure that will get fixed soon.

title: Solid Base in Chinatown
text:
I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for three nights in February 2017. I was in town for a solo vacation.

What I Liked:
1. The location.  I wanted to stay in a part of the city that was not extremely touristy and this hotel is ideal if you want that type of experience or if you just specifically want to stay in the heart of Chinatown.
2. They really maximize the city views with floor to ceiling windows in the rooms.
3. The free WiFi in the rooms is easy to connect to and works great.
4. You are within 3-4 blocks of multiple subway stops.
5. The heat, bed, pillows, everything was on point and comfortable.

What I Didn't Like:
1. The bathroom.  I didn't like it so much I am knocking a whole star off the review because of it.  Despite being a very spacious bathroom, it is just not designed very well.  The huge walk in shower has no "traditional" shower head and just a handheld sprayer on a sort-of adjustable arm.  So you either need the sprayer always in one hand or have to somehow position it on that adjustable arm just so.  Plus the water pressure was lame.
Also, despite having plenty of room, there is literally no counter space in the bathroom at all.  Luckily my Dopp kit is in a hangable bag, but if I didn't have that I have no idea where I would have put my stuff.

The bathroom aside, I enjoyed the property and had a wonderful trip to the city.  I am not in the hotel room all that much when in NYC, so if the place is clean and the bed is comfy I am pretty easy to please.  I would stay here again.

title: Hidden Gem!
text:
Booked this hotel based on a Cyber Monday deal so this hotel was picked based on price instead of anything else. 

Location is in Chinatown, right next to Little Italy with the Grand Street metro station one block away. Very easy to get to. 

We were blown away by the views from our room. Room was a corner unit on the 16th floor with floor to ceiling windows. Had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from the luxury of our bed. And also a view of the Freedom Tower. Considering how little we paid for this hotel, the views were unexpected. 

The room is small, but the windows make it feel cozy rather than cramped. 

Bathroom was updated and clean. No complaints. 

Stayed here 2 nights. Aside from the room, didn't see or do anything else with the hotel. Breakfast isn't included so can't speak to the restaurant. 

Bottom line: we would definitely stay here again for those views!

title: Okay for the price
text:
Its a very nice hotel - for the price!!

Location was not our favorite - besides thousands of asian stores, there are no supermarket, delli, or similar store nearby. 

Room was nice, people at the reception seemed at times like they did not care about the customers. 

We had to pay 3 dollars per item, while they stored our luggage, the last day - never tried that before. 

They did not refill soap and shampoo - also, water for the coffee/tea maker was also not refilled. 

So we had to buy those things ourselves.

title: Bueno pero...
text:
En promedio es un buen hotel y recomendable para visitas a la gran manzana. Empezare con los pro:Ubicación muy cerca del metro y en una zona tranquila y segura, precio para Nueva York esta bien, el hotel es agradable en su decoración, en lso pisos altos tiene unas vistas preciosas de Manhattan, las habitaciones son pequeñas como es usual en Nueva York. 
Los contras: Dentro de las personas que atienden en recepción hay bastante diferencia en el trato, algunos amables, y otros que ni si quiera saludan. La reposición de amenities es muy pobre, con decir que hemos tenido que pedir jabón porque se había acabado...jamas me había pasado en un hotel. 
Sufrimos también algunos inconvenientes, como que no hubiera agua en los pisos altos, sin embargo al ir a reclamar la falta de agua nos cambiaron por una noche a un piso bajo, asi que solucionaron bien el problema.
Finamente sopesando pros y contras es un buen hotel y ganan los aspectos positivos.

title: Excellent hotel and view for the Price
text: I found an awesome deal through Travelzoo over Black Friday/Cyber Monday for just $79/night for this hotel, so I had relatively low expectations for that price.  But our room (1602) was a corner room with floor to ceiling windows wrapping around two sides of the room with an incredible, unobstructed view of the Empire State Building.  The room was very small, with a queen size bed, desk and bathroom, but it was sufficient for our needs.  And I thought it was very nice and a great deal for the price!

title: Great service. Convenient location. Clean. And staff very polite and knowledgeable. Happy with entire stay.
text: Right in the heart of Chinatown, and not far from 911 Memorial, this hotel and its staff were centrally located for where I wanted to go. And the staff was great. If you're looking for a great place to stay after experiencing the city, this is the place.

title: Chinatown
text: We love the location of this hotel, it is centrally located to everything. We stayed in room 1007 which was not facing Bowery. It was much quieter this time.

title: A mix of good and not so good
text:
The Good:
-Well priced for NYC, especially with the $99 Travelzoo special
-Modern hotel, still small NYC rooms, but well appointed, nice bathrooms, clean
-Nice lounge with a great view of the city on the 18th floor.  Outdoor roof area would be very nice in warm weather.
Not so Good:
-Located in Chinatown, not really near most NYC attractions.  Good subway access
-Nickeled and dimed us:  
     -Charged us an extra $20 for a room above the 6th floor.  Initial room we were        given had a glass door to a 2nd floor roof area.  My wife wasn't comfortable with the security.
    -Charged us $3 for a cup of hot water at breakfast. My wife had a cold and just wanted some hot water to drink.  
-Breakfast area was the dark lobby bar.  Not real enticing.  Food arrived on the cold side.

title: Why I won´t return to this very good hotel
text:
Rooms on the upper floors, with floor to ceiling windows, will give you a wonderful view of Manhattan, Brooklyn or both.
Great staff, relaxed, understanding yet accommodating.
Acceptable gym that allows you to have a full workout.
Coffee machine in rooms, which is convenient. 

Despite all the positives, and me being a returning guest, I won´t come back until management comes it senses.
At check-in I was informed that storage of would cost me USD 3.50 for each item.
It´s not about the money, of course, but about principles. What´s next up for additional charges!? Welcome to our hotel, sir. Would you like to have air in your room? Well, that´ll be an extra 10 dollars a night.
Though the staff handled my frustration beautifully, Wyndham Garden Chinatown has lost my business until management puts an end to this nonsense.

title: Value
text: I stayed in this hotel a few times. It's very functional, clean, good service and provide great value. If you're on business or just visiting, you likely not going to spend much time in the room anyhow, take this hotel and spend the change elsewhere!

title: Great location and views!
text: I had a great stay here! My room was bigger than I expected, I was never cold in the room, and the views of the city were great. I would definitely recommend staying here. I was skeptical because of some of the negative reviews but im very happy I chose to give it a try!

title: Great views great location!
text: The hotel is not fancy but it is clean and the rooms with a view are great!  Ask for a high floor with a view. We had a great time. Free wifi a mini fridge in the room. We'd love to stay there again soon

title: Functional & Affordable
text: We selected this hotel because of the location and price.  We were looking for something affordable because we needed 3 rooms for our group, and we wanted to be close to Brooklyn where we would be visiting family.  The hotel is not fancy, but does have a lobby lounge as well as a rooftop lounge and restaurant.  The rooms are small but well-laid out.  Outside noise was minimal, which is helpful when you are in New York.  It is right in the middle of Chinatown and about 2 blocks from Little Italy, so there are plenty of places to eat, as well as lots of markets with local flavor.  It is also about a 10 minute walk to Soho for great shopping and restaurants, and about a 5 minute walk to the nearest subway station.  One thing to be aware of - there is a frosted glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom.  When you are in the shower, you are literally right next to the bed on the other side of the glass.  So, this could be a little awkward depending on who you are traveling with.  Also, there is a half glass enclosure for the shower, so water tends to go all over the floor no matter how hard you try not to splash.  Overall, the hotel was functional and affordable.

title: Fresh and clean with a great street level bar
text:
Found this Chinatown gem via Hotwire. 

Rooms are nice and clean (high standard with US measures). 

Staff (front desk, bar and restaurant) are very friendly. 

Very ambitious beer assortment in the outdoor sports bar on ground level. 

They also serve great tacos! Highly recommended in the summertime.

title: No Hot Water For Four Days
text: I stayed at the Wyndham Garden from Dec 28 - Jan 2. Upon arrival, I discovered that I had no hot water. I reported this to the front desk that afternoon, twice again on Thursday, twice again on Friday and again on Saturday. Finally, after four days, they finally moved me to a new room. The Front Desk people were completely rude about the entire situation.

title: Amazing NYC view!
text: This hotel room has the best view of any NY hotel I've ever stayed in.  My room, which ends in 2, is a corner, with floor to ceiling windows in two directions, up to the Empire State Building, and east to the new World Trade Center complex. Ask for a high floor and a corner!  Room is compact but clean and well appointed. I has little interaction with staff but what I had was good. Located in Chinatown with Little Italy right down the street. Nearest subway station is about 2-3 blocks away, which is good.  The neighborhood is sparsely populated at night but feels safe enough if you are confident. Hard to find a late night bite nearby though, at least that was my experience midweek in winter. Overall this is a great option; I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Ονειρεμενο ταξιδι και ξενοδοχειο!
text:
Πρωτο ταξιδι στην ονειρικη Νεα Υορκη και το ξενοδοχειο που επιλεξαμε μας εξεπληξε ευχαριστα!!!
Περα απο την υπεροχη θεα, δωματιο 1207 ηταν πολυ κοντα σε σταθμο του μετρο.
Επισης το κρεβατι, στρωμα ακομα και τα λευκα ειδη ηταν ιδιαιτερα και οτι χρειαζομασταν μετα απο πολυωρο περπατημα για να ξεκουραστουμε!
Το συστηνω ανεπιφυλακτα κυριως για καποιους που δεν ειναι διατεθημενοι να πληρωσουν τα υπερβολικα ακριβα δωματια των ξενοδοχειων του Μανχαταν.

title: Great Experience
text: I am very thrilled that I got to enjoy this beautiful experience at this hotel. Employees were very helpful. My room was very clean, and comfortable. I was very satisfied with the morning breakfast but there are also good food places around the area such as little Italy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to explore New York City and its beauty.

title: Great proximity to Chinatown and Little Italy
text:
Great, quick overnight stay here. It was a 12-15 minute ride to/from the Manhattan Megabus stop and we checked in around 1 p.m. on Christmas Eve. We had no issues checking in early and the guy at the front desk upgraded us to a room with a view when he realized we booked a room without one. The lobby was nice and lobby bar looked nice, too. We booked a room with one queen and paid the $30 rollaway bed fee for my daughter. 

Although it was a small room, the room was very nice and comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows were wonderful and we loved the views. The bathroom was spacious and modern too. Although I didn't go, my husband told me there was a nice rooftop bar and they also have daily happy hour from 4-8 p.m. Pretty cool!

I liked how this hotel was within Chinatown and also close to Little Italy. I was very pleased with our stay here.

title: Awful hotel! Awful service! Nothing works!
text: Nothing worked, the air, the elevator the tv. I got a rollaway for one night was charged for 3. Impossible to get a hold of anybody. I don't know how this is a 4 star hotel, it was more like a motel.

title: Great location, conveniently located in NYC.
text: I'd like to say, the staff is friendly and helpful.  The location is very convenient.  Lot's of public transportation around the are all within walking distance.  I would like to thank the manager for following up with us after the stay.  He is very proactive and handled the situation quickly and effectively.

title: Comfy & Clean
text: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was nice, comfy, and clean. Smaller rooms and bathrooms but being in the city it should be expected. If you're lucky to get a room and Bowery you have a great big window as your 4th wall with great city views. Room service was quick and delicious. The 24hr snack room is perfect for late night cravings...but you will pay extra for the on-site convenience. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend others to stay here.

title: Great NYC Trip
text: Awesome staff and hotel! Very friendly and informative staff on all shifts. Rooms were clean and they go out of their way to help your stay be the best. Very accommodating to hold our luggage till we could check in after arriving early to start our day in NYC. Great location.

title: Great service and location in Chinatown
text: Excellent front desk staff & service. They allowed me to check in at 10am and shower. Even my room near the ice maker was quiet. Lobby bar has great inexpensive wines. Local food choices are great, such as Dimes Restaurant. Go for it. Terrific value.

title: Holiday
text: Stayed here over thanks giving hotel was spot on for what we needed. Staff were great food and drink reasonable especially daily happy hour. Fantastic views of Empire State Building. If you like to go for a few drinks on a night the hotel is perfectly placed for all the nightlife on lower east side where you will find plenty cheap bars in clusters def will return

title: Room was very cold and the heating was broken. Horrendous hotel experience, hotel staff did nothing to help.
text:
This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had, and I do not recommend for anyone to ever stay here. Our hotel room on the second floor was so cold it was hard to sleep, and the hotel staff were not helpful. 

I had turned the thermostat to the mid to high 70s, but this changed nothing. I called the front desk asking if there was anything they could do about how cold the room was, and the man came to our room, turned the thermostat temperature to 90 (the maximum) and said that was all he could do. The thermostat might as well have been a decoration on the wall because it simply did nothing. It did not work, and the room remained extremely cold. I called them again and said that the hotel heating system must be broken for this room as the thermostat does not work, and asked if I could be moved to a different room on a different floor. I was told that there were no other rooms available that night, and that there was nothing they could do. Frankly, I don't believe this, we were staying during a very quiet time and it's likely they had nicer rooms on higher floors available but simply refused to move us even though our room's heating was broken.

This supposedly 4-star hotel in New York city costing $200+ per night had a broken heating system and they did nothing about it, and they refused to even have us move rooms. I don't know how they can think this is remotely acceptable.

Personally, I will never stay at a Wyndham again. I had even called their customer support after the stay, and they never got back to me. For anyone reading this, you're much better off staying with SPG, IHG, Marriott, Hyatt or Hilton.

title: Gorgeous views from upper floors, nice/clean room, no atmosphere in lobby.
text:
The room was nicely appointed, modern, comfortable, and clean.
Views from a 16th floor corner room were gorgeous— could see so much of the city from there, and the Manhattan Bridge extends across the East River from Brooklyn Heights and to land in the neighborhood— you get to see that from an interesting angle.
The room was impossible to get warm, though.  Kept turning up the heat, but...
Lobby had zero atmosphere and seemed minimally staffed.  I wasn't looking to hang out there, so not a big deal.  Check-in was prompt and easy.

title: Good option near Soho
text:
We've stayed for 1 night (3 guests) in November. 
Pros: rooms were clean, with all basic amenities. The hotel is 10 min from soho, and right in chinatown, which provides the cultural experience of walking through the markets. 
Cons: staff was ok but there's room for improvement in friendliness and concern with the guests. Regarding the price i must say that NY is getting to be a very expensive and overpriced city, and although the 380$/night was probably the best tariff we could get in a good hotel, its really overpriced for the overall quality of the hotel... but its NY.... Another thing is that the hotel charges 3,5$/each piece for storing our luggage after check out. this service is free of charge in all hotels i have ever stayed.

title: Fantastic hotel, offers so much more than you think!
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights with my dad in July. We were with a group of people all staying at different hotels and I have to say I think we chose fantastically well. People had paid so much more for their hotels and we had more in our rooms than they did.

Very welcoming reception staff and the foyer area is beautifully clean.

Our room was an excellent size and we had two comfy twin beds. I loved the bedding it was so soft and comfortable, I slept so well here.

We had a coffee making machine in our room, something that other people didn't have in other hotels. The coffee was excellent and was most enjoyable first thing in the morning.

We had floor to ceiling windows and had views up towards the Empire State building.

What I loved most is you walked out of the hotel and you were smack bang in the middle of China town and there was so much going on, but it was great being around normal New Yorkers rather than in Times Square with the tourists.

So you can walk to the lower end of Broadway where all the shops are in 10 minutes, you can get to Little Italy in 5 minutes, you have at least 4 different subways  to hand, lots of coffee shops in Little Italy. Round the corner near Manhatten bridge is a dunkin donuts for anyone wanting a quick breakfast, also along Canal St there is a 7/11 which is good to get snacks.

There are so many restaurants nearby but we were on a schedule with family that we only ate at one of the Chinese restaurants nearby, I wish we had had more time to eat there again.

I would not chose another hotel as I felt this hotel offered all that you needed plus it was in an amazing location that would show a new visitor more than being in Times Square.

The hotel also have a fantastic roof top bar which we only visited once which i regret as the view was to die for!

title: You have to pay for luggage storage!!!
text:
Hotel is so so.
Location is good in the heart of Chinatown, not far from Nolita.
But hotel is the equivalent of a 3-star ratings.
I wouldn't recommend to pay more than 200$ a night for a double room.
Service is just ok, the minimum, no extra-mile.
Terrible characteristic: you have to pay a fee for luggage storage which is shocking. The poor reason we were given to explain this: "our storage room is small hence limited. We have to collect a fee".
I would't return to this place.

title: Hotel bien ubicado y renovado
text:
Lo mejor: la ubicación. Sales a la calle y ya te encuentras en Chinatown, a dos pasos de Little Italy y del SoHo - zona de restaurantes y tiendas.
El hotel ha sido recientemente renovado, su fachada destaca entre el resto de edificios de la zona y las habitaciones eran amplias y cómodas.
A destacar la limpieza.

title: No need to leave the hotel but why not?
text:
This is what you expect of a Wyndham property. Easy check in --maybe a wee bit longer than some if you want to be picky. Bed was comfy. Location was convenient and central in Chinatown near the B/D stop at Grand Street. Our room, 309, was conveniently across from the ice machine, and no, you did not hear it at all from the room. 

There was a good hotel bar but the view is much better on the roof bar. If you wanted to be outside, there was a 2 drink minimum though. And, no, you can't take drink back to your room unless you dumped it into a plastic cup. 

Major con was the flawed shower design. It was just a partial glass enclosure but it wasn't big enough so your rug was quite soaked with water.

title: Great place, great service
text: I stay here often.  Vanessa at the front desk greets you with a smile and is helpful and efficient.  Give her a raise and some flowers!  Love this place.

title: Great location but audible surroundings
text: Unfortunately my review will have more critiques than accolades. For those driving in (and leaving your car overnight) the valet drop-off is nearly non-existent during peak times - nothing is clearly marked; it's simply a parking spot on the corner of Bowery. Your car will then be driven to a satellite parking lot (my car was unscathed so no complaint there). The front desk upon my arrival was super helpful but I was surprised to see that she was the only staff (they could use more). The elevators during this time were pretty slow and reduced to only one operating - wait time matters when you're trying to get some rest. Thankfully there's a lot of good food and shopping within walking distance. The centrality of the location is great for convenience but not the best parameter for restful sleep. The showers in this place are kind of weird as they are separated by a half wall. There are great views of Manhattan available in the hotel's terrace bar. The bartender was kind enough to escort us to the empty deck on an overcast evening - do note that there was a two-drink minimum to access the patio area. By my valuation, the experience was overpriced but it was the right place to stay for a weekend getaway in Chinatown Manhattan. It beat having to coordinate with an airbnb host.

title: DOG FRIENDLY - Great location! Fabulous staff, fun vibrant neighborhood and good eats...
text:
Traveling with 2 small dogs passing through for a day, we managed to get good parking and visited the 911 memorial, quickly drove to the hotel, parked at a place around the corner for 40$ for 24 hours, walked with in minutes to the hotel, was quickly checked in within minutes. The room on the 11th floor was above the clamor in the streets, gave a great evening view and was a a beautiful room, clean, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable.  The bathroom was large and modern.

Quite simply, wonderful hotel, and if you are a Wyndham rewards customer you can use your points and get a FABULOUS room and great location at a killer price.

I would definitely stay in this hotel again and highly recommend it, and their restaurant which is an open air sports bar cafe which was also dog friendly, great staff, fantastic food.

One street behind was a large safe park to safely walk a dog who prefers less hustle and bustle than a city street, just please be kind and pick up after your dog!

Wyndham got this place bundled up perfectly, and it's nice to have a top of the line dog friendly hotel...

THANK YOU!

title: stay ruined by petty baggage fee!
text:
I guess this is an average overpriced NYC hotel. Roomes are small, some with nice view. Other than that its pretty boring and undertsaffed. Reception and bar staff totally uninterested in guests and service nominal. Room was clean and housekeeping staff very polite and nice. Hotel is brand new so in good standard. 
In any case my stay there was ruined by the check out. Having 6 hours before my flight I wanted to leave my luggage with the consierge. To my surprice they asked for $3.50 plus tax per bag (small or big). The discussion around this and frustration to this pettiness made me now want to come back. I cant understand how a hotel, that charged me $70 for a night, would want to ruin csutomer experience by adding $7 to hold my luggage. It was obvius that the staff was accustomed to guest being upset about this. They told me it was the first hote they had worked at that charged for holding luggage. To make matters worse, Wwen I came back to collect the luggage the reception area was deserted, my uggage was sitting unguarded in the little store in the reception. I could just grab it and leave wand nobody noticed. So basically anybody could have stolen the luggage.

title: Technical Glitch and Poor Follow up
text:
I recently stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel in Chinatown. While the location was great, the room was clean, and staff generally friendly, they had a major computer glitch where we had to be let into our room or wait for someone to be available to let us in.

I also inquired about a complimentary upgrade since we were staying four nights, and were positioned right across from the ice machine, which made noise throughout the day and night. For the first two days, I was told they were sold out and they couldn't move us for the first two nights.
