You can imagine how upset I was during the third night (Friday) when I asked how full they were, and the person letting us into our room casually replied, "Not too busy, we're not sold out tonight".

Since this computer glitch happened, into my second night there, another guest and I asked what the hotel would be doing to give us a discount for the inconvenience. We were told that they would straighten this out and by giving us a credit later. It's been 12 days since and my credit card was just charged, with no invoice or credit whatsoever for any part of my hotel stay. 

When I called and asked, they would not give me the name of a manager to talk with because they were overwhelmed with trying to fix the computer problem, and asked me, "Could you call back tomorrow?"

I asked that they call me back tomorrow and gave them my number. Then I was told that someone might call me back in a few days, they "could not guarantee that someone could call me back tomorrow." If this was the case, then why did he ask me to waste my time calling back, when he couldn't "guarantee me an answer?"

I pointed out that they went ahead and charged my credit card with no notice of what the charges were, even though I left my email address with them. I also pointed out that the dates were all wrong. At least he acknowledged the date problem on the invoice.

I would have rated them much higher if I had gotten some good pro-active customer service during the four times that I inquired about the problems.  Still waiting for this to be resolved.

I get that it wasn't the staff's problem with the technical glitch; however, after seeing them note down my name and being told that they have to deal with "hundreds of guests" that was not good customer service. I pointed out that I'm one of those guests and also deserve an answer.

title: Failing grade on HVAC hurts overall score
text: We stayed the weekend of Oct 22.  Left the room Saturday morning on a rainy, cloudy day with mid-50's temperature, and returned at 11:00 pm to our lower-floor room that was 78 degrees (I assume that if appliances were on and warm bodies were present during the day it would have been even warmer ).  The front desk told me that the hotel switched that day to heat for the winter season and they can't provide air conditioning as well.  Without operable a/c or windows, room comfort was sorely lacking. Perhaps in deep winter on sunless days when temperatures are freezing there will be no risk that a/c is required.  But if 78 degrees is your room temperature, then I recommend this hotel. Room is small but not especially so for small NY rooms.  Furniture, bed are new and comfortable.  Great lower east side location.

title: Love the location and staff!
text: This is the second time I have stayed here- both times the staff were great.  They are friendly, helpful and very informative.  The place is very contemporary with an Asian influence.  The rooftop bar has a great view and the rooms are nice.  As we were going to visit MOCA (Museum of Chinese in America- a must see) on Centre Street - this location was very convenient.

title: Даже не ожидала что отель будет настолько хороший
text: Интерьер отеля прекрасно удивил, панорамные окна выходящие на эмпаэр билдинг просто восторг, комнатка не большая зато очень уютная и красивая, все новое, что тоже обрадовало. Расположение отеля очень удобное

title: Nice hotel great value
text:
Nice hotel in Chinatown. Very nice staff, attentive even though they had to deal with key systems being on the fritz. Lovely bathrooms and very comfortable beds. Excellent views from floor to ceiling windows. 

Would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent Hotel and Staff
text: We have stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown four times, and will continue to come in the future. It is very modern and clean, conveniently located, and the staff is very attentive, friendly, and helpful.

title: Schöne Aussicht
text: Der Hotelempfang erinnert an eine Jugendherberge. Nach meiner Ankunft um 2 Uhr morgens musste ich erstmal 10 Minuten warten, bis sich jemand bemühte mich einzuchecken. Das Zimmer war sehr klein, aber für New Yorker Verhältnisse ausreichend. Alles war sauber und modern, aber immer noch im Herbergsstil. Die Aussicht auf die Skyline inkl. dem Empire State Building hat für das sehr unpersönliche Personal entschädigt. Frühstück? Lieber nicht im Hotel, sondern im 200m entfernten "two hands"!

title: BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK CITY!!!!!
text: The Wyndham Chinatown is the best place to stay in NYC. It's your home away from home. They have excellent customer service, and they do their best to make your stay a pleasurable experience. The hotel is clean. That sweet mist that greets you as you step in is so welcoming and refreshing. Thank you for everything

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: For 269.00 per night, this Wyndham was a pleasant surprise. I needed to stay near my daughter who was moving into the East Village. This hotel although, possessing an unremarkable lobby, had clean, modern rooms with an updated bathroom, white duvets and careful housekeeping. I've stayed in more expensive hotels who have offered less. They are undergoing some construction but are up front about it and the work does not start until 9:00am. Very easy to get a cab or uber from the front. I never had to wait more than 5 minutes.

title: Buen hotel en Chinatown
text: Hotel cuidado, confortable, limpio, con preciosas vistas del midtown de Manhattan en pisos altos. En pleno centro del animado Chinatown, cerca de metro y autobuses. El precio razonable para la calidad y en comparación a los de la ciudad. Las habitaciones son de tamaño normal, la cama excelente y hay café y te disponibles.

title: Still good, but slipping a bit
text: I've stayed here on four separate occasions and have enjoyed my stay every time. I absolutely love the location at the edge of Chinatown. It is very convenient to walk to a number of different subway lines from here and if you like Chinese food, well, you are in heaven. I'd much rather stay here than the tourist traps near Time Square or Central Park. That being said, the hotel is showing its age -- a bit. I found my room just a little more worn and dirty than on past visits. There was hair in my bed and the bathroom smelled musty. Both were minor issues -- really no big deal. There are many good places to eat around the hotel so I usually eat outside the property. The beds are comfortable, showers run hot and room temperature easy to control. You might want to bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The hotel is on a busy corner and noise from the street can be an issue if you are on a lower floor, though I can sleep through just about anything. I can't say the staff is terribly friendly, but they are not rude either. I'm still giving this hotel four stars and will stay again.

title: Great view and location
text:
I'm a Marriott guy but my wife and I needed to be very close to the MOCA (Museum of Chinese in America. I'm glad she booked it. We had a marvelous 15th-floor view with an extended balcony. Only a couple floors have this type of balcony. It actually extends the length of the building so you can actually pass other rooms if you so choose. We were happy enough basking in the view where we were (looking north towards the Empire State Building). We did go to the rooftop (19th floor) and saw a more panoramic view where we saw the new World Trade Center.

The service was excellent. The room was small but hey, this is NYC so that is expected. My wife was here a year earlier where she said she did not have the view nor was the room laid out well. This time, the room was laid out better according to my wife. For me, the room could have been laid out a little better. We had a queen size bed with a nice flat screen TV coming out of the wall. Because the room is small, it took me 3 tries before I remembered to lower my head when walking around the bed. If you are shorter than 5'6" you are safe! Everything is contemporary, clean and well done.

It's the unique neighborhoods that make this hotel stand out. It is very near to Manhattan Bridge for easy access by cab, Uber, etc. Chinatown is at your doorsteps with all the great restaurants. MOCA is also walking distant and so is Little Italy and Soho.

We noticed the heat did not work but I did not bother telling the front desk as I only wanted to quickly warm up the room a few degrees. The A/C had been on upon arrival making the room a little chilly. 

You will be paying NYC prices unless you get some kind of special.

title: Chinatown
text: First time stay at Wyndham Chinatown was a great experience!  Centrally located to little italy, soho, flatiron, financial district. Quiet rooms, clean, great views.

title: Good location
text: Good location with Grand St station around the corner and easy walking distance to Lower Manhattan, Little Italy. Great views on higher floors although the sky bar was expensive. Would stay here again.

title: Best!
text: Great view of the city and location. Very clean rooms. But most of all, the service was impeccable. All of the staff was very helpful with our crazy heavy luggage &  local accommodation for food and fancy cocktails. I will return for sure.

title: Surprise Find! This hotel is the best.
text:
Stunned by the price of hotels in New York City during the global UN Meetings when every country's President was in town, I searched for an alternative: an affordable room. I expected I'd be unhappy with whatever I found...but i knew it was the cost of staying in NYC this particular week. I found a room at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. 93 Bowery. Uh-Oh! I'd heard about washing up on the Bowery all of my life. I expected panhandlers and toothless drunks.
What I found instead was a lovely hotel with friendly staff, excellent views of midtown and quiet. True, believe it or not quiet. Amazing. I'll stay at this hotel again and again. Thanks Wyndham for providing this great alternative!
